review.title: We had a great time
review.reviewText: Restaurant / bar has good small plate selections.  The butter lettuce salad was the best.  Good comfortable stay with good view of bridge and nice location to walk from the ferry bldg up to the piers.

review.title: Great stay
review.reviewText: Hotel staff very accomindating. Rooms very clean. Available toilettes if you forget something. Great Resturant and bar inside. Great location right next to BART locations.

review.title: Too modernist for me
review.reviewText: The hotel was very nice and very expensive (72$ for 2 breakfast expensive ). I prefer a luxurious environment rather than a modern one. The room was average, not the kind that invites you to stay a little longer. The hotel staff was excellent and if you prefer modern over classic luxury, this is the hotel for you! There is a cable car and BART stop right outside the entrance which makes the hotel a great place to stay for getting around. One can get to and from the airport in about a half hour for 9$,  something we wish we would have known before taking a super shuttle to the hotel that took over 1and 1/2 hours and 2x the cost.

review.title: Great location, awful shower, don't use concierge
review.reviewText: Great location. Nice hotel. Better than most big hotels. Shower is made for midgets and concierge will send you to a tourist trap. If you don't use the concierge and get a regular shower (even in non handicap room) you're at a great place

review.title: Great location, great staff.
review.reviewText: Hotel was central to the city, staff were fantastic and a pleasure to interact with.

review.title: Close to attractions.
review.reviewText: Great hotel, food prices are extremely high, $28.95 for breakfast!
review.negativeRemarks: Lower food prices.

managementResponses.response: Thank you so much for your review. We appreciate your compliment! Look forward to welcoming you back in the near future!

review.title: The Hyatt Regency Hotel was near by everything
review.reviewText: I loved the stay. Staff was very friendly and was on top of things. Great customer service. The best was everthing was walking distance. I will definitely stay at the Hyatt Regency San Francisco.

managementResponses.response: Thank you so much for your review and compliment on our staff! Please come back and see us again soon!

review.title: Perfect location for exploring San Francisco
review.reviewText: Impressed with friendliness of all staff throughout the hotel. Very helpful. Concierge did a great job with baseball tickets for us. Breakfast buffet tops!!

review.title: Great location, interesting modern design
review.reviewText: Loved this hotel for its appearance, its views from the bay side, and its location which is ideal for the Embarcadero area and also for transport links to usual tourist destinations.
review.negativeRemarks: Staff seemed a little detached and our welcome was cool, in fact informing us 'your room is not ready' despite it being 5pm, an hour after check-in
review.locationRemarks: Embarcadero (walk along the waterfront) - the Market, directly opposite - street car nearby - BART nearby

review.title: Fantastic choice in Embarcadero in SF!
review.reviewText:
Beautiful lobby and clean, spacious rooms!

Rooms often have views- mine had a view of the street and a glimpse of the Bay bridge which is lovely at night and in the sunrise.

Hotel is clean, ultra-modern, and very nice.  

Also a reasonable value considering it's San Francisco.
review.positiveRemarks: Spacious rooms, with attention to detail.  Even came with a free water bottle in the room.
review.negativeRemarks: Almost nothing!  To be picky, the light switches are old and dated.
review.locationRemarks:
Right in the business district, but also close to Fisherman's Wharf if you are into touristy things.

The Mission, my favorite area, is nearby.

review.title: Well located, great common areas, but dated rooms.
review.reviewText: The white tile and white grout in the tub/shower probably was great when this was built, but now has mold growing along the bottom. Its expensive, but really well located on the trolley line and across from the piers.

review.title: Disappointed with Hyatt for the first time.
review.reviewText:
Unfortunately, our anniversary did not go as smooth as we wanted to go with Hyatt. We got a room that didn't look like one on Expedia pictures. The room was small, smelly (mold), outdated furniture, different layout. We requested a new room but were told all rooms are booked. Went to the front desk again and the room was available but on the 9th floor. We wanted on the higher floors. This room was much cleaner and as shown on Expedia picture.
The cleaning lady did a wonderful job and the room was very clean after the first night. She left 2 wine glasses and the plate on the floor in front of our door. That stayed on the floor until the third day when we checked out.
For this price in Hyatt we would expect better service. I guess we will try other than Hyatt hotel next time.
review.positiveRemarks: Location is very nice. Close to everything,
review.negativeRemarks: Service, nicer furniture and bedding.
review.locationRemarks:
5 minute walk to Ferry Building and Market Place. Metro access right at the Hyatt entrance.
Cable car right at Hyatt. 10 minutes walk to Chinatown

review.title: Wonderful hotel. Great location!
review.reviewText: We had a wonderful stay at this hotel. Very comfortable and clean rooms, staff were very helpful and friendly! Great proximity to many attractions, well within walking distance! Would definitely recommend to friends and family.
review.positiveRemarks: The proximity to the San Francisco Bay! The very friendly and helpful staff.

review.reviewText:
Everything was excellent .
The only thing that could be improved is the homeless people on the other side of the street by 7-11
When you look out you motel room window that's what you see.

review.title: Two nights in San Francisco
review.reviewText: The Hyatt is well located for tourist as well as business travelers. Great view.  If you like to walk not far to walk across the street to the Port of San Francisco. Up to Pier 33 for a cruise outdo Alcatraz. PIer 39 is just a little farther up,the way. The restaurant has great food and the price is reasonable for a nice dinner at the end of a long day. Very comfortable seating. The hotel itself is quiet. The room ms are spacious. Very comfortable. Bed. Bathroom was fine. Nothing wrong but a tub and toilet no wasted space. Nice dressing area. Large closet. If you like to have a tidy room plenty of room to put your things away. Internet was excellent wifi for a hotel way better than expected. Self parking is available but valet parking was wonderful. If you aren't from the area I highly suggest park your vehicle at hotel and take other transportation. Getting there is not difficult but parking is a problem in popular areas of the city. One of the cable car lines ends right at the hotel. Be sure to view the bay bridge at night. Great city to be a tourist. Staff very helpful with information. The type of service you would expect in this class of hotel. No problems in anyway.
review.positiveRemarks: Location, clean spacious room. High quality bed linens and towels.
review.negativeRemarks: We were well pleased with everything about this hotel. It is very large and has several entrances which is a bit confusing.
review.locationRemarks: Call cars. The ferries, tours to various places, Pier 39. Shopping along the various piers. Places to eat. Tour to Alcatraz. (Book,Alcatraez ahead)

review.title: Good
review.reviewText: It is a very nice hotel but they charge too much for parking. Also they have hidden charges once we got home they charge for something I didn't get.

review.title: Very cool hotel with good location.
review.reviewText: The staff and concierge were very helpful and nice. The design of this hotel is really neat and it is in a good location. Right across from food option and beautiful views of the bay bridge. Rooms were modern and provided plenty of towels and hygiene items. Would absolutely stay here again.

review.title: Excellent location
review.reviewText:
Stayed two nights in a bay view King room, it was an excellent experience .
Good location and good food options nearby

We got there only to find out our reservation had been cancelled in June. We were never notified of the cancellation,and had to scramble to find a hotel. This reservation was made in March when I purchased our day on the green concert tickets. We ended up paying twice the price.

review.title: Some good, some  not
review.reviewText:
On the plus side the location can't be beat.  Hotel is across the street from the Ferry building and has easy access to multiple forms of transportation.  The hotel staff were all pleasant and tried to be accommodating.
On the other hand the room was very small and lacking a dresser or any type of drawers at all.  We were staying 5 nights and there was absolutely no where to unpack.  My complaint to the front desk yielded 2 small baskets and extra hangers.  Not a comfortable way to settle in.
We chose to upgrade our room to a balcony with a view of the bay and although the balcony was nice the view from the room mostly consisted of the office building next door.  
After calling before the trip and asking at the front desk at check in if the room fridge had a freezer and being assured it did...it did not.  We travel with medical supplies that require a freezer.  They did accommodate us but it required parking a dormitory style fridge in the corner of the tiny room.
Lastly I happened to check my credit card status on line toward the end of the stay to find Hyatt had charged $550 to my card.  I was angry to learn they neglected to tell us they charge $75.00 per day "in case" you charge incidentals to the room.  The funds were refunded after we checked out but I thought it was bad business not to inform us of this at check in.  To give credit where it's due, by way of apology the manager credited us for 2 nights of room upgrade we had selected.
review.negativeRemarks: Overall it was clean with pleasant staff but all the minor annoyances added up to a negative experience.

review.title: Nice hotel during the week
review.reviewText: Nice hotel, walking distance to many sites but not ideal for the weekend
review.negativeRemarks: Confort of the room, more space for breakfast
review.locationRemarks: Many things to do but not a nice neighborhood during the weekend

review.title: Excellent accommodations and friendly staff
review.reviewText: Accommodations were wonderful - clean room and bath, very comfortable bed. After check out, we had to store our bags til the evening and hang out to catch a bus later. It was no problem for them.
review.locationRemarks: Close to transportation from the airport, the waterfront and walkable to many places.

review.title: Nice hotel near Embarcadero
review.reviewText: Had a great experience; clean, comfortable, quiet (despite the location). Excellent location! Would return.
review.positiveRemarks: Rooms were spacious and clean - staff very helpful. Was there for a conference downstairs.
review.locationRemarks: Near Embarcadero. Walking distance to all waterfront activities (Fisherman's Wharf, Exploratorium, Boat cruises, etc)

review.title: Nice location, close to many transportation
review.reviewText: Nice location, easy access to many public transportation, TRAM, cable car, Ferry.
review.positiveRemarks: View, architecture, cleaniness, free Wi-Fi, although not include in the room rate, the breakfast restaurant offer a nice variety.
review.negativeRemarks:
Everything is great but if I have to be picky.The hotel policy has a check-in @ 4h00 PM.
We arrived @ 2h30 PM and we had to wait for our room. Minor.
review.locationRemarks:
Easy access to all the Piers, public transportation, Exploratorium, Pier 39, Alcatraz Landing
This hotel doesn't have a view of the Golden Gate

review.title: A concrete jungle, with dated rooms.
review.reviewText: Upon arrival the desk clerk kept insisting on us providing a credit card, even though we insisted on paying cash. Then we were told to hand over a further $300 for I can only assume insurance purposes. We wasn't offered assistance with our luggage to our room. The room was o.k but dated (especially the bathroom). On weeknights we guessed that the staff where valeting customer cars at the foyer, and the noise could be heard from the 11th floor ( our floor ), this went on until approximately 10:30 pm. Finally on our last night our room phone rang on two separate occasions at an unsavoury hour.
review.locationRemarks: A little far out for a general tourist.

review.title: Beautiful - clean - friendly - perfect.
review.reviewText: My wife and I travel often. We are very particular about our accommodations. The atrium is beautiful. The rooms are very clean. The staff is super friendly. The location is perfect. 6 out of 5 stars.

review.title: Fabulous hotel!
review.reviewText: Love this place! Gorgeous hotel. Great location. Cannot believe the price I got on Expedia.
review.positiveRemarks: Beautiful atrium. Incredible view from room. Clean, modern, comfy.
review.negativeRemarks: Nothing at all!
review.locationRemarks: Fabulous location. Ferry Bldg. Fisherman's wharf. Shopping. Food.

review.title: Hotel close to the embarcadero
review.reviewText: Check in was smooth. Room was comfortable and clean.

photos.caption: Our view from our upgraded room.
We walked to the Ferry Building for breakfast.

review.title: Quick trip but very enjoyable.
review.reviewText: The only thing I would complain about is we had to wait a long wait to check in.  There was only 2 repesentatives checking in guest.  But once we were at the counter checking in the experience became better by the minute.  The gentleman helping us apologized for the delay. He asked if there was anything we needed while we were there.  He excused himself for a moment.  He returned and told us he had upgraded our room with no cost.  We were surprised!  This made our short trip even better!  The room was wonderful, clean and so comfortable.  Great location and I would stay there again in a heart beat.
Great stay! Very nice hotel. I highly recommend the breakfast there
Very clean, great location. Enjoyed the stay for my conference.

review.title: Nice hotel great location
review.reviewText: Very comfortable  rooms, nice bar and resteraunt down stairs
review.negativeRemarks: Parking is expensive valet $67 a night
review.locationRemarks: Walking distance to AT&T park

review.reviewText: Felt too big. Very commercial feeling to this place.
Perfect place to stay to enjoy SF if on business or pleasure.  Beautiful view of SF Bay and Bay Bridge.

review.title: great location close to Ferry Building
review.reviewText: Was only staying in town for the night, and wanted to visit some of my favorite restaurants.  I didn't want to have to spend time or money in an uber, so I wanted to be close to Ferry Building.  Weather was great, and it was great to be able to walk to the places I wanted to go to.
review.negativeRemarks: They need room service.  I cannot believe they do not have room service
review.locationRemarks: Great Location with about a million places within walking distance

review.reviewText: Excellent location for accessing Embarcadero, Chinatown, North Beach, Fishermans Wharf, Mission District, Union Square and transportation (BART, cable cars, busses, ferries and trolleys)
review.positiveRemarks: Great clean room, comfortable bed, top grade amenities, spectacular atrium and grounds
review.negativeRemarks: Surrounding streets are filthy

review.title: Unbeatable architecture
review.reviewText: I loved my stay here. You cannot beat the classic, almost brutalist architecture. Atriums like this aren't allowed under current building code, so the lobby is a must-see. I could have spent all night there. However, my room had a view of the Bay Bridge and its light show, so it was equally fascinating. The rooms are large, clean  and comfortable  the staff is awesome. Hope I can go back someday.
review.negativeRemarks: I miss the plants that were there originally.
review.locationRemarks: Ferry Marketplace is across the street. BART station right outside the door. Walking distance to anything in the business district.

review.reviewText: We have purchased bridge&bay view room.Our room was end of corridor and with very limited view.You have to struggle to see the bridge.I talked to front desk and they offered breakfast for just two of us(we are four people). I am very disappointed.I think they give worse room to Expedia quest.

review.title: Short vacation time
review.reviewText: The stay was great up until check out. When I received my bill there was a $175 Laundry & Dry cleaning bill that I did't ask for. I was there for only one night and when clearing it up at the front desk, she stayed that she "remembered someone calling to ask for express dry cleaning and to be done by 7pm" when clearly the hotel should know that I was not me who called it and if any one had to pick it up, it was not my room. I had to call my credit card company to make sure that these charges were not valid and put my card on hold for any further transactions. I kept getting charges that were coming through from the hotel for $220.11 and $295.00 when I have already paid at the front desk at the time of checkin. It made the rest of my trip to the Bay inconvenient because my credit card was on hold. I would have gladly gave this hotel a higher rating.
review.locationRemarks: Close to everything. This is why I chose this hotel.

review.title: Weekend Stay
review.reviewText: Great location across the street from Ferry plaza Bldg. Bay views, view of bay bridge. Several renowned restaurants on walkable distance. Room food service is not that great. Our morning coffee & breakfast served directly form Starbucks in cardboard box..........unusual for 4 star facility.
Wonderful place to stay!  Would recommend this hotel!

review.title: Great hotel, great location
review.reviewText: We recently stayed 3 nights here. The room and location were excellent - we were offered an upgrade on arrival and had a room with a balcony and a harbor view. The stop for one of the cable car routes is right outside and the SF Ferry Building is just across the road. Lots of places to eat nearby and a short walk to Union Square, SF MOMA etc. Highly recommended.
review.negativeRemarks: Perhaps the muzak ...everything else was great.

review.title: Good location
review.reviewText:
Nice stay.  Tee valet parking very e pensive. Do of recommend to s 
None to use the service,?  Especially when you come from outside of the USA.

This was our first trip to San Francisco and my daughter planned everything including choosing the hotel. We were looking for a small suite so she would have her own space. The hotel location was great, staff very friendly, and the room immaculate and nicely appointed.

review.title: Beautiful hotel in a great location!
review.reviewText: Great place to stay close to the bay and within walking distance to attractions including Fisherman's Wharf if you don't mind a bit of a walk.
review.positiveRemarks: Beautiful lobby and luxurious bedding; great lobby bar
review.locationRemarks: Close to the water and many restaurants; within walking distance of Fisherman's Wharf

review.title: Great hotel, just avoid the bell staff
review.reviewText: Room wasn't quite ready so we tried to check luggage at the bell desk, they looked right through us like we weren't there. Other staff was fine though.

review.title: Location was perfect.
review.reviewText: Atrium was welcoming. Felt right at home. The room was nice, but too much road noise. We were only on the 5th floor because they originally reserved me a 1 bed when I needed 2 beds for my family, 2 adults and 2 children. My husband and I plan on returning without kids in the future.

review.title: Excellent home base location
review.reviewText: From the front desk staff to the excellent bartenders it was a great experience.  I can't wait to return.

review.title: Hotel is  close to all. I had a wonderful time
review.reviewText: I had a wonderful time. Everything  was great. Scenery was lovely. Nice views.

review.title: Nice hotel in a great location
review.reviewText: The Hyatt Regency is a nice hotel at a very good location to tour San Francisco. It hosts many events and is a reasonable 20-30 minutes from the airport. The bay-side views are beautiful.
review.positiveRemarks: The Hyatt has a vast, open lobby with fast elevators and good quick food options.
review.negativeRemarks: My room keys didn't work on the first attempt, so I had to wait in a long line again to get them recoded.
review.locationRemarks: The Hyatt is very close to the Ferry Building. It's a reasonable walking distance from Union Square, Coit Tower, and other tourist attractions.

review.title: Excellent downtown location
review.reviewText:
Clean rooms with view bay. 
Elevator location not good. Too much to walk to go the room. Narrow and very long corridor to go to the room.
review.negativeRemarks: Add elevators on the other end f the hotel
review.locationRemarks: Near by shopping

review.title: Location, location, location!
review.reviewText: We happen to love going to the ferry building so the location was perfect.  We had a bay view and really enjoyed that.  Unfortunately due to the interesting architecture of this 1973 building, the view was not accessible unless you were standing right in front of the window.  While the angled architecture is pretty cool, the building is a bit dated.  The bed was great and had nice linens.

review.title: Anniversary
review.reviewText: My wife and I spent our 15 year wedding anniversary at the Hyatt Regency in San Francisco and loved everything about the place. We got a room with a balcony and partial bay views that were absolutely stunning. The bar in the lobby was very nice and we met an awesome bartender named Allmanskey. She made everyone at the bar feel welcomed and engaged them in conversation. We would love to visit again soon, but have to save up for that balcony room again.

review.title: Good location.
review.reviewText: Very friendly staff. Our room was excellent with a beautiful view of the Bay Bridge(1115). Aurora kept our room very clean & tidy. It was nice having Starbucks coffee in the room with to go cups.

review.title: Location, Location!
review.reviewText: We chose this hotel because of its proximity to the Embarcadero and Ferry Terminal Marketplace. The Embarcadero is steps away from the hotel and is a wonderful spot for strolling with many restaurant and shopping options. Our room had a view of the bay which was lovely at any time of day or night and worth the extra money. The hotel staff was friendly, professional and helpful without exception. The lobby was particularly appealing with a full restaurant and bar, as well as a casual short-order, grab-and-go area, all featuring healthy food options and planet-friendly packaging. Also in the lobby was a wide variety of seating areas for small groups and singles. We could not have been happier with this hotel and hope to return soon.
I like everything but just didn't like how small the rooms were , just expected a little bit much more

review.title: Beautiful hotel
review.reviewText: We had a great time, felt pampered. We will stay there again.
review.positiveRemarks: The comfort, the helpful staff and the architecture.
review.negativeRemarks: Put more creamers with the coffee maker in the room.
review.locationRemarks: Fisherman's Wharf, ride the cable cars, visit Chinatown

review.title: Close to Exploratorium
review.reviewText: We enjoyed our stay at the Hyatt. The staff was very helpful and the hotel itself was very impressive. I wish it would have been more kid friendly and have some things for kids to do inside the hotel. Overall, great experience and would definitely stay there again!
We were there for our honeymoon the hotel gave us a gift certificate to the market in the hotel which was very generous and unexpected

review.title: Great stay for our honeymoon!
review.reviewText: My wife and I stayed here for our honeymoon in San Francisco and had a great experience. We informed the concierge that it was our honeymoon the day we got there, just in case there were any specials we could get. They ended up sending us a $75 gift card from the front desk staff and a $50 gift card from the hotel manager, both for the little cafe on the lobby, which was really appreciated. The location was amazing. Not incredibly touristy like Fisherman's Wharf, which was really nice. There were tons of great restaurants and shops in both the Embarcadero center, which is right next to the hotel, and the Ferry building across the street. It's also in a great location if you're up for some walking. Union Square, Fisherman's Wharf, Chinatown, and North Beach are all 20-35 minute walks away, which is great! We also happened to be staying there during the 4th of July, and even though the area near the hotel is safe, things throughout the city became extremely rowdy, especially after the fireworks. The hotel was completely prepared for this. Hotel staff were at the main entrance (all other entrances were locked) only letting people in who had room cards. The elevators were also locked out for the night so they could not be used at all without swiping a room card. The next morning things had quieted down and the area was back to normal, but it was really comforting that night to know that the hotel was prepared for the holiday. Overall, I'd highly recommend this hotel!

review.title: Close to ferry building
review.reviewText: We stayed in a suite with a gorgeous view of the water and bay bridge.  Suite is big enough for 4 ppl although wish the sofa was a sofa bed - the kids end d up in the bed w me while my husband slept on a rollaway.  Still lovely stay though- the kids loved this hotel!

review.title: Great room, but mildew in the tub grouting
review.reviewText: We got into the room and it was great.  But we were disappointed to find mildew in the tub grouting.  Usually, that's a "benefit" of a much lower standard hotel.

review.title: Just the way your stay should go...
review.reviewText: Arrived late due to 2 hour flight delay, was in and out of Reception in moments and a room upgrade to corner balcony which was a nice surprise.  Gentleman at Front Desk attributed it to the full occupancy, but what did I care.  It was the nicest accommodations I believe I ever had the chance to stay in.  Really disappointed I was there for only for one night.
review.positiveRemarks: Centrally located and very upscale atmosphere
review.locationRemarks: Close to the best attractions that downtown SF has to offer. The Street Car line start near the entrance is the nicest way to experience the area.

review.title: Great location, across from the ferry terminal.
review.reviewText: Everything was great.  We had a machine that dispensed cold filtered water on our floor - you should bring an empty water container.
review.positiveRemarks: Location.  The view from our balcony was great.
review.negativeRemarks: Everything was great.
review.locationRemarks: I found the location great.  Shopping nearby.  There is a food market at the Ferry Terminal on Thursday mornings.

review.title: Just across the street from Ferry Building
review.reviewText: Hotel is in the perfect location. Just across the street from the Ferry Building makes this the perfect location. We also walked to the baseball stadium, Pier 39, and fishermans warf. Also walking distance to the Alcatraz tours ferry location. Pickup for the wine tour was right in front of hotel, perfect location for everything we wanted to do. Also found a great breakfast spot in the embarcardo building which was right next door called the Breaking Bread. We selected a balcony room with view of the bay and ferry building. Only complaint was the towels in the bathroom were not of great quality, but otherwise perfect location, staff was exceptional and accommodating. No complaints!

review.title: Excellent location
review.reviewText: My room needed a bit of refreshing, especially the shower enclosure.

review.title: Awesome hotel close to Pier 39 and Fishermans Warf
review.reviewText:
Great Hotel with a great staff. Everyone was really nice and helpful!
We will stay there again!
Good place to stay and I will come again. Excellent location, very convenience

review.title: Perfect hotel
review.reviewText: I was staying there for three night, the hotel was super good with a wonderful bay view. Amazing lobby, incredible architectural style.

review.title: Anniversary
review.reviewText: Just what we were looking for.  Close to restaurants, shops, bars, also was able to walk to where our champagne brunch cruise boarded at the pier.

review.title: Nice hotel
review.reviewText: I've stayed here several times, and really enjoy it. However in the last year or so they got rid of their fab room service menu and have a cheapy to go box menu with sandwiches etc. I will not be ordering from that again. Everything else is wonderful. Great location.
review.negativeRemarks: Room service menu.

review.title: Great look. Arquitecture.
review.reviewText: I was very disappointed about the parking. When I made reservation I was told it would be 25 dollars a day. When we arrived they charge 60 dollars a day!!! The bathroom was tiny and our first night, the fire alarm went off at 2:30 am. We were guided outside at this time and waited till cleared.  Overpriced hotel.  I called to receive a receipt for my stay and payment and haven't received one yet.

review.title: Front Desk Staff and Hyatt hotel
review.reviewText: After a long drive, we checked in to Hyatt and was kindly welcomed by the front desk staff. She was very helpful and professional. The hotel itself had an amazing view from the inside and was very clean. It's a walking distance to many shops and restaurants. We paid $34 to park in the garage, $69 to valet. Parking was a five minute walk to the hotel. Wish the parking was free but it is SF. We would definetly book another night at this hotel based on our good experience!

review.title: Hotel with problems
review.reviewText: The light over one bed had no globe so that the bare bulb was exposed, the clock radio was one and a quarter hour fast, there was no television station guide and only one suitcase rack.    This meant that one of us had to sit on the floor to use it.

review.title: Great View
review.reviewText: For a hotel that looked like it was made solely of poured cement, it was noisy in the room. If you do not like heights stay away from this hotel, it is open in the center from the first floor to the roof. Visually stunning
review.positiveRemarks: It was right on the Bay, the view was spectacular and the ferry was a short walk away.
review.negativeRemarks: A better room service option would be nice,and more transportation options.
review.locationRemarks: The Ferry building was very close and a strip mall of sort snaked between some of the buildings, that was fun but very easy to get lost.

review.title: Close to the Ferry Terminal
review.reviewText: Great hotel, airy atrium, which I like. One thing, no coffee at 5:30 AM though there is a Starbucks across the street.
review.negativeRemarks: Coffee in the lobby for early risers. They have a little grab and go place but it did not open until 6AM the day I was there. The staff was there and
review.locationRemarks: It's the financial district in SF, enough said

review.title: Business trip to Bay Area
review.reviewText:
I came to San Francisco on a business trip and very much enjoyed my stay at this hotel! Very large rooms, professional staff and welcoming atmosphere. I will definitely be back to stay when I am in the area again! I am the National Sales Manager with a large hotel company and definitely noticed and appreciated the service at this property...thank you! 

Jeremiah Khan
review.positiveRemarks: The lobby was amazing!! The rooms were large and comfortable!
review.negativeRemarks: N/A
review.locationRemarks: In the heart of the financial district...perfect for sales calls!

review.title: Lovely hotel with underground links to shops.
review.reviewText: Lovely hotel and staff.  Just 3 gripes.  There were not enough plain tea bags.  I was given just one a day.  Plenty of flavoured ones.  The hairdryer cable was too short if used in room.  I had to bend my knees and lean over the table towards the plug to dry my hair.     It wasn't for safety reasons as it could still fall in the sink when used in bathroom.  The pool had a tide mark.
review.positiveRemarks: The staff, the decor, the food, the position to railway station and old centre of town.
review.negativeRemarks: See my gripes above.
review.locationRemarks: It was easy to get to malls, historic parts of town, the railway station, and the Forks centre.

review.title: Great location
review.reviewText: Overall, a very good hotel.  We liked the location (close to the Ferry Building on the Embarcadero) a lot.  Near shops and restaurants.  Two suggestions for the hotel:  a second chair to sit in and read would be great;  also, towel racks so if you're not requiring clean towels, the ones you're using will dry.
review.positiveRemarks: Very quiet.  Also, we had a partial bay view, which included the Bay Bridge
review.negativeRemarks: Second reading chair in the room - it's certainly big enough.  Also, towel racks, not hooks.
review.locationRemarks: Several good places to eat in the Ferry Building, which is across the street:  Coqueta, and Market Bar

review.title: Good location with BART station right next door.
review.reviewText: Nice place, staff were friendly.  Right across from the old Ferry Terminal building which has all sorts of cool shops, cafes and restaurants and a boardwalk to sit outside and enjoy.
review.locationRemarks: Great location central to everything.

review.title: Excellent location and Service
review.reviewText: Hotel staff are super professiona and nice.  Check in was quick and easy and the restaurant and bar are a good value.
review.locationRemarks: Close to the pier and a lot of resturants.

review.title: Still a winner
review.reviewText: This is perhaps my seventh day at this hotel. It continues to meet my expectations.
Great lobby. Great view from our room and balcony of the bay and Treasure Island. Close to wharf.

review.title: Comfortable and convenient  for tourists.
review.reviewText: We enjoyed our stay. The hotel is close to the bay and convenient to tourist attractions. Only complaint was that there's almost no seating in the lobby. There was a 4 am evacuation due to a fire alarm. It was handled as smoothly as possible by the staff.

review.title: good hotels hideous decor
review.reviewText: I like the Hyatt chain except the decor is so hideous I can barely stand to go in there.

review.title: Good Location - Wasted Space
review.reviewText: W stayed in a King room with a bay view. This hotel had a great location in terms of access to public transportation. You are only steps from BART, MUNI bus, MUNI subway, free Presidio shuttles and ferries. The hotel has a lot of wasted space and opportunities. For starters there are great places with great views of the bay - everyone of the 14 "regular" floors has a large open space with floor to ceiling windows facing the bay - however without chairs or sofas they are not much good for anything but the occasional gaze. The walkways leading to the rooms are single file as the oddly angled rooms jut out ever 20 feet or so.  Inside our king room there is a large (rather useless) entryway with a table which results in a claustrophobic shower & toilet area. The room has a single sitting chair and a desk chair, so plan to watch TV from the Bed if there are more then one of you. Even as a single person you will be moving furniture around to get a view of the TV. While our "Bay view" room had a partial view of the bay, there is again no way to enjoy it while sitting down as unnecessary store architectural accents on the outside of the floor to ceiling windows blocks your view. All of these leading to the idea that this is intended for a single person on a business trip, not a vacation. Finally, I would suggest skipping the limited, overpriced hotel food in lieu of better, cheaper local  restaurants. Just be careful to check their hours as on weekends some places are closed.
review.negativeRemarks: Make use of the large empty areas with great views - add couches and chairs so people can sit and enjoy the views. Rearrange and add sofas to rooms.
review.locationRemarks: Lots of transportation and access to rest of the city. Get to Golden Gate bride, zoo, ferries via convenient MUNI and shuttles.

review.title: overbooked and no room!
review.reviewText: I had booked this hotel over one month ago for an overnight between flights from Hawaii to the east coast. When we arrived, we were told the hotel was overbooked, there was one room left which the housekeeping staff had informed the front desk smelled strongly of smoke. We were told we could be relocated to another hotel, the grand, handed $20 dollars for the cab fare and dismissed. I feel this was disgraceful....why book a room at all if it will not be available when you arrive? I was told my original reservation fee would be refunded and we would not be charged for moving to the other hotel; but, I felt very inconvenienced and the hotel had no concern about their inability to accommodate us. I will never book with them again.

They have recently stopped doing full room service. Only a limited menu now and nothing simple that works for someone trying to avoid gluten and dairy.  I used to get a beautiful breakfast there.  Prices overall have gotten exorbitant. I travel for work but I think we will seek a different hotel next time.

managementResponses.response: Thank you for your review and compliment! Glad you enjoyed your stay and I'll make sure to share your kind words with Amy at the desk!

review.title: Beautiful hotel just off the Bay
review.reviewText: I got there too early to check in, but the hotel staff was super helpful in helping me store my luggage and assisting me with places to get some lunch while I waited for my room to be ready. The wait time was less than an hour! Amy at the reception desk was particularly notable - she was very welcoming.
review.locationRemarks: Absolutely visit the waterfront market just across the street from the hotel - so much great local food!

review.reviewText: The only bad review I can give is it took 30 minutes to get our car out of valet.  When you spend $67 to park I think that is unacceptable.

This was an huge terrible waste of my birthday.
The hotel was a nightmare and we spent our time accomadating their problems.
Moving rooms at midnight was humiliating,disrespectful and just plain bad.
They have plumbing problems and made us and our stay an unforgettable mess.
I never have been so misled,and taken advantage of.

review.title: Great choice!
review.reviewText: The Hotel was in a great location for our traveling purposes. Close to public transportation. The rooms were comfortable and quiet. The hotel staff were all friendly and accommodating. The hotel lobby had a great open feel.

review.title: great location
review.reviewText:
great location for checking out shopping district and ferry terminal food market
highly recommend ferry terminal if you are coeliac (as I am) - there is a fantastic gf bakery/sandwich bar located inside - hotel has terrible gf options

review.title: Business Trip
review.reviewText: Room was clean and comfortable. King bed was comfortable with plenty of pillows. Located close to numerous restaurants. I would stay again.

review.title: Nice location
review.reviewText: Good central location to start from to see all the sites
Very long walk to our room -- seemed rather deserted and unwelcoming.

review.title: Showing its age but great location
review.reviewText: Great location and friendly staff - Bathroom is tiny; parking is $70/night w/tax

review.title: Great it was close to lots of things and great wal
review.reviewText: My experience was great we got there early and they allowed us to check in early.

review.title: Great location
review.reviewText:
Just stayed 4 nights at the Hyatt Regency.  The location is great, in the Financial District with very convenient access to all public transportation, including trolley.  Quick ride on the street cars down to Pier 39 and Fisherman's Wharf.  This is great if you want to avoid staying in that very busy area.  We had reserved a Bay view room, and were offered an upgrade to the top floor when we checked in...great view with a patio.  
I would rate this hotel as a 3.5 star, not quite 4 star.  Room service is not 24 hours, kitchen closes at 11.  We wanted a late night dessert on our last night after a late dinner elsewhere, but were out of luck.  Beds are extremely hard, like sleeping on a concrete mattress with a thin pillow top!  Bathrooms are quite small and outdated (maybe that was just because our room was slightly angled).  Toilet clogged one day.  Maintenance came pretty quickly and fixed it, but commented that clogs happen often.  I wouldn't make this our "go to" hotel, but I would recommend it if the above cons aren't a big deal for you.
PS- parking here is very expensive, but you don't need a car if you plan on just getting around the downtown area.  Also, plan on a $225 "deposit" on check-in, in addition to your total room charges.

review.title: Excellent location with High Prices
review.reviewText:
Arrived late after 23 hours of flight delays in stormy weather. Room assigned was badly configured semi handicap accessible and therefore inconvenient and awkward for able bodied businessman. No counter in bath, baskets on floor with hairdryer-- weird setup. Only one water glass. 
Staff and financial district location were terrific-- prices in hotel ridiculously high even for a  New Yorker.

review.title:
Friendly staff
Elegant appearance
review.reviewText:
We took breakfast at the restaurant. Staff was very friendly.
Check out time is 12:00, therefore we had a enough time to go around San Francisco with parking car there.

review.title: Amazing hotel.
review.reviewText: Valet as soon as we pulled up to the hotel. Friendly concierge, beautiful facilities, amazing view and just a short walk from anything you desire. 10/10 no doubt.

review.title: City easily walkable from this location
review.reviewText: Clean and friendly. Busy part of the city but easy to find dining and easy access to just about anywhere.
Stayed with my wife here for a weekend. Great location, easy access to transportation. I loved the atrium, great option to just sit and relax.
review.positiveRemarks: The location is awesome, very convenient and good to walk around.
review.locationRemarks: good transportation network from this location. The BART station exits to the front of this hotel.

review.reviewText: The nicest hotel in the best location. I can't wait to come stay again !

review.title: Wonderful all around!
review.reviewText: Beautiful hotel, excellent location with gorgeous views, clean and private rooms. Serene lounge areas, hip bar, and a hidden gem of a restaurant right outside the north side of hotel (Sens). I will definitely stay here again!  Also easy access right off the Bay Bridge.
review.locationRemarks: Walk to Ferry Building. The world of SF is right out door if venturing outside or viewed from your balcony if staying in and relaxing.

review.reviewText: Great location, excellent hotel. Clean and very helpful staff

review.title: Decent stay
review.reviewText:
I booked a suite here and when I booked it they said suites on we're levels 7 and up. When I got there they gave me a suite on third floor with no view at all of any Bay Area. 
Then when I check out, they hit me with a valet parking charge of $70... We didn't even have a car. My friend stayed at the hotel from 7pto 11p and they said that's considered a full day. And charged me $70 for it! Craziest thing I've ever heard. This hotel is also close to nothing if it's your first time in San Fran.
It was a good stay had a great time and plan on going back

review.title: Great Location, Disappointing Experience
review.reviewText:
Fabulous location 800 feet from the ferry building.  Great, but pricey, breakfast buffet. Wonderful room with living room and balcony with outdoor seating.

BUT: 

It began badly: no one to greet you and no one and no signs to tell you where the reception desk is (unmarked two floors up) or how to get there. For the price, you'd expect bottled water in the room, but there was none, not even for purchase. The drapes didn't fully cover the slider windows, and therefore we couldn't filter out the street light. The hotel didn't clean our room one day even though we were out the entire day.  When housekeeping came to our room after we called to complain, they tried to tell us that we had requested a delayed cleaning time (giving us the time that we called to complain and that they entered our complaint into the computer). For the price, I'd expect to be on a higher floor than the 3rd floor, which is the first floor of the hotel rooms. Being on the third floor meant that at 7AM we were awakened by a street musician began playing very bad jazz music.

review.title: Convenient for business in financial district
review.reviewText: Big place.  Great views from best rooms. Big room, small bathroom, big TV. 5-10 minute walk to my meetings

review.title: Lessons learned
review.reviewText:
First lesson: When you plan a trip, check and see what local events may be happening during your stay that may effect   not only your arrival to the hotel, but every thing you have planned. We arrived on a Saturday to find not only the main street to our hotel blocked due to preparations for the Super Bowl, but also a protest. Every access to the hotel was blocked or closed all together. We ended up driving to the other end of the city and parking where my daughter was staying in corporate housing and taking the Muni back as close as we could to the hotel, with luggage in tow.
Second lesson;: In your stay includes a Sunday, make sure that there are restaurants that are open that you can get to. There was nothing open that we could find, even a chain coffee shop.
Third lesson: They hotel was in the process of remodeling inside which meant noise in the early morning. We had no idea. They also had no restaurant in the hotel. We ended up eating crackers and sharing a sandwich in the temporary bar while they set up for a conference the next day in the center of the lobby.
Summary: Do your homework before you choice a hotel. Check what is happening in the area durning your stay in addition to remodeling inside the hotel.
review.positiveRemarks: Staff was friendly. Room was clean. Once we were able to get to the hotel, it is close to all methods of transport throughout the city.
review.negativeRemarks: Would not have stayed at this hotel do to things listed above on this visit.

review.title: One night stay.
review.reviewText: Despite the Restaurant Remodel and the Road Construction, we were very impressed with this Hotel. The Staff was welcoming and helpful. As we were checking out, I had left my Coat hanging in the closet and a Member of the Staff RAN from our room to catch us at the Elevator to return my coat. We were at the opposite end of the Hotel from the Elevators!
review.negativeRemarks: Free Parking

review.reviewText: near to my office, good price for early january season.
review.negativeRemarks: more thoughtful frontdesk representative, i had to go down 12 floors again to reactive my old key in order to pick up my unpacked laggage
review.locationRemarks: financial district

photos.caption: The Atrium with Color Changing Sculpture

review.title: Very uniquely designed hotel close to everything
review.reviewText:
The hotel is very pretty on the inside and the rooms were very nice also. This is San Francisco so expect to pay more for parking and the food here is fairly pricey as well. We had very little interaction with the staff but they seemed friendly enough. All of the elevators are on one side of the complex and the middle is a giant atrium. If you get a room on the opposite side of the atrium you have to walk all the way around the complex to get to the elevators. Also if you are going up or down during normal meal times or check-in/check-out times, expect the elevator to stop on every single floor which means it could take a while to get down.

The hotel is close to many things in San Francisco including the financial district and the Exploratorium so it is a good place to stay as a staging point for your visit in the city. I would definitely recommend it to others looking for a nice hotel in SF.
review.positiveRemarks: The inside is beautiful with the color changing lights. The rooms are nice as well and are definitely 4 star quality.
review.negativeRemarks: Elevators on the opposite side of the atrium would be nice but it is too late for that now. The architecture doesn't allow it due to the slope.

review.title: Great location near Embarcadero
review.reviewText: We enjoyed a spacious bedroom with a Nice view of the San Francisco Bay. Close to union square & Fishermans wharf. The breakfast had a good variety.

review.title: Great hotel for a girls weekend!
review.reviewText: The hotel was very nice and the staff was great. We loved being so close to the pier. Note: the pillows in the rooms are not very comfortable.
review.positiveRemarks: close to a lot of nice restaurants. Close to Bart and the trolley as well.
review.negativeRemarks: pillows were hard.
review.locationRemarks: the market at the pier was nice, we rode the trolley up to Chinatown, had dinner at Pier 39.

review.reviewText:
Great room 
Amazing shower
Great location

Only downfall was expensive parking

review.title: Very nice hotel, well located.
review.reviewText: Large clean rooms and very nice staff. The concierge and the front desk were very helpful. I had called earlier to ask for the rooms to be next door and hopefully with a view. I was told by someone on the phone that they didn't have two king rooms together in the hotel and a view was chancy, however, they would put down the request. I was pleasantly surprised that they did have the rooms next to each other and we got a really nice view from the 11th floor. whosoever was on the phone did't know much about this property. Internet was available through out our stay of 7 days, and it was pretty good. Overall, a very good experience.
Old tired hotel...desperately needs remodeling...unsightly...dated and depressing
review.negativeRemarks: complete remodel
review.locationRemarks: Semi slum area

review.reviewText: The staff are bunch of jerks. The location and view is great.

review.title: Great Hotel Right on the Waterfront
review.reviewText:
My two kids and i were in Room 1511 with a view of the Bay Bridge.  We purposely booked a bay view room to watch the New Year's Eve fireworks and we were not disappointed!  A front-row seat without the crowds!  For some reason the hotel said we wouldn't be able to see the fireworks from any of the rooms but it must have been to dissuade parties.  

Our room was a Bay View King.  Very comfortable for an adult and two kids.  You can get a roll-away twin if you need one for an additional charge.  One drawback: room service was not very good and was expensive as there is a nearly 25% gratuity charge.  There are a lot of little places around the hotel that are much better for the money.  

Hotel is centrally located right across from the ferry building.  The F Line runs to the Exploratorium, the Alcatraz cruises, Pier 39, Fisherman's Wharf and the cable cars.  Also AT&T Park.  Valet parking is a whopping $59 but there's self-parking for $34 right across the street in Embarcadero 4.  It has EV chargers if so inclined.

All in all, very happy with the hotel and we will be back next New Year's Eve, I hope!
review.positiveRemarks: Centrally located for activities along the waterfront.
review.negativeRemarks: Room service could definitely see some improvement for the price.  Breakfast was ok, dinner was not.

review.title: Stop on our way home
review.reviewText:
We drove from Washington to Arizona for Christmas.  Decided to take the coast back home and stop in San Francisco for the first time.  The Hyatt was the first hotel that popped up with two double beds as we are a family of 4. First, the entrance was very confusing to find the front desk.  Second, the parking was not convenient.  Pretty far away to grab something forgotten in the car. Just not possible.  Third, the staff was not friendly.  Could not give a smile and did not tell us about the hotel in any way.  Just handed us the room cards and it was up to us to find it.  Forth, after settled in, we went to the lounge to relax and grab a drink.  All the tables were dirty and the server came over to let us know the kitchen was closed but we could still order a drink.  Didn't clean the table we were at for us and didn't come back.  We waited for 15 min and just gave up.  The lounge only had two other tables, so he was not to busy to tend to us.  Fifth, the beds were very hard and the noise level from outside made it impossible to sleep.
Very disappointing.  Checked out and stayed at a different hotel the next night.
review.negativeRemarks: Customer service

review.title: Great location for San Francisco for New Year's ev
review.reviewText: Great location for the fireworks Nice hotel good staff

I have wonderful impression to the hotel.
Beautiful sight view and luxurious lobby.
And location is good for travell...

review.title: Great hotel in Embarcadero
review.reviewText: I loved the hotel. Beautiful atrium and bay views from the 15 floor. Excellent location close to shopping and restaurants.  Within walking distance to fisherman's wharf and Chinatown.  This is my go-to when I'm in the sf area.

review.title: Great Experience
review.reviewText: This hotel is amazing.  Great location, friendly staff, and unbelievable view.

We had booked this hotel as they usually have a wonderful Christmas lights display including snow being created inside the hotel lobby. They did not have it this year and the hotel was under construction. So no food/bar service before 3 and a lot of noise. The kids were pretty disappointed.

review.title: Cosy room at accessible location
review.reviewText: Our 2 night stay in Hyatt was splendid! The rooms are huge and very clean. The toilets are also very big. It was a comfortable stay and there were many buses and cable cars available just below our door step :) The only drawback was that self-parking was pretty expensive and far away from the hotel. Other than that, beautiful hotel and big cosy rooms!
review.negativeRemarks: Self-parking services
review.locationRemarks: Near almost everywhere that is significant in San Francisco!

review.title: A disappointing stay
review.reviewText:
I booked the room for the Christmas night for my family through Expedia with full payment in advance. When I booked the room, I indicated that we have two adults and two kids, 12 and 11 year old. Here are what we ran into:
1. When we checked in the room (with one king size bed) and request the beds for kids, I was told I have to pay $25 for the bed. The operator told me I have to contact expedia.com for the charge.
2. Before I checked in, I called hotel and asked the parking place at Embarcadero parking lot 3 or 4 next to the  hotel, I was told the parking there was not overnight. The operator told me the hotel has the overnight valet parking. In reality, parking at Embarcadero parking lot 3 or 4 is overnight for $34. The hotel valet parking costs twice high.
3. Hotel room AC unit does not have enough power. I asked the hotel engineer to come and check and he said it worked fine. So I have to request an additional mobile heater in the room.
4. At around 8am, the cleaning person knocked on the door for cleaning the room before I got up. My wife answer the door and told her we are not ready. My wife asked her what is the check out time, she answered 11am. The fact is that the check out time is at noon.
5. As soon as we checked out and lock the door at around 10:30am, my kid found she left her hat in the room. So I asked the cleaning lady to call the hotel security to open the room for us. We waited about 20 minutes before the security came to open the door.
review.negativeRemarks: see my experience above
review.locationRemarks: a lot.

review.reviewText: A spacious room and convenient location.  Free WiFi in room. Nice place to stay.

review.title: Not what we expected!
review.reviewText: Heading to SF for a medical appointment, hotel room to small for a roll away, then was charging 25.00 for it.  Was not allowed to take the car out of the parking lot unless paying another $40.00 for parking AGAIN.  Continental breakfast cost $125.00 for 2 Adults, 2 Kids.   Front Desk not helpful.  If we needed a roll away they suggested we get a suite, another 150.00 then it would have enough room to put a roll away in there.  An ongoing medical procedure for our child the following day, not having money to upgrade was quite a problem.
review.negativeRemarks: Yes, the help!

review.title: Perfect spot to be close to pier 3!
review.reviewText: Stayed here for my company Christmas party on the Hornblower "Spirit" Dinner cruise.  Made getting there and back so convenient and we didn't have to worry about driving in a compromised state!  Able to walk to pier 3 in about 5 minutes!  Room was comfortable.  The property was nice except for the ongoing construction for a new restaurant.

review.title: Best Hotel
review.reviewText:
My boyfriend and I love staying at this hotel. We love the easy to and from the BART and Muni Transportation. We love the views that also come with this hotel you can see parts of the bay bridge and parts of the ferry building. 
The hotel rooms in this hotel are very nice and clean. There beds are very  comfy. There staff is always so nice. This time they allowed us to check in at least 4 hours early and gave us an upgrade for free.

review.title: Architectural blunder
review.reviewText: This hotel has a terrible layout and also has no parking on the property. Beyond that, it's a beautiful place and the rooms are very nice.
review.positiveRemarks: The rooms are great. The staff were friendly.
review.negativeRemarks: Useful stairs on the far sides of the building and a note that the hotel doesn't actually have parking in the hotel proper would be useful.

review.title: SCROOGE HAS TAKEN OVER THE HYATT!
review.reviewText: Our family looks forward all year long to our annual tradition of staying at the Hyatt Regency Embarcadero for the holiday decorations, including the beautiful hanging lights from the balconies, snow machine, the amazing Christmas village, the animated life-size nutcracker, and the red & green elevators.  To our utter dismay, the lobby is being remodeled in an extremely unattractive modern motif and there was practically no holiday decorations.  What happened?  We were so stunned that we googled the hotel to find it now has new owners, to whom we have some advice:  Stark modern decor makes sense for the tech company lobbies, but the San Francisco hotels are all about tradition and everyone coming into the city for the holiday decorations.  Whose idea was it to take it all away?
review.positiveRemarks: Front desk was professional and listened to my saga.
review.negativeRemarks: Bring back the holiday decorations!
review.locationRemarks: Good location for ice skating, shopping, and restaurants.

review.title: Nice hotel great location
review.reviewText: The Hyatt Regency is a large and unique hotel with a huge atrium center. There was construction this week which was kind of a pain sometimes but once it's done, I expect it will 4 star quality. The location almost on the waterfront and with cable cars, street cars, busses and the Bart all right in front, is very convenient. The staff were wonderful.  The concierge especially. The union square area is an easy walk, and fishermen's wharf is a 30 min walk.  Chinatown is about 15- 20. We had an awesome view of the bay bridge and the port of san francisco the left and up market street to the right. We went off season and saved some money and crowds.

review.title: Should have disclosed
review.reviewText: Hotel did not inform me at anytime there was construction being performed in the atrium lobby
review.negativeRemarks: Communication

review.title: good stay
review.reviewText: Lots of construction. Staff members not once or twice within five seconds, then come inside the room. This was a lack of privacy for me. Laundry service got the price of my laundry items incorrect. My key card didn't work when I arrived at about eight 9 o'clock at night.  The view is spectacular! The room is impeccable, and the hotel is a four-star hotel. Limited restaurant menu.

review.title: Hotel under construction
review.reviewText: I have 40 years of experience with this Hyatt. There is major construction presently underway. There is a huge tent in the lobby where the food service use to be located. There is a huge roar coming from this area, including jackhammers. All the charm was gone from this hotel.
review.positiveRemarks: Once the construction is completed I will stay there again.
review.locationRemarks: Ferry Building is fun located across the street.

review.title: Comfortable hotel
review.reviewText: Just visiting for the Thanks giving holiday, It was an awsome time for my self, to short of course.
review.positiveRemarks: Central location to all directions withing the City and out of the City
review.negativeRemarks: It would of been nice to have like a chester drawer for my cloths intead of the one small space for coats which is part of the hotel experience.
review.locationRemarks: Location central to all public transportations and within walking distance of shops and restaurants.

review.title: close to piers/transportation
review.reviewText: We were in San Fran to celebrate my 65th birthday with our son.  We had a wonderful visit, and was surprised that the atrium was torn down while we were visiting.  Being that it was the week end before Thanksgiving was a surprise.
review.positiveRemarks: location, view from room, valet service was great
review.negativeRemarks: seating to watch tv, robes, microwave, additional drinking glasses, coffee maker for multiple cups, larger bath towels

review.title: Very nice
review.reviewText: Had a great stay!  Bay view was absolutely beautiful. Friendly staff, clean rooms and walking distance from a lot. Would stay again.

review.title: Excellent location
review.reviewText: Was warmly greeted at the front desk....they were going through some lobby renovations but everything was fine for check in...Hotel is close to the waterfront which is great for sightseeing...long walk to and from the elevator if you order a room with the bay view....view was worth the walk.....comfortable and clean room....
review.negativeRemarks: Long walk to elevators..breakfast buffet was pricey and very poor selection of items
review.locationRemarks: Did walk on the Pier.....Alcatraz tour

review.reviewText: It's a wonderful place to spend the night with my wife, it is very clean and we found it very romantic to.

review.title: Hotel has balconies and beautiful view of the Bay!
review.reviewText: Hotel was under renovation, so it was not in the best condition while we were there. I would recommend going after the construction is done. Always get the Regency Club upgrade at this hotel, the club is totally worth it, and it comes with breakfast and dinner!!

review.title: Convenient to public transportation
review.reviewText: Our room was great with a wonderful view of the bay; the lobby area was under construction with confusion about service locations.

Thank you to Mona for finding safety pins for me when I forgot to bring it for the race! The hotel was awesome. Wish we had more time to hang out there. The beds were super comfortable. Would definitely stay here again! :)

review.title: Horrible hotel.
review.reviewText: Dirty, old and just a horrible experience. It really made me question Hyatts competence.
Amazing location and views. Spectacular architecture. Room was noisier than I expected (the ventilation system was noteicable noisy)

review.title: Beautiful balcony views
review.reviewText:
There was a bit of construction in the main atrium that was really noisy. I could not hear it in my room, and they seemed to stop at a decent hour. 
The fire alarms did go off twice, but I believe this was related to the construction. Still, walking down 16 flights of stairs was no fun.

The view from our balcony was amazing. We could see a lot of the bay and the city. We were given? earned? a pass into the regency club, which has a 360 view of the bay and city. I wish we had known it served complimentary breakfast/dinner when we arrived...we waited until our last night to check it out, and were really heartbroken to find that out.
review.positiveRemarks: Views. Hotel elevators walls are nearly all glass. Provides an amazing view of the hotel's atrium.
review.negativeRemarks: Less fire alarms. More information about the Regency Club.
review.locationRemarks: The trolley tracks literally stop right outside. The ferry building is across the street, and full of amazing shops.

review.reviewText: Nice rooms, great location to site seeing points of interest and transportation.

review.title: Hotel in downtown
review.reviewText:
Great. Just great xxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxx vvvvvvvvvvvvvvvvvvvvvvvvv bbbbb

Mmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmm
review.negativeRemarks: Acoustics

review.title: Nice Hotel close to all we wanted
review.reviewText: From when we arrived to when we left the experience was excellent , Nice views of the bay area and very clean rooms Staff go out of there way to help and make the experience what we wanted . Had a slight problem with the shower and we were given a upgrade to another room so they could repair the problem , Walking distance to all the attractions but if you didn't want to walk you could catch a street car or tram outside the hotel .Would defiantly stay there again .
review.positiveRemarks: The location and the friendly staff
review.locationRemarks: Walk to the pier , Walk to Union Square and the shopping around the area

review.title: Nice place
review.reviewText: Really nice place. Everything was clean and cozy. Room had a great view of the bay and staff made the stay very enjoyable.

review.title: Fun in the city by the bay
review.reviewText: Hotel was very wonderful and centrally located for our San Francisco experience. Many things to do around the hotel.
review.locationRemarks: Near the Port of San Francisco and all the wonderful businesses I never knew existed within the building. Near AT& T park. Lots of good transportation

review.title: Great location.
review.reviewText: This is our second time at the hotel. It has a great location just off the Embracedero, across the road from the ferry building and with the cable car stopping right outside, it doesn't get any better. We also pay extra for the Regency Club which means you get free breakfast ( which is excellent) and snacks and drinks throughout the day which is great value. I would definitely recommend this hotel.

review.title: Mostly good but.....
review.reviewText: Did not receive clean glasses on 2nd day & had to request more shampoo. Not what I expected from this hotel

review.title: Very clean with great view.
review.reviewText: Everything from the staff greeting us to the coffee in the room was perfect.

review.title: Great location but outdated
review.reviewText: The entrance to the lobby up two escalators reveals a massive cathedral ceiling like hotel core.  At one time this must have been mind blowing but without the plants handing from each floors balcony this was just a very beautiful skyway.  The staff was cordial but the room was awkward with sharp angles and a small bathroom.  We had a partial view of the wharf which was cool with a very comfortable king size bed.
review.positiveRemarks: Valet parking, convenient location, and moderate price.
review.negativeRemarks: Hang so e plants from each floors  balcony.
review.locationRemarks: It's San Francisco dummy there's always something going on or just entertain yourself people watching.  We had a farmers market/craft fair to shop at

review.title: Better choices in SF
review.reviewText: Couldn't check in at 3. Took my phone to text when room ready. Received no text. Room was very expensive and not too clean. Smelled of mold and mildew. Rug stained. Had an issue on sat with Internet but resolved that day. Tech support rang our room at 6:58 AM on a sun morning to check on problem! Old hotel always under construction.

review.title: Holiday weekend
review.reviewText:
Our stay went very well, we used valet parking, the staff was quick to serve us. Check in was a 5 minute wait but again very friendly and got us our room quickly.
The room was clean and had a fresh scent to it. We had a partial view of San Francisco bay. A comfortable bed, nice large tv and many amenities.

review.title: Great Trip
review.reviewText: Clean hotel.  Some rooms had very nice views, mine included.
review.negativeRemarks: Update some main areas to be a bit more modern (although already nice and clean even if appear a bit outdated).
review.locationRemarks: About 1-2 miles from Fishermans wharf, Att stadium, Moscone center, many of the piers and interesting views.

review.title: weekend in the city-chose because of location
review.reviewText:
check in easy, clean room, great location, 
when asked about food after 12pm given one take out menu
review.negativeRemarks:
a make up mirror and full mirror in room
lobby women restroom smelly and dirty
no food after 12PM? no place close

review.title: Close to the financial area
review.reviewText: The hotel staff are helpful. The room is spacious.  Not much touris information provided.

review.title: Nice hotel walking distance to many attractions.
review.reviewText: Nice hotel along the bay. Trolley car easily accessible. Walking distance to Fisherman's Wharf and AT&T Park.

review.title: Hyatt Embarcadero
review.reviewText: We had a great time until we returned to our car after the weekend.  We had asked the valet to retrieve my sunglasses from the car but they brought us a different pair that were also in the car then the ones I had asked for, no big deal.  When we retrieved the car at the end of the stay I went to get my original sunglasses and they were gone.  They were a nice pair of Maui Jim sunglasses which have vanished.  I called to report this to the security yesterday and am yet to hear back.  I said I would like to offer them the opportunity to return the glasses without questions.  I now await a reply.
review.positiveRemarks: The location is great and the views are amazing!
review.negativeRemarks: Of course I would like to get my sunglasses back.

review.reviewText: Great location close to Ferry Building and ATT Park

review.title: Anniversary get away
review.reviewText: LOVE this hotel.Very welcoming.Beautiful view from room.Enjoyable walks.In fact walked back to the hotel after seeing Beach Blanket Babylon, about a mile,but a nice walk.Wonderful buffet breakfast.

Excellent location 
Enjoyed our stay
We were well looked after

review.title: Very convenient Location
review.reviewText: The hotel is in a fantastic location across from the Ferry building and walking distance to a lot of places. The hotel is very corporate, a bit unfriendly, and very little character. The rooms are quite nice and comfortable. Nice fitness center. I feel for the rate that we paid, the hotel fell short on service and amenities.
review.negativeRemarks: Better service. Friendlier Staff, at all levels.

review.title: Great hotel, very convenient location
review.reviewText:
We couldn't have asked for a more convenient location for our family's San Francisco vacation. We took the Bart train into the city from the airport and were delightfully surprised to see that our hotel was literally right there as we exited the Embarcadero station. Getting around the city was simple as well. Muni bus lines and even cable cars were available right outside the front door, and we were within easy walking distance to several restaurants and the Ferry Building. Longer walks led us to the Exploratorium, Fisherman's Wharf and Market Street. 

Some downtown hotels can be seedy, but not the Hyatt. The huge atrium had recently been renovated, and the rooms were modern and clean as well. The staff was very friendly and accommodating.

Our only complaints:

- The bathroom is very small. Our family of three found ourselves tripping over each other. Not much the Hyatt can do about that, but the huge Atrium felt like wasted space, given how tight our bathroom facilities were.

- The breakfast buffet was delicious but overpriced. For three of us, the bill came to $100, including tip. That's outrageous even for the city, and we made sure to find other breakfast options for the remainder of our trip.
review.negativeRemarks: Reduce the price of the brunch.
review.locationRemarks: Restaurants, the historic Ferry Building (shops), cable cars. Longer walk takes you to the Exploratorium.

review.title: Nice hotel at an excellent location
review.reviewText: You dont need a car if we stay in this hotel and to go to places in the SFO area. BART(train) is just in front of the building, Ferry is just across the street, Cable car is in front of the building. There are lots of restaurants for breakfast and lunch. Few restaurants for dinner also with a bay view and stuff. We took the room with the bay view and it is worth and we loved the stay.
review.negativeRemarks: bathrooms
review.locationRemarks: downtown, Ferry, Cable car, bay bridge, beaches

review.title: Good Location
review.reviewText:
Pleasant stay in a dated Hotel that needs
Updating.

review.title: Great location in embarcadero
review.reviewText: Great stay. Loved the Tadich Grill and San Francisco helicopter tour. The tour included a flight under the Golden Gate Bridge. Wow!

review.title: Poor Reception at Check in
review.reviewText: We got a lot of attitude during check in because we used Expedia.  We had listed 3 adults but the room had only one bed.  When we requested a roll away we were told none was available.  If we had an issue with this we should call Expedia.  Later in the evening we asked for a roll away again and low and behold one was available.

review.title: Perfect San Fran location!
review.reviewText: Beautiful hotel. Easy access to BART, Ferry Building, and fabulous dining in the area.

review.title: Nice hotel right on Embarcadero/Piers
review.reviewText: Beautiful hotel with great service from the front desk as well as the bartenders at the Eclipse Lounge/Restaurant.
review.negativeRemarks: Needs a swimming pool and jacuzzi to complete the great hotel package
review.locationRemarks: Located on embarcadero across from the big 1915 clock tower. Great view of the bay. Close to all the restaurants and day and night life on embarcadero

review.title: Close to attractions
review.reviewText: Arriving to our room we were greeted at door with 2 overflowing room service trays from previous guests which made us wonder if room was ready. Upon entering room it was clean except balcony area which was full of cigarette butts.
Decent location if you don't want to be surrounded by every other tourist... and great if you're in town on business in the financial district.

review.title: Perfect Location
review.reviewText: Easy location to find.  Nice room, great view.  Spacious bar with good appetizers and courteous staff.

review.title: Beautiful Hotel close to everything
review.reviewText: Wonderful hotel, beautiful lobby. Helpful and welcoming staff. Only problem was extremely loud wedding/band in lobby made it impossible to relax if the afternoon and evening. It was like annoying din piped right into our room on the 10th floor.  As much as I liked the place, I won't be going back if they keep allowing that kind of noisy intrusion into an otherwise calm, peaceful atmosphere.

review.title: Modern hotel in a great location
review.reviewText: Modern hotel in a great location overlooking the Ferry building. We went for a bay view room, which was definitely worth the extra money, as beautiful views, especially of the sun rising and setting. 15 minutes walk to Pier 39, China town, and shopping area. Tram and Muni stops right outside hotel, if you wanted to go further afield. Room was spacious, clean, and comfortable. Breakfast buffet was extensive, varied and good value. The atrium was really pretty. Staff excellent and friendly, went out of there way to help.
review.positiveRemarks: Great location, bay views, comfortable room, friendly staff, extensive breakfast.
review.negativeRemarks: Better lighting in the rooms and quieter air conditioning!
review.locationRemarks: Buy the Citipass, if you stay more than 4 days. Go to Californian Science Academy, North Beach, Pier 39, Exploratorium, Chinatown, Haight Ashbury etc

review.title: Great locaton
review.reviewText: Just a block from the Ferry Building so easy to get everywhere by foot. Very nice upscale hotel. Not a bad value for SF with a nice breakfast included. Our room was not cleaned one day, but that may have been a misunderstanding with a staff member. Room was very nice.
review.negativeRemarks: Nothing to speak of
review.locationRemarks: Great location at the end of the BART and Trolley car line. Near Ferry building and a couple mile walk to Fisherman's Wharf.

review.title: Excellent Hotel
review.reviewText: Very nice place. Friendly staff. Great location. Couldn't have asked for more.

Way over priced. Advertised as room with a view of the bridge. What bridge???  Advertised as room for 4 people (with one king size bed). Of course rollout bed is additional $25. And with a rollout bed There is no room to walk around a room. Almost $500 a night even refrigerator was empty.

review.title: Great location.  Most staff was courteous.
review.reviewText: Breakfast deal was a total rip off.  They push the rest of the guests to purchase the buffet as well.  It was like dealing with a sales person at the breakfast table.  Was not pleased.  Very expensive breakfast.
review.negativeRemarks: breakfast deals.
review.locationRemarks: great location.  close to many things such as transportation, restaurants, etc.

review.title: High price tag for your return
review.reviewText: Excellent location, rooms can use some improvement, facilities are ok, but the weakest links of this Hyatt are the restaurant and cleaning staff, at least the one that clean my room.  The food quality do not match the prices.  Some restaurant staff are rude and it looks like they hate their jobs.  Room cleanliness is not their best; there was a particular smell in my room - like a wet carpet or dirty socks - I ran into the cleaning lady and told her about it and after I gave her a tip, and then she told me to call downstairs.  I felt hussled :).  The best asset this Hyatt has is the location, it's right in the middle of everything.

review.title: Beautiful hotel in a great location.
