review.reviewText: We enjoyed our stay here.  They allowed our dog and there is a beautiful grassy park right outside the hotel to take your dog in the middle of the city.  Quiet, clean and fun area across from the ferry building.

review.title: Great location
review.reviewText: I have booked at this hotel as it was the host hotel for San Francisco Marathon and it is close the start line of a race that starts so early!  I really like the location, staff friendliness and breakfast options.  I highly recommend it for those who wants to stay in SF proper and experience the best of the city- scenery, shopping, dining and proximity for running on the waterfront.
review.locationRemarks: Across from the Embarcadero and Ferry terminal bldg, lots to do.

review.title: Perfect view to the ocean.
review.reviewText: Very pleasant hotel, nice view to the ocean and city. Breakfast was delicious, my daughter enjoyed her stay a lot.

review.title: Good Embarcadero location
review.reviewText: I like this hotel. It's dated, but still "fancy" in lobby. It is over priced and there is not much to do nearby after 11:00 pm. Nice walk to a Giants game and farmer's market Sat. morning is huge and good!

review.title: By the bay
review.reviewText: Overlooking the bay. Great view. Beautiful lobby, like seriously the most beautiful atrium level. Great service from staff. I ould reccommend checking out the Regency Club at the top level. One of the best highlight of our trip

review.title: Nice hotel close to everything in San Fco
review.reviewText:
Great hotel
Big hotel
Great location
Big rooms
Modern
Clean
Great Hyatt
Breakfast is very good

review.title: Overall positive experience
review.reviewText: My initial flight was cancelled so I was a day late to checkin, even after calling and letting them know I was still charged for the room. Then when I checked in, got a city view when I was billed for a bay view. And that's the worst part of it all. The staff was very accommodating and friendly, food was ok, room was super clean. Overall I would say a good experience after the initial fiasco.

photos.caption: Golden Gate Bridge from tour bus

review.title: Nice, close to public transportation venues
review.reviewText: Public street cars trolleys and buses stop in front of hotel. Tourist sights are within walking distance. Various food establishments are located nearby, as well as well as in the hotel. Foremost, we felt safe

review.title: Perfect location and great staff. Small room..
review.reviewText: We stayed here the night we got married. The staff made this experience excellent. The facilities were nice and the view was perfect. We were "upgraded" to a nicer room on the top floor and received champagne!  Only gripe was that the room was much smaller than it appeared in the photos. Other than that, a stellar stay. Enjoyed the views from the regency lounge.

Very nice lobby in a nice location in San Francisco. The bathroom floor was slanted and water ran into the next room and soaked the carpet. 
They offered free filtered water on each floor, which was a ice perk. Overall, not a bad deal for a very expensive city.

review.title: Great location
review.reviewText: Excellent trip to San Francisco, hotel in great central location within easy walking distance of all areas

review.title: Very nice...easy access to everything.
review.reviewText: All very nice.  Service in the Regency Club was perfect.  Enjoyed every aspect of our stay.

review.title: Fabulous location!!! Perfect for families.
review.reviewText: great location! Ferry building is amazing and it is close to transportation! Will definetly stay here again!

review.title: Not a 4 star hotel.
review.reviewText: No minibar. No room service after 10pm. No easy access to water, food or drinks. Outdated carpets. Unable to hold bicycles at deposit or bell desk.

review.title: Bay view a must!!
review.reviewText: The view of the Ferry Building and Bay was remarkable. With so much activity going on below I'd recommend the upgrade.  When window is closed I did not notice the noise from the street below. But when the window is open so much to hear including late a night serenade from a saxophone. Awesome locale to many top attractions in SF.

review.title: Excellent  hotel in the  financial  district.
review.reviewText: Outstanding  hotel.  Modern  accommodation and  great amenities.  Close to everything and transportation  to all major  points of the  city. An awesome hotel.

review.title: Wonderful location!
review.reviewText:
Beautiful hotel, attentive, welcoming staff, gorgeous lobby.  We especially loved the location by the waterfront and easy access to public transport.
Check in and check out was an easy breeze which I especially appreciate when I am tired and want to enjoy my room.
However, the room was tight for 4 people (3 women and a child) and the beds were small (doubles, I believe) but were very comfortable.  Also, there is only one bank of elevators so it is quite a walk from your room if you are located on the opposite side of the hotel.
Our room had been set up for only two people (2 sets of towels, 2 glasses, 2 coffee cups, etc,) despite our reservation for 4.   However, after phoning down to the front desk our needs were immediately rectified by housekeeping, which I appreciated.
Loved our stay!
review.locationRemarks: Perfect location and easy access to cable car, Chinatown, Ferry Bldg. F train (5 minute ride to Fisherman's Wharf).  Starbucks, Walgreen's, Taco Bell

review.reviewText: This was our first time staying in this hotel. We asked for an extra bed 3 times and had to keep requesting extra towels each day.  There was absolutely no welcoming feeling for us.  We will stay at Marriott next time.
review.positiveRemarks: The closeness to what we wanted to do.
review.negativeRemarks: We called the hotel front desk a couple of times and no one answered the phone.

review.title: Great hotel in a great location.
review.reviewText: We stayed for two nights and liked everything about this hotel. The location was great, the decor was nice, everything about the room was great. We even had a bite to eat in the restaurant and enjoyed the food. We will definitely stay here again.

review.title: Paid for upgrade, had to move
review.reviewText: Air conditioner was horrible loud/ broken! Had to move rooms next day!

review.title: Well worth the price
review.reviewText:
The Hyatt Regency is a great architectural hotel.  John Portman knew how to dramatize a space.  Unfortunately now (June 2015) the Atrium of the hotel is under construction and remodeling so the space cannot be fully realized yet. I hope they complete that soon.  
Though I had been there before, I forgot the long haul down the halls to your room if you ended up on the bay side (the best for views).
It's location is prime location near some very good restaurants and the shops along the pier are literally steps away.
A friend and I booked two room with king size bed in each. We had no complaints about the cleanliness, facilities and size.
This is an 'almost 4 star' hotel.  Once the atrium/lobby is finished it should be 4 star.

review.title: Great location and rooms!
review.reviewText: For a combination of work and play you can't beat this hotel.  The access to the financial district, Bart station, easy walks to Chinatown, Coit Tower, a bit farther walk but very do-able to Fishermans Wharf and Union Square!  But best of all, right by the Ferry Building with its wonderful Saturday morning farmers market.  And the room had a roomy fridge for those yummy food items we bought to save for late night snacks!  Easy to buy perishables and run them back to the room before continuing on the day's adventures!  So if you need to come for work, do your work during the week and stay on for the weekend and stay at the Hyatt.  You'll be glad you did.
review.locationRemarks: See above comments.

review.title: Somewhat happy with hotel
review.reviewText: Everything was good, except I didn't know about paying $68.00 for parking by the hotel until I was checking in. If I new about this high parking fee I might have picked a lower cost hotel. Everything else was good.
review.positiveRemarks: The area, the room was nice and quiet
review.negativeRemarks: let people know about the cost of parking before they check in
review.locationRemarks: location is great! lots of things to do in walking distance

review.title: Wonderful view!
review.reviewText: Beautiful lobby!  And beautiful view from the room - got the room overlooking the ferry building - I believe there is only one like that per floor.

review.title: Nice Hotel with a balcony and a view!!
review.reviewText: We enjoyed a beautiful weekend in the city and the room was quite nice!

review.title: Nice hotel and close to several attractions
review.reviewText: Walking distance to Ferry Building, Restaurants on the water and AT&T park. Very nice clean hotel with great staff. Highly recommend.

review.title: Nice stay for our Anniversary
review.reviewText:
We took a ferry to San Francisco from the East Bay.  That was fun and the Hotel is very close to the Ferry Building.  We had a room on the 8th floor that overlooked the Bay.  We could see the Bay Bridge, ferries, sail boats and ships on the water and activities of people and trolleys below onshore.  The Hotel lobby is amazing.

The Hotel staff members were  helpful and very friendly.  They seemed happy at their jobs.

The Hotel is within walking distance of many good restaurants and shops and isn't that far from Pier 39 and Fisherman's Wharf.  We walked there too and boarded the ferry at Pier 41 on the day we returned to the East Bay.

All in all it was a very enjoyable stay.
review.positiveRemarks: Mostly the convenience and friendly staff.
review.negativeRemarks: Maybe just more specials for lower price stays.
review.locationRemarks: The Hotel is within walking distance of many good restaurants and shops and isn't that far from Pier 39 and Fisherman's Wharf. We walked there too.

review.title: Good location
review.reviewText:
We particularly liked the location as it was away from the busy area of Fisherman's Wharf but close enough to walk there.
We were very pleased with the room and view given the rate we paid through Expedia.
The room was well equipped and clean and very comfortable. The sound proofing between rooms was good.
Overall we enjoyed our stay a lot.
review.negativeRemarks: The sliding door to outside could be better insulated as there was some traffic noise.
review.locationRemarks: Good location as walkable to Fisherman's Wharf but in a quieter location.

review.title: Great hotel with a fantastic location
review.reviewText: Checkin was simple and easy. Staff was professional but friendly. Loved that the room was clean and quiet with a great view. Will stay again

review.title: Nice hotel to go round in SF city!
review.reviewText: This hotel is located in the center of city. We go around in the city with the convenience we like it about this hotel.  The staff are friendly and it is comfortable to stay here. We surely would recommend this hotel to our friends who like to stay in SF for a few days to see the city.
No complaints. It was great. Service was great from checking in, getting a taxi and to room service. The hotel experience was nice.

review.title: Nice but not a 4star
review.reviewText:
Staff were ok but very slow.

Work being done in lobby area extremely loud and no advance warning at check in or booking time

Room was quite small for 2 adults
review.locationRemarks: Restaurants and fisher mans wharf are all walkable to reach

review.title: convenient to attractions, cruise terminal, food.
review.reviewText: Would certainly stay there again...early b'fast was excellent
review.locationRemarks: cruise port, harbor, restaurants, tours are all conveniently located by walking

review.title: I don't mind spending 6 - $900.00 on a Nice Room
review.reviewText: The room was very small and the bathroom and tub were inadequate. there was one picture in the room that was hung up directly behind the large TV Screen. The TV was nice to watch. There was no coffee table in the room either.
review.positiveRemarks: The Door men were warm, funny and welcoming. Very professional. Concierge were also very nice and accommodating as well as the Bell men.
review.negativeRemarks: Over Priced Movies, Redesign bathroom and add a coffee table or something to eat off of in the room.
review.locationRemarks: Location was great.

review.title: Mostly awesome
review.reviewText: The rate was great for this hotel. Unfortunately, we arrived to major jackhammer noise in the lobby. The hotel accommodated us by moving us to a higher floor, but we had to wait 70 min. to check in. So we got checked in a little later than we thought. A hiccup yes, but definitely not earth-shattering.
review.positiveRemarks: The location, the incredible view from the balcony.
review.negativeRemarks: The shower fixture was extremely outdated.  Time to freshen up!
review.locationRemarks: Right on the Embarcadero. Everything was within easy walking distance.

review.title: Very Nice Hotel
review.reviewText: First time staying here and had a great experience, except for a mix up with our booking at the hotel. Another person with the same name was also staying and the same room was booked for both parties. Hotel management handled things quickly and upgraded our stay since the mistake was on their part. Will stay here again when visiting SF.
review.positiveRemarks: Very nice! Amazing lobby area and great views of the city and bay.
review.locationRemarks: Close to Pier 39 and Union Square.

managementResponses.response: Please accept our sincere apologies. The construction noise is indeed an issue during our lobby renovation but it is exciting to see the amazing transformation when it is complete. We understand your decision and hope you will come back in the future to see the finished product.

review.title: Construction zone
review.reviewText: Hotel overall is good with the exception of the construction during our stay.  The loud noise was ridiculously loud & unacceptable. The staff doesn't even know the exact time on when the loud noise will stop. They gave us 4pm then we asked again & they informed us 5pm. But 5pm came & went & the noise was still going on. It finally stopped at 6pm.  We woke up the next morning & the noise started again at 9:30am.  This is too much & we decided to check out right away.

review.title: Not a great stay
review.reviewText: The rooms are small but location is good,the valet parking is too high, they can provide some water in the room

review.title: Great hotel close to all transport and Embarcadero
review.reviewText: We were a family of three adults travelling with an 8 month-old baby. The room was very clean and comfortable, quiet despite being in such a central area. The beds were great after a long day of walking, and wifi worked perfectly all the time. We got complementary breakfast and the food was abundant and delicious. Wed definitely recommend this hotel and would go back.
review.positiveRemarks: We liked the location, the room, the food, and the service was great.
review.negativeRemarks: We requested a crib when we checked in but then forgot to ask for it again and never had it at our room. We recommend requesting it in advance.
review.locationRemarks: There are plenty of small restaurants right outside the hotel, and Embarcadero is just crossing a street.

review.title: Recommend alternatives
review.reviewText: Excellent central location. Food excellent and breakfast is definitely worth it. Arrived to find large hair on the bathroom wall of the extremely small bathroom with a shower over the bath and a shower curtain that lets water flood the floor and the toilet is right next to the bath. This was meant to be a deluxe room too. The bathroom sink and mirror is simply behind a partial wall partition within the main bedroom and not very private at all. Then we discovered stale vomit on the floor of the bedroom! The duty manager reluctantly upgraded us, only upon my insistence after initially offering to cover the affected area with area freshener that evening and cleaning the carpet the next day if we could ensure we would be out of the room for at least half a day to allow this. The rooms otherwise are disappointing and overall probably equivalent of 3 star property. The gym is good. Location good but other properties probably better value for money with nicer and more obliging management team. I stayed at the Hilton last year and I think I will it return there next time.
review.negativeRemarks: Bedroom and bathroom layout is pretty awful. Cleanliness is a major concern. Management team need to significantly improve their customer service.
review.locationRemarks: Union square and Alcatraz are just a bus ride away. The BART station is just across the street fir arrival from the airport.

review.title: Nice hotel near At t park and water. Good eats
review.reviewText: Great stay, A lot of attractions around. Beautiful

review.title: Beautiful lobby and rooms with awesome breakfast
review.reviewText: We stayed at the Hyatt Regency for our wedding. The room was beautiful , clean and had a great view. However, the front desk experience was a little underwhelming. On my wedding morning, I asked to print a copy of my wedding vows before the ceremony and they referred me to their business center. I ended up being charged $20.00 and I only needed to check my email for 1 minute and print one black and white page of text.
review.positiveRemarks: The hotel has great views, friendly cleaning staff, and a great breakfast.
review.negativeRemarks: Staff had no reaction at all to our impending wedding. Didn't feel friendly for us.
review.locationRemarks: Hotel is near Pier 1 and across from convenient food places- Starbucks, 7/11, Walgreens.

review.title: Beautiful hotel in perfect location!
review.reviewText: Easy valet parking, quick and friendly check in, lovely room with great views, perfect location, enjoyed the Ferry Building shops and restaurants. Great hotel, would definitely recommend!
Surprising well appointed considering its age.  New bathroom fixtures and the Atrium has had a good makeover.

managementResponses.response: Thank you for your feedback on our restaurant staffs. I apologize for the confusion. Your review has been shared with my Restaurant manager.

review.title: Fantastic location.
review.reviewText: The only negative was the bar and bar menu. There are signs everywhere for Happy Hour and the waitress said they had just changed menus. However, there was only one red wine and no white for Happy Hour and no special drinks.  Staff didn't seem to have a clue.  Chicken wings were tasteless with boring BBQ sauce.   A disappointment in such a grand setting.
review.negativeRemarks: Bar
review.locationRemarks: Ferry Building is fantastic.  Walked to Exploratorium and Pier 39.  Walked to Chinatown.

review.title: Excellent hotel, fantastic location!
review.reviewText: We recently travelled in and out of San Francisco within a month so decided to try out 3 different hotels. Out of the three hotels (Hyatt Regency, Westin St Francis, Park Central), the Hyatt stood out to us as the best experience. We loved the location, we hung out and ate and shopped at the Embarcadero buildings, walked the Embarcadero all the way around to Ghiradelli Square and back, caught the commuter ferry to Sausalito, took the cable car up and down California Street, and walked to Union Square. It was great to be away from the tourist mecca of Union Square and the hotel has an elegance and freshness. The hotel is great, the rooms were fresh and modern, and the atrium style hotel foyer feels airy and modern.
review.positiveRemarks: The room was great, we had a balcony (we were there in March so it was good weather to sit outside and relax) and the ambiance was easy.

review.title: Beautiful hotel in a great location
review.reviewText: Friendly staff, clean rooms.  Perfect location.  You won't be disappointed!

review.title: Embarcadero
review.reviewText:
My friends and I ended up at this hotel after a night out. I had a better price from Expedia and they said they couldn't match it and I actually had to go through expedia. No biggie. They guy was nice and said he'd upgrade us to a suite for the inconvenience since it was late and they had some available. 
Some lady then came and took over for him and did not upgrade us like the nice man was going to do. She was the worst part of the experience.

review.title: Great location
review.reviewText: Room was great, large and comfortable, but the class doors ( window) were not cleaned
review.positiveRemarks:
View was great, bed was comfortable and room was layed out well. 
Plenty of lighting
review.negativeRemarks: Cleaning glass windows( doors)
review.locationRemarks: Near shopping , resturants and piers

review.reviewText: Check in was bad, I asked the front desk lady if there were any upgrades available and told me I already had a nice room, when I get to the room, big dissapoinment, she gave me a room in a corner with too little space (I had already upgraded), when I go back to let her know that I wasnt happy with the room, she gave me an upgraded one and mentioned she wouldnt charge me the 45 dlls difference. (I thought there were no upgrades available)

review.title: I use to love her....
review.reviewText:
I use to love this hotel...
prepaid for ocean view room, upon check in,  got charged another $25 for an ocean view, they called it a room upgrade,
also I had bought 2 cocktails at the downstairs lounge for $16 (happy hour prices) gave a $20, the cocktail waitress keep the full amount and never returned my change (she shouldn't assume it was her tip, that's called stealing) plus she keep pestering my wife and me every 5 minutes, nothing is more annoying then when a staff member continues to interupt conversations between a married couple trying to enjoy their anniversary evening (maybe it's a whites only hotel), also $5 transportation fee everytime you order over priced room service. The parking situation is a joke,  Yeah... that being said.... I'm migrating back to the Hilton as my chain Hotel.  This place truely needs to be down graded to a 
3-STARs!
review.positiveRemarks: they do have a good kitchen...
review.negativeRemarks: cleaner rooms, floors and walls were dirty especially behind the nite stands, desk etc. (dust bunny central), the I-phone radio in the room was broken
review.locationRemarks: with the exception of the sewage street smell, the location to the tourist attractions were super close.

review.title: All Amenities were only a few feet away.
review.reviewText: From check in to check out, the efficiency was marvelous. Complimentary newspaper, and breakfast buffet was a plus. The service was phenomenal overall. The Regency club lounge was an extra highlight with complimentary foods, and beverages, massage chairs, and the view of the city was exhilarating. The rooms were spotlessly perfected, with the beds were so comfortable. There were eco friendly recycling bins in our room. The staff, and service was genuine. We will definitely come back for more VIP treatment.
review.positiveRemarks: There were plenty of plugs for our electronics. The Regency Club was a highlight overlooking the bay and bay bridge. With complimentary foods,beverage
review.negativeRemarks: There is no reason for 2 soap holders attached to the wall of the shower/tub. There was one high holder, and one low holder.
review.locationRemarks: The cable car was a few steps away. Shops were all around. Restaurants were all around. Buses were all around. What more could we ask for?

review.title: Nice hotel with excellent facilities.
review.reviewText: I would say that my experience in general was pleasant. The staff, with the exception of some waiters in The Eclipse restaurant, was very professional.
review.positiveRemarks: The facilities definitely. Fitness center very clean and organized. I was definitely impressed with The Regency Club 360 view and its amenities.
review.negativeRemarks: The Regency Club food could be better. When I thanked a The Eclipse waiter for serving me coffee his answer was "yeap." Totally inappropriate!!
review.locationRemarks: Location is great and I found plenty of things to do and places to go to.

review.reviewText: Clean Room, breathtaking views, and great location.
review.negativeRemarks: N/A
review.locationRemarks: Great eats, and easily accessible to the heart of downtown SF

review.title: Location location location.
review.reviewText: Clean and comfortable.. Helpful concierge.   One mile walk to union square ( flat and easy walk). Near shopping. Close to the ferry building and weekly farmers market.  Also great if you are dining at One Market.

review.title: Great location, spectacular view of clock tower
review.reviewText: Beautiful hotel, nice room, a balcony that opens to a magnificent view of the clock tower of the ferry building as well as the bay and bridge. Starbucks coffee in the room, comfy bed and bedding. Perfect for my quick one night business trip!
review.positiveRemarks: lobby, room furnishings and style, view from the room
review.locationRemarks: Across the street from ferry building clock tower (market, shops, restaurants), one mile from museums, 1-2 miles from the piers and fisherman's wharf

review.title: Close to Pier activity
review.reviewText: Needed to have more people at reception desk, the times I walked down to bar area always a line to check i and with only two people working the desk.  Bell boy service great and also out curb and car service people great
review.positiveRemarks: Close to where I needed  to go
review.negativeRemarks: Front desk needed more people working, you are getting a good price for the room, get more people at front desk
review.locationRemarks: N/a

review.title: Walking distance to the embarcadero.
review.reviewText: Great hotel.  Very friendly staff.  At check in the clerk had some trouble finding my reservation, but once she found it she offered a late check out at no additional charge  (2:00 pm). Valet parking staff was very friendly and helpful .  Restaurant left something to be desired, but when you're in San Francisco who wants to eat at a hotel. Short cab ride to North Beach and really good Italian food.

review.title: Great Location for business travellers
review.reviewText: Breakfast limited and not too tasteful. Could have done with more variety on the buffet given its price tag of $24 + tax.
review.positiveRemarks: Location for business - very close to financial district. Bay view rooms had a good view and Balcony
review.negativeRemarks: Food variety
review.locationRemarks: Its the financial district. Cable car and Bart station right on doorstep but all touristy stuff is further away

review.title: Super Convenient to Many Attractions
review.reviewText:
You just can't beat the ease of travel to and from this hotel. BART stops just below the front door so access from either SFO or OAK can't be bettered. There are always taxis out front and buses to every part of the city can be boarded within two blocks. The Ferry Building is just across the street with boats headed for everywhere on the Bay.

The property has been well maintained by a single chain for about 50 years. The latest round of improvements have included upgrades to the bathrooms with much improved lighting. It remains one of the most architecturally interesting hotels in San Francisco and in the country. One need not have much contact with the staff, but they are uniformly friendly and helpful. It is remarkably quiet even though it is always full while we are there.

The views are remarkable especially toward the Bay. We stay here several times each year and never consider changing to another hotel.
review.positiveRemarks: Location and the look and feel of the place.
review.negativeRemarks: New bathrooms are short on towel bars.
review.locationRemarks: There are a half dozen destination restaurants within walking distance. The theaters, opera and symphony halls are a quick taxi or bus ride away.

review.reviewText: First time there and like it.  Breakfast is OK.  Glad to recommend.

review.title: Finally Got to Stay to Celebrate Engagement
review.reviewText:
I was surprising my honey who was flying in from Japan just to see me so that we could celebrate our engagement. Check in went smoothly, and the room was great!  My room was also on the side of the hotel in the middle of the array of balcony bay view rooms. Understandable considering the price I paid versus what I knew it to be from the Hyatt's website. But I was disappointed that I couldn't see the Ferry Building at all. I had called ahead saying it was for my fiance and at the front desk; I was a little surprised they didn't offer anything like the wonderful upgrades I got at the Hilton many times and the Trump Hotel for minor things such as graduation or something. Call it entitlement, the price here was quite low actually. I remember other Hyatts not meeting expectations too.
The cons were actually quite bad. The absolute worst was the construction going on in the Atrium. Power drills that filled the ENTIRE hotel with horrible construction sounds. I wish I was notified of this at any point, be it the reservation, the call to confirm, check in, etc. The room did a great job of buffering the noise, but the horrible thing was the morning before check out. We didn't see the little insert for "Do not disturb" and check out was 11AM so we didn't expect them to come so early. We yelled no when they knocked but with the construction noise, they couldn't hear and entered at the WORST time. We were "busy" and a little panicked when they came in anyway. I paid a low price, but..
review.negativeRemarks: Customer service
review.locationRemarks: The Ferry Building is just across the way and the Embarcadero Shopping Plazas and Downtown are so close!

review.title: Great stay!  Nice hotel in a good location.
review.reviewText: I was in San Francisco for business.  The hotel is in a good location close to the main areas in downtown.  It was clean and the staff was helpful.  Also the area was pretty good as compared to some of the other areas I have stayed.

review.title: Fancy hotel near most sites.
review.reviewText: Beautiful and luxurious. Parking is additional. it was close to most of the sites I wanted to see.
They could not find my reservation when I first arrived but were able to book me a room.
review.negativeRemarks: The carpet is a bit dated and the lobby is as well.
review.locationRemarks: Great location, close to a lot of activities.

review.title: Beautiful hotel centrally located near major sites
review.reviewText: Super clean. The trolley was on the premises along with electric car. Near all the sites I wanted to stay.  Super 8 was close by and $20 cheaper but a dump. This was extremely classy.

review.title: Very nice hotel.Friendly staff
review.reviewText: Good place to relax and close to restaurants. A lot of sight seeing. If you have small kids, maybe not suitable because there is not much things for them to do.

review.title: Ruining a once great property
review.reviewText: Safe was defective, tired 7 times to fix it. Once when we checked in New Years Eve and then New Years day morning, staff was in our room 8:15 to 10:15 AM.  Still not fixed.Then offered a brunch coupon at 10:20,idiots, we had not yet been able to use the bathroom to get ready to go out. Then called at 10:30 wanting to come back with a specialist who would only be in the hotel for 20 min.. Told them no, we were trying to make a lunch date at 11:30 and using the room to get ready.  There was no room service New Years Day morning???, only the brunch which we could not prepare for because on the staff in our room.  The restaurant upstairs that rotated and was very upscale at one time, no longer can rotate and is closed. This was per an employee.  Management policies did not make us feel they were glad we chose their property, rather that we were fortunate to be there. NOT!!!!!!!  And won't again. I first stayed here in the late 70"s, decline is sad.
review.negativeRemarks: NEW management. An attitude which should be about the guests comfort and use of the facilities.
review.locationRemarks: Ferry building, Ferry, great restaurants near by, Boulevard, Tadich, Perrys, Yank Sing.

review.reviewText:
Stayed for one night it was comfortable and nice. The hotel was beautiful and clean. 
The room had an amazing view of the bay bridge it would have been nice to have a balcony to enjoy it more!

review.title: Perfect location, close to everything
review.reviewText: Great place to stay since it is close to everything. Only a few weirdos across the street by Starbucks but the norm for sf.
review.negativeRemarks: Maid service- why did she take our box of Kleenex from our room? We purchased it across the street. Weird.
review.locationRemarks: Ferry terminal building, little Italy, Exploratorium

review.title: Eh
review.reviewText: For how much I paid, it wasn't a good stay for me. I should of had more amenities like complementary breakfast, a microwave inside the hotel room, more elevators,  etc... just not enough for the amount I paid. But the hotel workers were real nice, I just feel they want to be a "high-end" hotel but it's just a big building with good views.
Beautiful place! View amazing. Rooms very nice and great location. Easy to go anywhere walking distance.

review.title: 4 star hotel without any facilities!!!
review.reviewText: This hotel is really big but there is only one bar/restaurant and nothing else! staff is not friendly except concierge desk.  AC was not working! there is not any mini bar at room! compare to service and its facilities so expensive!
review.positiveRemarks: It is in down town. very close to piers as well as shopping malls and tourism places in city.
review.negativeRemarks: Needs to add minimum 2-3 restaurants.
review.locationRemarks: Very good location. Close to public transport and shopping areas.

review.title: Not the quality expected of the Hyatt name!
review.reviewText: Partially used bar of soap was in the the shower soap dish
The hotel was nice, but in the back of my mind i was still unhappy about expedia.

review.title: It was good experiance
review.reviewText: It was good experiance. The hotel is clean and staff are freindly. Location  is strategic and the view was great.

review.title: Stayed just the one night
review.reviewText: Very nice staff, very clean hotel great room it was overall a very enjoyable stay.

review.title: Gorgeous hotel!
review.reviewText: Beautiful atrium lobby! Gorgeous Christmas setting. Fun happy hour. Sunday morning jazz music wafting in through our window. Beautiful view of Bay Bridge!

review.title: Great downtown location
review.reviewText: Spacious room, helpful staff.  Great location to ferry building, downtown, great nearby restaurants.

review.title: Terrible check in
review.reviewText:
To begin, expedia failed to provide my name properly so the front desk was unable to locate my itinerary. Even with my confirmation email info the clerk was unable to locate my reservation. During my registration, there was construction in the atrium, and the noise was extremely loud.  After contacting expedia and resolving the problem I went to my room. The room appearance was dated. There were
Carpet stains, scratches on the funiture, small bathroom, and a hole in the bed skirt. I contacted the front desk to change rooms, which they did. The second room provided was an improvement.

review.title: My stay was fantastic
review.reviewText: It is close to everything, great room, clean, great staff. I will definitely be back

review.title: Comfort away from home
review.reviewText: As soon as you step in to the hotel the staff is nice and attentive. The room are so clean and beds are very comfortable. The rooms are very spacious didn't really feel like I was in a hotel room.

review.title: Beautiful hotel!
review.reviewText: We plan to always stay here when visiting the city!!

horrible access if you arrive in evening traffic , confusing to find even with gps. one hour to go 1 mile, parking at hotel $ 65.00  a shocker to me , but maybe I am to old and out of touch with the world today

Checking counter staff is very friendly.
Next visit to SF, I will stay here again
review.locationRemarks: Bart station

review.title: Great beginning to the holidays
review.reviewText: Love the Hyatt. Staff is very friendly and helpful,rooms were clean and Christmas decorations were beautiful really got us into the holiday spirit.  This hotel is directly across from Bart if you want to go downtown.Trolley stops right across the street if you want a ride to pier 39 and wharf cost $ 2.25 . Food in the resteraunt was good but a little pricey but it is a Hotel resteraunt.  Will return next year again. Also Starbucks right across the street.
review.positiveRemarks: Convenient to everything and not as busy as downtown
review.negativeRemarks: It is right in the center of the embarcadero surrounded by tall buildings so not much of a view but we were not in the room enough to care.
review.locationRemarks: Pier 39 is within walking distance but take the trolley its cheap it is about a mile and a half.  It really is convenient to everything because Bart i

review.title: convient to Bart
review.reviewText: Excellent location to the Ferry building, Bay bridge and piers.

review.title: Not good
review.reviewText: Molded food, house keeping terrible, management have no people skills

review.title: Beautiful hotel, convenient location to the Wharf!
review.reviewText:
Stayed for 2 nights around the tree lighting time in prep for Christmas! Beautiful lobby; stayed on the 3rd floor----a little loud through the night and hearing seagulls in the early morning--- but we were pleasantly surprised to find earplugs and white noise machine by our beds.

Self parking and valet parking quite expensive; but self park was right next door and easy to get to. Valet parking was also very efficient and quick if you use the texting feature to hail your car. Definitely would stay here again.
review.negativeRemarks: The concierge services could use some improvement with being more accurate with their information.
review.locationRemarks: The Ferry Bldg is right across the street with tons of eateries and great foodie-type of shopping. Quick drive or  to many great sights around SF town

review.reviewText: My experience at hotel was pretty good.  I felt safe and secured but the parking situation should be fixed. It was too expensive ,guest  should get discounted parking.
review.negativeRemarks: your staff could help download luggage from the car when guest  arrive at your hotel..No one helped me with my luggage.and they were just looking.
review.locationRemarks: movie, museum

review.title: Don't trust concierge advice
review.reviewText:
The concierge desk gave us advice on transit to Levi's stadium. The muni train he sent us too wasn't open at the time we needed if we were going to catch the Caltrain. The bus he told us to catch from Caltrain to the stadium wasn't running at the time the first train arrives. The transit passes he suggested ended up costing more because of having to buy extra transit tickets, not to mention the cab ride to get to Caltrain in a panic due to the muni not being open followed by no train heading that way till after the first Caltrain would have departed. The last straw was that he told us our transit passes were good for all transit in San Fran. Failed to mention that they don't work on the BART so we couldn't use them to get back to the airport. We ended up buying passes that we didn't even come close to breaking even with and then spending loads on additional passes all from bad advice. 
We went back to the concierge desk the day after the game to give an account of the nightmare of a commute that they had caused through terrible advice and directions, they took our room number and then did absolutely nothing for us. 
On a separate note if they ask you if you want an upgrade for a bay view ask to see the room first. We paid $140 to upgrade for our 3 night stay. When we got to the room the view was a small sliding door in the corner of the room that you could only see if you walked all the way to the end of the room. Made worse by music till 11 and noise all night by the rink

review.title: Good Customer Service
review.reviewText: We checked in and there was a pungent smell of cigarette smoke. We immediately requested a new room, and was upgraded to a higher floor.  Service by front desk personnel was excellent
review.positiveRemarks: Proximity to the Wharf and within distance to many downtown attractions
review.locationRemarks: Chinatown, Bay Bridge, Financial District, Fisherman's Wharf were all within distance

review.title: Perfect location
review.reviewText: I booked this hotel due to its location right next door to the piers and public transportation.  Pricey parking at the hotel but great piece of mind not having to worry about my car while I roamed all over SF all day.

review.title: Internet
review.reviewText: $400 for a room and you have to pay for internet??
review.negativeRemarks: For $400 internet should be free.  Free internet is 2 stars to me so this makes this a 2-3 star hotel.

review.title: Great location in the Financial District
review.reviewText: Weekend get away with my wife. Excellent location in the Financial District in close proximity to the Ferry Building and the piers along the Bay. Helpful staff and Concierge. Numerous restaurants in walking distance, but helpful to make reservations in advance or be flexible where and when you eat. Great exercise facility. Efficient elevators with great views of the atrium.
review.positiveRemarks: Good service and support by hotel staff. Great ambiance with an impressive atrium. Ease of access to rooms via elevators.
review.negativeRemarks: Room lighting was minimal. On site parking is expensive. We parked at Golden Gate Parking garage and on street.
review.locationRemarks: Close to Ferry Building and piers along the Bay. Walking distance to Union Square. Next to BART and Trolley.

review.title: Better than expected
review.reviewText:
Way better than my expectations. The hotel does gear towards business travelers, but I thought it was just as pleasing for leisure travelers. 
The front desk was helpful and made our early check in a breeze. The atrium airy and surprisingly quiet. 
Our room which had a balcony view of the bay was decorated nicely, comfortable, quiet, and clean. It was larger than expected. 
I loved the location with great access to BART. I would definitely stay here again as the rate was quite reasonable, I slept well, and felt very comfortable.
review.negativeRemarks: I would febreeze the rooms.

review.title: GOOD LOCATION BUT...
review.reviewText: The hotel stay was ok.  The hotel staff reception were not friendly at all-checking in or out. Shouldnt hotels feel welcoming?  Even a 1 star hotel I am sure has a welcoming approach! It felt like a business transaction both times, not warm and fuzzy like you get in other places.  COME ON its a 4 star!  Get on it Hyatt!!   The room was clean no complaints there. If you get a room facing the street, Be warned that the windows are not thick enough, so though location is great...you will have to sacrifice a good nights rest for hearing street noise, trains and cars.
review.negativeRemarks: Front desk staff be a little more welcoming, its important!
review.locationRemarks: The hotel is near the embarcadero, Ferry building(which you good enjoy delicious bites to eat and drink) transportation all around, bay in front!

review.title: Go Giants !
review.reviewText: Memorable Trip.. The Giants just won the World Series and the parade and celebration happened in front of the hotel.
review.positiveRemarks:
Location, Location, Location -- No Need for rental cars.
Bart, Cable Cars, Buses- Public Transportation available within walking from hotel.
review.negativeRemarks: Common Areas, Lobby need updating.
review.locationRemarks:
Farmers Market @ Ferry Building, Fishman's Wharf, Union Square, Restaurants.
Too many to name . Concierge Service was very helpful- Please use it.

review.title: Hyatt Regency San Francisco
review.reviewText:
The standard of our room was very poor for the price paid.
The shower was broken when we go into the room and the bathroom in general was tiny. Even after fixing the shower was poor.
This what no what we expected from this type of hotel. If we had paid 1/2 of what we did, it would still be too much for the room we were given
Very disappointing. Expected better from the Hyatt Group
review.positiveRemarks: The Ambience was good as was the general look of the hotel both inside & outside
review.negativeRemarks: See Above
review.locationRemarks: Great location

review.title: Nice hotel
review.reviewText:
Location was nice, being close to the waterfront was a big plus. Our room was clean and spacious.

My only complaint is that Wi-Fi wasn't included with the room. Ridiculous in 2014.

review.title: Nice hotel close to the touristic areas
review.reviewText: My stay was very nice except the air condition fan in the  room made a very high noise

review.title: Hotel was very nice.  The staff was very helpful.
review.reviewText: The hotel is beautiful.  Staff was very friendly and helpful upon arriving at Hyatt Regency.  Ruth at the front desk was very sweet and thoughtful.  The atrium was so gorgeous, from the lights to the ambience of the lobby.   Our room was very clean.  The view was great, perfect place on the balcony to go out enjoy the perfect weather. You can see the water, Bay Bridge, Pier 1 from our room.  Hotel was in a central location that allowed us to walked to many of the places we wanted to visit.  Pier 1 is AWESOME, loved all the fresh veggies, fruit, bread and coffee.

review.title: great location; Bart easy acces from/to SF airport
review.reviewText:
Friendly staff at reception. Impressive lobby.
We booked a Regency Club Double Room. Room size was fine.It was disappointing though that the room did look a bit outdated- not fresh and not clean.The bathroom was very small.
The complementary breakfast, midday snacks, cocktails & hors d'ouvres services were good and that made up for the less impressive quality of the room.
Overall all staff were very friendly and helpful.
review.negativeRemarks: Better cleaning and improving the condition of room interior
review.locationRemarks:
Easy acces to all kinds of transport.Ferry Building accros the road.
Walking distance to many SF attractions. Cable car stop just outside.

review.reviewText: I did not get the room (king) i prepaid for and was garenteed through Expedia . Checked in at 3:00 pm on time and still was given a double room that didn't even have enough room for myself and my wife to sleep together was a total disappointment for the hotel and Expedia

review.title: Perfect breakfast buffet.
review.reviewText:
Very well-maintained room with wonderful beds made with clean duvets instead of the usual nasty bedspreads.  Love the sink & mirror 
arrangement as well, with separate shower & toilet.  Perfect breakfast buffet to start the day, included in our deal.

review.title: So relaxing and hotel was quite
review.reviewText: Super friendly staff and lots of amenities. Great location and the hotel bar was great too

review.title: Feedback is re: Expedia, not hotel
review.reviewText: I've stayed at the Hyatt Regency numerous times, but I don't think I'll reserve through Expedia again. That's because the room I was given was on a very noisy floor and it was probably my worst experience at that hotel ever.  I now realize there is a difference between reserving through the hotel directly and through a travel engine.

review.title: Very pleasant stay
review.reviewText: Very much enjoyed the stay for my business trip. Would recommend to friends and colleagues

review.title: Thanks for the memories
review.reviewText: My husband and I came to San Francisco for 3 nights to celebrate our 30th anniversary.
review.positiveRemarks: Great location, beautiful lobby.  Loved having an ocean facing balcony and the fortune cookies in the lobby were a cute touch.
review.negativeRemarks: Front desk staff could have been more engaged.  Basically did check-in with little interaction.  Did not like the carpet in the bathroom area of room.
review.locationRemarks: Great location.  Utilized Ferry Building for coffee/pastry in the mornings.  Bus tours were all great.  Hotel concierge was very helpful

review.title: Beautiful hotel with bay views
review.reviewText: Amazing hotel will definitely come back!!!! Wonderful staff and amazing food.

review.title: Beautiful atrium. Very close to the piers.
review.reviewText: Enjoyed our stay at this hotel. Would stay there again.

review.title: Hyatt Regency  AWESOME
review.reviewText:
Staff was very helpful, especially the concierge.  First time I've ever used them, and they helped us with getting around San Francisco.  We used public transportation ($2.25 per person), which this hotel is situated perfectly.  We did not try the cable cars, but the stop was right outside the valet door.  We were able to go the Beach (though a long ride), to Haight & Ashbury, Pier 39 and AT&T Park.  We went on a wine tour, which met across the road at the Ferry Building.  The return trip ended at the Ferry building using a ferry transfer across the bay.  We never had to walk more than 300 yards out of the hotel to get to some sort of transportation.    

My only complaint was aside from the breakfast offered at the hotel, there were not many morning restaurants to choose from except all of the coffee shops that offered pastries and bagels.

I thought maybe for the price of the room per night they might offer a van transfer to or from the SFO (airport), but sadly they do not.  They do have an outside van service which is reasonably priced @ $16/person.

Overall very pleased with the stay
review.positiveRemarks: Close to the public transit hub.  Staff and concierge very helpful.  Rooms were comfortable.
review.negativeRemarks:
For the price of the hotel, they did not have a van that would travel to or from the SFO.
There was a service available at $16/person--not hotel
review.locationRemarks: Located near the ferry building and Muni, probably at the most 300 yards away.Allowed us to go to the beach(long ride), pier 39 and AT&T Park.

review.title: Nice Hotel, Close to the Bay
review.reviewText:
Absolutely the easiest hotel in San Francisco to get to and from the SFO airport - and the nicest!  BART stops right below the front door. The striking architectural design has held up perfectly over many years and constant attention has kept the rooms looking like new. We have stayed here many times and have never been disappointed.

Over many years the facility has been well maintained. Our interaction with the staff is fairly limited, but always pleasant. 

Every room we have ever stayed in has been nicely laid out and well equipped. They have all had interesting views of the City or the Bay.

In a city where it is often tempting to bring food back to the room the small refrigerator is a real bonus. There is also plenty of drawer space in the attractive furniture.

Our only nagging negative is the lack of free internet service in the rooms.
review.positiveRemarks: The design, the location and the quiet are very appealing. All the rooms are very nicely appointed.
review.negativeRemarks:
After the latest upgrade of the bathrooms, there are too few towel racks.

No free WiFi in the rooms is almost a deal-breaker!
review.locationRemarks: Very close to many of our favorite restaurants. Public transportation or taxi service to virtually everything else San Francisco has to offer.

review.title: great location.
review.reviewText: Next time will catch the BART in from the airport as it is SO close to the hotel entrance..  Close to most things in an easy walking  city. Great restaurants close by and city transport easy and close.

review.title: Very nice
review.reviewText: The only thing that would be helpful would be get some new lighting in the bathrooms it's not a living room you need to see in there.  The make up mirror is even worse.  I had a wonderful time perfect but I might have scared people there since I couldn't see

review.title: Close to everything in San Francisco
review.reviewText: Modern with every room facing the outside of the building. Large central auditorium but no relaxing by the pool area that I could see. The hotels position in San Francisco is it's major selling point.

review.title: Just about as good as it gets in San Francisco.
review.reviewText: Huge room, great bar, convenient location, and what we're really all looking for - a super comfortable bed in a quiet room.
review.userLocation: formerly Bay Area, now in Oregon

review.title: Hyatt's are dependable
review.reviewText: Booked the hotel literally on our way up to San Francisco. Good rate. Good location between waterfront and Union Square. Older Hyatt but updated and comfortable.

review.title: Elegant Hotel and Perfect Location
review.reviewText: I know this hotel has been around for a long time and it's been 20 plus years since I last stayed here.  I was pleasantly surprised at how comfortable and well kept the hotel is and just loved the balcony and view of the Bay.  The location is convenient to shopping, restaurants and the piers.  This will be a more frequent destination when enjoying a trip to San Francisco.
review.positiveRemarks: I really liked everything from the rooms, balcony, lobby and location.  Not much to dislike.
review.negativeRemarks: Parking but that's always a problem in SF.
review.locationRemarks: As I said above, you can walk to the piers, to some outstanding restaurants in the financial district and lots of shopping at the Embarcadero.

review.reviewText: Beautiful Hotel. Excellent location. Service is excellent.  Cozy, convenient.

review.title: Awesome looking hotel!
review.reviewText: Staff was very friendly and helpful! Hotel was easy to find. View of bay from room. Room was very nice, clean and spacious. Bed was very comfortable and soft! Went to an evening baseball game and was within walking distance about 1 mile. Wonderful walking along the piers!
review.positiveRemarks: I think their beds were the most comfortable. Architecture of the building was great.
review.negativeRemarks: Parking was a little on the steep side.
review.locationRemarks: Wonderful restaurants across from hotel. Baseball game within walking distance.

review.reviewText: Trouble with the wifi but overall it was great for our business stay. The regency lounge has great views

review.title: Great Location
review.reviewText: Overall good. Sliding patio door did not work. Had to be fixed 3 times never did get it working. Great location. Staff was polite. Beds and pillows were excellent.
review.negativeRemarks: Fixing the patio door
review.locationRemarks: Close to everything.

review.title: Nice hotel in downtown San Francisco.
review.reviewText: Overall a very nice experience. Great location. Staff very positive. Food was delicious.
Perfect hotel, directly across from Ferry Building. Everything was perfect.
review.positiveRemarks: Staff was very accommodating. Loved sitting at the lounge at night enjoying a light dinner with a class of wine. We often chatted with the staff.
review.locationRemarks: Perfect location on the Embarcadero. Loved shopping at the Farmer's Market. Walked to Fisherman's Wharf , Chinatownand Italian section for dinner.

review.reviewText: Great. Loved the location close to the train station and sites.
review.positiveRemarks: Great service and amenities. Friendly staff.
review.negativeRemarks: For that price, Wi-fi should DEFINITELY be included.

review.title: great location
review.reviewText: Pleasant and helpful staff. Beautiful view from balcony.
review.locationRemarks: Close to Embarcadero, Ferry bldg., Piers

review.title: LOVED the Regency Club & Staff!
review.reviewText:
Worth the extra money to get to go up to the Regency Club.  They offer several times you can go to the top and enjoy food/drinks.  For the price you are paying for the rooms, they should be in top condition.  The bathroom needed a little TLC on it's fixtures & shower head (kept sliding down while taking a shower) :/
Will think twice about spending that kind of money for a room like that.
review.positiveRemarks: LOVED the Regency Club & Staff.  They were very friendly and helpful.  Good food & great amenities(free wi-fi, computer w/printer, massage chairs, etc
review.negativeRemarks: Towel rack near sink kept falling off, shower head was a handicap model and it slide down the pole while you took a shower.  Won't stay in place.
review.locationRemarks: Great views! Since in financial district, food places closed up around 6pm (plan around that)

review.title: I would choose a different area next time
review.reviewText: great location as far as being able to get around.  Bart, busses and cable car all right out front.  also bike rental right around the corner, as well as the Ferry bldg.  this was good as we tended to leave the area for the day.  hotel was very big.  i have some mobility issues, and would have requested a room closer to the elevators had I known how far I was going to have to walk. the open lobby made it a little noisy at times.
review.positiveRemarks: cable car stops right out side of the hotel, and I never saw this stop busy.  we hoped on no problem.

review.title: What a view!
review.reviewText: We were able to upgrade to the Hyatt room and were very pleased. It was comfortable and spacious. The view was amazing! You could see and hear the many activities of the city. I wouldn't recommend this room if you are looking for a quiet room but we love the city noise and movement so it was perfect for us.
review.positiveRemarks: Everyone working in the hotel was friendly and helpful. The Stay Fit gym was great and fully funtional. Thank you Hyatt we had a great time.
review.locationRemarks: Everything is close. Trolley. Bart. Shopping. China town. The Pier. When we didnt feel like walking the helful doormen made it easy to get a cab.

review.title: Good Location
review.reviewText: Sent the night after returning from Napa, the hotel was clean and well maintained.   Walking distance to the AT&T ball park for baseball.  Great location for most other tourist sites.
review.negativeRemarks: Check in staff was hit and miss with customer service.

review.title: Nice hotel, close enough to walk to Wharf.
review.reviewText: The hotel was clean and nice. We had a beautiful view of the Bay Bridge. We walked to excellent dining and sight-seeing spots.
review.negativeRemarks: Parking was too expensive!!!

review.title: Old hotel with no real dining options. Noisy rooms
review.reviewText: Paid top dollars for a room on a weekend ($350 ) and was greeted with: zero points since I booked at an online travel site. I was told that I could not pay for access to the Regency lounge since it was 'full'. The only dining option is an open cafeteria style hall at the bottom of the hotel that is exceedingly noisy and which plays auto-pop (machine 'music') with the same verse over-and-over again for 8-12 minutes at a time (torture). You will get a better dining experience at McDonalds. The rooms are small, the furniture was probably installed 20-30 years ago and looks like what we had in our house in the 1980s. If you give up and try buying your own snack in the gift store you are in for a 'treat'. You cannot charge anything to your room from the gift store unless you show ID, room key and sign 3 (!) different receipts. The process takes 10  minutes. Once in the room, the bed is comfortable, but you will be charged $9.95 to use the internet, and there is no mini-bar in your room. There is also no coffee maker in the room (like Marriott and Hilton). So what you get is a run-down hotel that has seen better days and a service level and dining experience that is below any standard. All of this for the 'pleasure' of paying over $350 per night. The only good experience is the Consierge desk which is staffed by friendly and very helpful people. Stay away and pick any other 4-star hotel in SF, where you will most likely have a much better experience.
review.negativeRemarks: Demolish and build a new hotel (or do major renovation).  Start playing music in 'resturant' and not machine made noise.
review.locationRemarks: Great resturants next door with amazing service and food!!

review.title: The worst Hyatt Regence I have ever stayed.
review.reviewText:
1) The window needs to be improved for better sound isolation. The window facing the street is a nightmare for anybody who could not sleep well in the night. Change to use the up-to-date sound isolation windows to solve the problem. 
2) Internet can never work with my computer which is installed with Windows XP. And it works with all hotels. However, the internet does work with my iPhone, iPad and iPad Mini. Hotel could not solve this problem. 
3) Call for additional toilet paper in the noon but not delivered till late evening after another call to push. 
4) The corridor is too narrow. If you drag two pieces of luggages to your two hands, you can not get through. The luggage tend to bump to the wall.
review.negativeRemarks: Internet, Service, Sound Isolation
review.locationRemarks: The San Francisco Port is across the Embacardero. You can even walk to Fisherman Wharf or Union Square.

review.title: Hotel close to embarcadero with a view of the bay.
review.reviewText: Lovely stay. Staff was friendly. Great location. Would come back and stay here.

review.title: A wonderful stay
review.reviewText: We arrived at the Hyatt and was told our room was ready so the porter followed us with our luggage and off we went. As I got into our room the smell of cigarette smoke was terrible I asked for a non smoking room and I also thought it was a smoke free hotel. I called the desk and within minutes we where transfered to another room no questions asked. The hotel is in a great position surrounded by great restaurants and bars and walking distance to Fisherman's Wharf and all the activities SF offers. Our flight out of SF was a late one they gave me an extra hour before  check out at no additional fee they then minded our luggage and offered a safety deposit box for our valuables without charge. I would recommend this Hotel to family and friends without hesitation.
review.positiveRemarks: The staff, location, large rooms we had a balcony with beautiful views of the SF harbour.
review.locationRemarks: As mentioned above the location is brilliant surrounded by restaurants, bars and walking distance to Fisherman's wharf

review.title: Beautiful hotel situated in an ideal location
review.reviewText: We stayed here due to its great location to explore SF. Ideally situated close to the Ferry building and a 15 minute walk down to pier 39. The hotel has a beautiful interior with comfortable rooms. Will stay here again.

review.title: Top Notch
review.reviewText:
We arrived 3 hours before check in,mand were promptly given a room with a gorgeous view of the bay/ferry building.

Concierge services were so kind and informative. Beds were incredibly comfortable, and black-out drapes made for easy slumber. Everyone around us, above and below, were either very quiet or the rooms are well insulated and appointed to minimize sound.

We used 2 blow dryers and once, and blew the fuse for our whole room. Maintenance personnel arrived within 5 min. to reboot. The lounge was great for a happy hour nosh. Even the cleaning women were personable and friendly.

I highly recommend this hotel, since you can WALK everywhere! You only need a car service to and from SFO..Emerald 5 is the BEST!
review.negativeRemarks: Not a thing
review.locationRemarks: Near Ferry building. You can walk to Fisherman's Wharf (Scoma's😄), Ghirad. Square, pier 39, Union Square, China Town, pubs & rest. in downtn.

review.title: Our favorite place to stay in SF!
review.reviewText: Our favorite place to stay whenever we come to the city for Giants games, special occasions and just to get away.  The staff are the best, welcoming doormen and front desk agents, courteous and knowledgeable concierge and happy, friendly housekeepers who always greet you in the hallways. The valet are outsourced but also excellent.  The hotel is spectacular, best lobby EVER, clean and modern. Recent room upgrade is excellent and the rooms are as clean and comfortable as ever. I had a particularly pleasant experience with Ken at the concierge.  I had done a little research on some restaurants but I wanted a local's opinion and he was patient and very helpful. The location of this hotel is perfect for our needs. Our main reason for frequent visits to the city is for Giants games and we can just walk to the park from the hotel. It is easy to get anywhere from there via bus, metro, cable car, taxi or walking. The views are unbelievably beautiful from the bay side rooms and even the city views are wonderful. We just love this place, can you tell?!
review.positiveRemarks: Staff, location, amenities and how clean and comfortable it is.  We also love how consistently awesome it is.
review.negativeRemarks: The only thing I could possibly say needs improvement is that the vanity area could use a lighted, magnifying make up mirror. That's it!
review.locationRemarks: AT&T Park, Ferry Building market, Fisherman's Wharf, cable car stop.

review.title: Close to Ferry Building and Muni Transportation.
review.reviewText: Amazing.   Hotel staff great, perfect location.  Second time staying here.
review.negativeRemarks: Perfect
review.locationRemarks: Ferry Building, Muni Transportation.    Great location.

review.title: Weekend getaway
review.reviewText:
hotel was nice. 
room was not clean and they gave us room keys that didn't work.
People should be reminded its $60/day to park at hotel
Yes I understand its Frisco, but the value is just not there.
review.negativeRemarks: Room cleanliness
review.locationRemarks: Some restaurants and shopping were cloase

review.title: Great location
review.reviewText: within 5 minute walk to ferry building on the water; but hotel is huge, thronged with tourists,and needing some upgrades, and parking was $64 per night!

review.title: Great room and view!
review.reviewText: Attended business conference and loved my wonderful balcony room overlooking the Bay!  Could not be beat!  The cleanliness and presentation of room furnishings was extremely pleasant.  The location was terrific!
review.positiveRemarks: Location in city, easy access to public transportation and the fabulous balcony room with breath taking view.
review.negativeRemarks:
Conference rooms were not particularly comfortable or well laid out.
Restaurant very high priced and service minimal.
review.locationRemarks: This location is perfect.  Cable car and Bart right there...  Restaurants close by including great ones in #1 Ferry Terminal building.  Views super.

review.title: Room not ready had to pay 40 per night for upgrade
review.reviewText: Room not ready, had to pay upgrade for room that was, construction. All over lots of noise room does come with sound machine and ear plugs
review.negativeRemarks: Insulation for noise
review.locationRemarks: Ferry to anyplace in San Fran, cable cars at your door

review.title: Great location! Quick walk to Fisherman's wharf
review.reviewText: Outstanding staff, very accommodating.   Staff extremely pleasant
review.negativeRemarks: Free wifi
review.locationRemarks: So much to do and centrally located to all piblic transportation

review.title: Great views and location
review.reviewText: Beautiful hotel close to everything, amazing view of the Ferry building, great goat cheese burger, yum!!!

review.title: Amazing Hotel for the Price!
review.reviewText: I loved everything about this hotel - from the valet staff outside to the front desk staff to the lobby, the elevators, the room - I could not find a single negative thing about it. I am not well-traveled and don't stay in hotels often, but based on my limited experience, I will say that I would have expected a hotel this nice to cost a lot more. I asked about a room with a nice view and was given a room on the 14th floor, from which I had an incredible view of The Ferry Building, the Bay Bridge, the Bay itself - there wasn't much I couldn't see. I slept remarkably well considering the noise my first night there - which was the 4th of July, so the hotel is definitely not to blame for the chaos! The bed was amazing, the pillows were amazing, the bedding was amazing ... Need I say more? I was solo on this trip, but the room had enough towels for at least two people - which is a rarity! - and great water pressure - another rarity in hotels. Everything was clean and just absolutely beautiful. I can't say enough nice things.
review.positiveRemarks: EVERYTHING. There wasn't anything I didn't like.
review.negativeRemarks: I truly can't think of one negative thing to say - I wouldn't change a thing.
review.locationRemarks: There are tons of restaurants, vendors, stores, cafes, etc. It's within walking distance from The Ferry Bldg, Fisherman's Wharf, and lots more!

review.title: Hotel directly across from ferry building.
review.reviewText: The Hyatt is in a great location. Easy walking to AT&T Park, Union Square, and Pier 39.  We will stay here again.

review.title: Great view, room a little small.
review.reviewText: Had a great time!  The room was small but the view was outstanding!
review.positiveRemarks: The view from our room was great!
review.negativeRemarks: No

review.title: Nice hotel and close to several attractions.
review.reviewText:
First time to San Francisco. Hotel was very nice and within walking distance to most of the attractions.  

Downside was price of parking per night. $64 for valet or $32 self park but would have to move every 24 hours. Also no free Wi-Fi. For the price of hotel you would think Wi-Fi would be included.

review.title: Came back again  for our 40 Anniversary!
review.reviewText: Your concierge helped us celebrate our  40 anniversary with fruit & wine!  A lovely jesture that was sincerely appreciated!  Other than the outside construction and the "pride parade" noise, it was a lovely stay.  Thank you.

review.title: Wonderful room and staff
review.reviewText: Fabulous 47th anniversary celebration. Everyone so friendly. View from room of bay. Convenient for all forms of transportation. Second time here. Last time with our whole family.
review.positiveRemarks: Convenient for San Francisco. Public transportation within a block or two. Bart straight to hotel door from airport. Variety of food choices very near
review.locationRemarks: Amazing location. Two blocks to ferry building and ferry terminal. Street cars to many places. Bart from airport to hotel door.

review.title: Expect to pay $$$$ for parking and food
review.reviewText: Fancy place, no extras included. Cool lobby/lounge to hang out in. On 9th floor can hear the street noise. Many vangrants hanging around property.
review.negativeRemarks: Sound proof the window

review.title: Hotel close to the Ferry Building
review.reviewText: We loved our hotel stay. The view of the Bay Bridge and Ferry Building were beautiful. It was very easy to hop on the F-line and California cable car line. Loved the Ferry Building for breakfast and the farmer's market. Easy to take ferry ride to Sausalito. We would stay there again in a heart beat.
review.negativeRemarks: Parking price... we used another garage for half the cost.

review.title: Great bed.
review.reviewText: Great bed. Still amazing architecture. Conveniently across from the Ferry Building and shops.
review.negativeRemarks: Current construction on the street/Metro entrance in front of the entrance is a little bother.

review.title: Nice hotel at excellent location
review.reviewText: Amazing lobby, a must see, the architecture is awesome. The bay view was nice. Excellent location. Only downside is my room was the exact opposite of the elevator hub, they should have one in each corner!

review.title: Wonderful stay!!
review.reviewText: Let me start by saying Sheila with the Concierge staff was amazing. She was so helpful and knowledgeable!! Check in was very efficient. Daily valet charges were a little high but they were also very courteous!! Overall a 9 out of 10.

review.title: Beautiful hotel and staff! Enjoyed our stay
review.reviewText: Regency Club has the best views of bay and city! Food, drinks and staff were excellent
Fire alarm was beeping at 4 o'clock in the morning. It was beeping for testing again at 6am.

review.title: Very nice hotel in safe central area of San Franci
review.reviewText: Staff at hotel was excellent in planning events and making arrangements. Parking is very expensive and street construction was on going.
review.negativeRemarks: parking
review.locationRemarks: Fishermans wharf, transportation, China town, union square, Alcatraz

review.title: comfortable
review.reviewText: easy location, nice big room, good bed, good size tv
review.negativeRemarks: bathroom light switch needed repair
review.locationRemarks: open market fun! food places nearby.

review.title: Nice Hotel close to the Bart and buses
review.reviewText: No bath tub, strongly suggest you purchase regency club for great view of the bay and snacks as well as continental breakfast at specific times. Very convenient to catch the bart and bus. Boudin clam chowder in breadbowl right around the corner. Don't suggest going out after 8pm. Not much of a restaurant in the hotel. Great view of the bay with the regency club (16th & 17th floor rooms). Hotel only have 17 floors. Still doing construction outside the hotel. There is a computer and printer at the front desk so you can print your boarding pass. Overall, its a great place to stay and pricey.

review.title: Don't bother.
review.reviewText: The price of the room was approximately $240.00 for the Friday night we stayed & it cost $64.00 just to park. The hotel was nice & clean but incredibally outdated.
review.negativeRemarks: The rugs, our patio lock, the furniture.
review.locationRemarks: Chinatown

review.title: Friendly Staff
review.reviewText: The staff was very helpful and provided us with the necessary information we needed. We weren't sure what bus to take to visit the Golden Gate bridge and we were provided with the necessary information. The staff at the front of the hotel and at the lobby are very helpful and made us feel that we were inportant.

review.title: Awesome location and a beautiful view
review.reviewText: Breath taking view from our room everything you want to see in the city is a short walk or short ride in the trolley

review.title: Fantastic Hotel
review.reviewText: We stay in their Club top floor and the experience was great!
review.positiveRemarks: They have a fantastic top floor area for breakfast with unbelievable views.
review.negativeRemarks: Parking was very expensive
review.locationRemarks: It's in the heart of the city with plenty to do.

review.title: Great location
review.reviewText: Great location, Ferry building across the road for food, all transport at the door.

review.title: comfortable and well located
review.reviewText: great time in a clean, top notch hotel! staff was courteous and only downside was the lack of a regular restaurant.
review.locationRemarks: the PIER

review.title: Good Location
review.reviewText:
SF is the best city in the USA. Very European. over 3,000 restaurants and the fierce competition ensures great quality food.

We like the Embarcadero / Financial District because it is close to watering holes and eateries we like. Plenty within a 10 minute walk. You can catch the Cable Car right outside for a trip to Chinatown, Nob Hill or Union Square and also Fisherman's Wharf.
review.positiveRemarks: The architecture of the hotel is unique and very pleasing, both inside and out. Great views of the bay and Bay Bridge.
review.negativeRemarks: The bathrooms are due for an upgrade, but still roomy enough to keep my wife happy.
review.locationRemarks: Napa/Sonoma wine country are about an hour drive. The hotel has tours if you would prefer going with a group.

review.title: Upscale hotel near the Embarcadero
review.reviewText: Perfect location. We were able to walk with small children from the Port of San Francisco and Pier 1 to Pier 39 (Fisherman's Wharf) without any other transportation. Breakfast at the hotel was very nice. The hotel staff was very friendly. Very quiet and relaxing hotel. The bathrooms are small, but functional. This is the hotel to book if you need flexibility and independence.
review.negativeRemarks: Nothing to improve
review.locationRemarks: Embarcadero, Port of San Francisco, Wharf, Piers. Bay Bridge.

review.title: Awesome View
review.reviewText:
We had a bay view room with balcony. On the plus side, the view of bay and surrounding area wonderful. Waking up each morning to amazing sunrise and sounds of the bay were a real treat. The restaurant..lounge food was ok but overpriced considering the taste. The restaurant service was the best. Our server found out we were there to get married and went out of her way to make our dinner a special one.

The downside was the construction going on in front of hotel. Not hotel fault of course, but would have been nice to know when we booked through Expedia so to consider another location or at least expect it. For this class of hotel it would have been nice to have SOMEONE greet us and help with our luggage, or at least inform us the lobby to checkin was on third floor!!! We were in a limousine so I would think some sort of service upon arrival is not too much to ask.
Checkin was all business. I had to prompt the clerk to tell us about the restaurant, amenities, where the excercise room is located, etc... .
The room was ok, but so dusty! Considering the nightly rates, the housekeeping management is absolutely neglecting such an important aspect of a guests stay.

Having stayed at hotels throughout the world, I would expect the Hyatt name to offer more than what we received. What do guests want in a hotel? Good service and a clean room. This Hyatt unfortunately doesn't prioritize either.
review.negativeRemarks: Valet, housekeeping, and front desk customer service.
review.locationRemarks: In the heart of San Francisco financial district within walking distance of the waterfront and many good restaurants.

review.title: Great place !
review.reviewText: It's not our first time at the Hyatt Regency! We love it !

review.title: Just stayed one night. But very good location and
review.reviewText: Good experience. Friendly, helpful staff, nice restaurant

review.title: Great Location but not thrilled with the service
review.reviewText: The city was great - the location could not be better. The two disappointments we had - one of which shouldn't have happened was with regard to the room selection. We were a family of 3 - specifically paid the little extra to confirm we would have the two double beds with the bay view. We arrived at 9 p.m. local time (midnight our time) and were told they were so busy they just didn't have any rooms with two double beds and instead were giving us a king size with a bay view (and expecting us to be grateful that they were giving us that).
