After a few minutes of discussion she apologized - said that was the best they could do - but that the next day they would upgrade us to a room better suited for us. The next day, after a good bit of sightseeing etc., we went to the desk - explained what had happened and what we were promised. After about 15 minutes and a lot of discussion with a manager, we were given a room with the two double beds - view nowhere near as nice - and again, it was presented in such a way that they wanted us to recognize they were really doing us a favor. Some favor. My other complaint was the noise - but in reality that was beyond the control of the Hyatt.
review.negativeRemarks: Customer Service specifically at check-in.
review.locationRemarks: Great access to waterfront - cable cars & transportation in general.

review.title: Sleeping in the board room...
review.reviewText: Wow. Given the location and the price of this hotel, one might expect some touch of class or elegance. We were sadly disappointed with the "office like" decor with all the warmth and charm of sleeping in a relative's day office on vacation. I don't think we will be back...
review.negativeRemarks: Add some character and style to the rooms and make the guests feel like guests and not clients.
review.locationRemarks: Great location right across from the waterfront and walking distance from Fisherman's Wharf, etc.

review.title: Nice hotel
review.reviewText: It was the pleasant 3 nights stay. Excellent services.
review.positiveRemarks: Services, location, architecture of the building

review.title: Average stay with a couple of bumps
review.reviewText: When we arrived we were told we had been upgraded to a waterfront view which turned out to be code for we don't have a room with a king size bed you reserved and prepaid for. We hope you like the 2 full size beds. The next bump was we returned back to our room after a full day of sight seeing to find the room was not made with morning towels still on the floor and the bed still not made. These were BAU tasks that I thought Hyatt would have been able to handle. Fortunately, the rest of the stay was smooth sailing.
review.negativeRemarks: Cleaning service makes sure the rooms are cleaned

review.title: Concert and a ball game
review.reviewText: Great place would stay there again. Great location, staff, and room.
review.negativeRemarks: nothing.
review.locationRemarks: Embarcadero, ATT park

review.title: 2 Night Stay
review.reviewText: Absolutely horrible service from the restaurant staff. Girlfriend had to get up to tell the manager we were ready to order or else our order would never have been taken. When we finally ordered our food, it took 30+ minutes to get our food. To their credit, although overpriced, the food was good. Service however was awful. Room service on the other hand was better. Great room service staff and the food we ordered was great.
review.positiveRemarks: Beautiful decor, great view in our bay view room.
review.negativeRemarks: Service at the restaurant.
review.locationRemarks: You are on Embarcadero so everything is nearby. From the ferry building, to Alcatraz tours, Pier 39, Fisherman's Warf, etc.

review.title: great hotel and location
review.reviewText: Nothing bad to say. Great view and awesome balcony.

review.title: Location is the only perk to this Hyatt
review.reviewText: We didn't have the best stay. The hotel location is great, but the room is small for such a huge hotel. Also, check-in time is Noon, and housekeeping was knocking on our door at 8:30am! It was very disturbing since we were sleeping. And, the hotel staff was could care less that we complained. We would not recommend this hotel or go back. There are a lot of hotels in the city with better accommodations!

review.title: Not Worth the Money
review.reviewText: This hotel was nice, but I definitely feel like it was overpriced for what it was. The room was small, no view, by the description I was expecting a balcony but there wasn't one. The lobby wasn't as nice as I was hoping either.

review.title: Old facilities waiting for renewing
review.reviewText: First of all, even though this hotel is quite near the beach, various activities held in the square next to hotel make it very noisy. Furthermore, there are several floors in the hotel are doing reconstruction, this make the whole hotel looks so disorganized. I even waked up at 7 by a noise from piping repairing and even asked to check if there is a snake in my sink!

review.title: Valentines Day Trip
review.reviewText: Wonderful time. The food was great, location was amazing, and the bed was comfortable!!!
review.negativeRemarks: Nothing
review.locationRemarks: Pier 39, Ferry Building, etc

review.title: Fantastic decor inside....
review.reviewText: Smooth check in, good service, great location and an awesome elevator experience.

managementResponses.response: Thank you so much staying with us again and the 5-star review! We are thrilled you had a fantastic time in San Francisco. The City Pass definitely makes it easy to explore the city by the bay. We truly appreciate your loyalty to the Hyatt and look forward to welcoming you back again in the near future!

review.title: Second visit - still our favorite hotel in SF!
review.reviewText: Our second visit and still love the location and service. The hotel is clean, the staff extremely attentive and helpful, and everything was perfect. We purchased City Passes - which connected us to EVERYTHING. I love San Francisco - this city truly has the gift of hospitality. It remains our favorite get-away!
review.positiveRemarks: The staff. They are so accommodating and attentive to detail. I think the cleaning service noticed that we had colds. They left extra tissue boxes!
review.negativeRemarks: Cannot think of one thing!
review.locationRemarks: This hotel is located in the 'heart' of SF. It is close to transportation, shopping, food and attractions. We used City Passes. Highly recommend this!

review.title: I booked for abay view and they gave quarter view
review.reviewText: The room was joint and u can hear noises out side and the roof is leaking water to the lobby i didn't like the stay because they charge high and there is no spa

review.title: Great accomodations, great location
review.reviewText: Room was clean and comfortable and had a great view.
review.positiveRemarks: All staff was friendly and accomodating.
review.locationRemarks: Next time will come prepared to participate in more activities on the Embarcadero.

managementResponses.response: Thank you so much for your review. Congratulations on your anniversary! We are delighted to hear you enjoyed your stay with us. Your kind words on our staffs is our biggest compliment. We look forward to welcoming you back and celebrate many more special occasions with us!

review.title: Very convenient to the beach, Bart or Cable cars.
review.reviewText: We were in S.F. to attend a wedding and also celebrate an anniversary. The entire hotel staff from front door to room staff were well trained in being accommodating and tourist friendly. Food in restaurant and room service was prompt and well prepare.
review.positiveRemarks: Convenient location and met all our needs.
review.negativeRemarks: NA
review.locationRemarks: Location across from Ferry Building and beach front is very convenient for walkers. Bart line and cable cars right outside the door.

review.title: Excellent staff response to questions, problems an
review.reviewText: Site of Conference attended 2/2014. Staff were most responsive to questions/ concerns and needs. Arranged transportation to airport that was vital; provided microwave requested for room use; provided emergency access to room when "key" lost.
review.positiveRemarks: Site of Conference. Easy access to Port of San Francisco, cable cars, Bay.
review.negativeRemarks: Not the hotel's fault but rained entire weekend of stay. Delighted Californians, they had ha d no rain since November but discouraged our exploration

review.reviewText: Proximity to financial center is key

review.title: Nice hotel. Staff was awesome
review.reviewText: Wonderful experience. Would recommend hotel to everyone

review.title: Beyond Awesome in San Francisco
review.reviewText: We stayed at the Hyatt in San Francisco for our Anniversary weekend. We not only had an incredible view, but our bedding and room comfort was excellent. The Hyatt is within walking distance to most things San Francisco. We never did have to use our car. The staff was very generous and helpful.
review.negativeRemarks: Nothing really other than the faucet leaked.
review.locationRemarks: The Hyatt is at the Embarcadero Center...easy walking distance to the Wharf, Giants Stadium, and many local shopping and dining pleasures

review.title: Street noise a problem even on the 11th floor.
review.reviewText: We were on the 11th floor facing the Bay Bridge and could hear the traffic as well as people talking on the street below. The windows shook all night which made it difficult to sleep.
review.negativeRemarks: Windows should be fixed so that they don't shake and make noise which makes sleeping difficult.

managementResponses.response: Thank you for your feedback. We apologize for the poor experience you had. Our hotel is going through a rooms upgrade as we speak. All carpets will be replaced and furniture will be refurbished.

review.title: Carpet & sofa There's mant stains very dirty.
review.reviewText:
Room not clean & too old.
Carpet & sofa There's mant stains very dirty.

review.title: Rooms smell Great! Great views & location
review.reviewText:
Great experience!
Wonderful hotel, we'll definitely go back.
Parking is a downer

review.title: New Years Eve
review.reviewText: Great location for the New Years Eve Celebrations and comfortable rooms spacious enough for 2 adults and 2 children. Great New Years day breakfast buffet too.
review.positiveRemarks: Great location, impressive lobby area with wonderful "fake snow".
review.locationRemarks: Opposite the main Ferry terminal and all the attractions in Fishermans Wharf.

review.positiveRemarks: Beautiful view, comfortable bed, terrific location!

review.title: Good location
review.reviewText: We checked in on new year eve. It's good location for firework. Staff were nice. Lobby was impressed. However, the room and facility need to be updated especially for free WiFi. I don't understand why lux hotels consider WiFi must be an option and fee service.

review.title: Avoid this hotel
review.reviewText: Very bad experience . Banana is 8 dollars per piece

review.title: Nice hotel but construction/sloppy housekeeping
review.reviewText: I love the Hyatt experience, however we had several mishaps at this hotel. The biggest one was after returning from a day of sightseeing, housekeeping had left the door propped by the door bolt. Also, the hairdryer in the room literally exploded and almost caught on fire. Pieces ended up flying out of it and luckily did not hurt the person using it. After they replaced the hairdryer, there must have been a miscommunication because housekeeping returned while we were away and took our own travel hairdryer by mistake. Just sloppy. I found the front desk unfriendly and unhelpful but the concierge was great. The fitness room was nice. There was an ice skating rink set up outside for the holiday that was very LOUD but the views were nice.
review.positiveRemarks: Most people that worked there were very friendly
review.negativeRemarks: see above
review.locationRemarks: More to do in another location not in the financial district.

review.reviewText: Couldn't find my reservation when I arrived as name was spelled incorrectly. Maid service never left enough towels and bathroom could have been cleaner.

managementResponses.response: Wow! Thank you so much for your review. We are thrilled you had such a great experience at the hotel and you enjoyed all the holiday decorations! We appreciate your kind words on our staffs! Your recommendation is our biggest compliment. We look forward to welcoming you back soon!

review.title: Price worth the Dream
review.reviewText: I wanted a dream hotel experience for our one night stay in SF. It lived up to the expectations. The lobby was drizzled with tens of thousands of hanging white christmas lights gave the 10 story interior a dreamy feel. Staff was amazingly happy polite and a plasure to talk with. Will pay the price to know in advance how happy I will I am there. Highly recommend to others!

review.title: Perfect
review.reviewText: Great

review.title: Nice Hotel in the Financial District
review.reviewText: We got a great deal through Expedia for this hotel. It's located in the Financial District and is a short walk to Union Square and other areas. Parking is REALLY expensive at $61/day. Staff was absolutely wonderful. Rooms were very clean and nicely appointed although you could tell that it's about time for a facelift (scrapes here and there, peeling faux wood fixtures, etc.) and the bed was too soft, which is more of a personal preference than a fault. Also, the air conditioner didn't work very well and had a hard time getting below 72, which is too warm for us to sleep. The view though, was stunning, and we were only on the 5th floor. The lobby was beautifully decorated for the holidays, which might have been my favorite part besides the great staff!
review.negativeRemarks: Rooms could be updated, air conditioners fixed
review.locationRemarks: Easy walk to Ferry Building, Union Square, etc.

review.title: Very nice hotel, noisy room on street side.
review.locationRemarks: Enjoyed the ferry building and farmers' market

review.title: Sf Hyatt embraced euro
review.reviewText: Everything was great except service in the lobby bar. They were incredibly slow and seemed only interested in serving the young professionals. Would not go there again.
review.negativeRemarks: Bar service.
review.locationRemarks: Great location near the ferry building and shopping. Hard to get to the wharf and pier 39 area.

review.title: Good location, convenient to attractions but less
review.reviewText: Good hotel, but almost everything in it is concrete - not very attractive. Don't get the regency club upgrade, it isn't worth it. No drinks are included, and there are better views elsewhere in the city. I paid a lot of money and didn't get much more than Pepsi and some cookies....

photos.caption: View from our City View room

review.title: Hyatt Regency
review.reviewText: This was our second stay at the Hyatt. It is centrally located and the views from the Regency Room are fantastic. I requested a room with somewhat of a view for pictures (even though it clearly stated I would get a city view). I was able to take a few nice shots of the Bay Bridge and was very, very pleased (just wish we could have actually opened up the sliding door instead of taking pictures through the glass). I would highly recommend upgrading to the Regency Room package if possible. Also, you can get some great shots from the 16th or 17th (Regency Level) floor end windows or, of course, simple cross the street and go through the Ferry Building. Love this hotel! Great food and comfy mattress!
review.negativeRemarks: More access to Regency Club (for simply sitting and relaxing)!
review.locationRemarks: Ferry Building, Embarcadero shopping, sight seeing, etc.

review.title: Good
review.reviewText: Its was lovely for the Christmas Holiday. All the beautiful lights gave us a Christmas experience. Going to bring the kids next year. But the parking was too high- $65 dollars for over night? and we couldnt get into the Bar upstairs.. they made only to upgraded guest.:( Breakfast was good !! lots of food.
review.negativeRemarks: more taxi service at the hotel
review.locationRemarks: went to north beach- farmers market - show. We could walk just about everywhere! I like that and the view wasnt too bad either

review.reviewText:
very solid. beautiful lobby with Xmas lights. nice view of waterfront from "Bay View Room".

only drawback was that room soundproofing wasn't great. man in the next room was clearly doing business in Asia so started long, loud phone conversations at midnight.

review.title: Cleanliness issues but nice hotel by the bay.
review.reviewText: I was stayed here for 2 days. First day was pleasant but the second day had some cleanliness issues. Bed had a weird smell to it. It felt tacky. Overall hotel is nice. It had nice XMas decoration to it which stood out.
review.positiveRemarks: Bay view is really amazing. You can sit in the balcony for hours and enjoy the view.
review.negativeRemarks: Work on hotels cleanliness.
review.locationRemarks: Its in Downtown.

review.positiveRemarks: The location and service are the best of it.

review.title: gorgeous view of the bay
review.reviewText: the staff were always friendly and willing to help, the room was bigger then most i've stayed in and everything was so easy to get to. would suggest this hotel to anyone staying in San Fran
review.negativeRemarks: maybe free wifi
review.locationRemarks: Too many to list but Pier 39 was awesome

review.title: Perfect location on the Embarcadero
review.reviewText: This hotel was wonderful from the minute we checked in until the minute we checked out.
review.positiveRemarks: Great location, clean, modern, up to date, food and drink in hotel and nearby. Had king room with view of Bay Bridge and Ferry Building - fabulous.
review.locationRemarks: Hotel is across the the street from the Ferry Building so lots of see, do and eat plus trolley stop is outside for the places you cannot walk to.

review.title: Great Time in San Francisco
review.reviewText: We recently booked a quick trip to San Francisco through Expedia and had a very enjoyable visit. The car was waiting at the airport to take us to the Hyatt at the Embarcadero where the staff was friendly and helpful. Our room was comfortable and clean, and the views from the Hyatt are some of the best in the city, and the location is great. I like being able to walk to the Yank Sing and Tadich restaurants as well as many others within minutes of the hotel. The car back to the airport was right on time, so overall Expedia did a wonderful job. Thank you.
review.negativeRemarks: The rooms are more designed as efficient than esthetic but I knew this in advance I would still like to see them made more luxurious.
review.locationRemarks: To me this is the best location in the city. If you never have you must eat at Tadich's and Yank Sing's in the Financial district both within blocks.

review.title: Nice Hotel with Bay Views
review.reviewText: Nice hotel. Staff was great. Great location right across from the Ferry Building and away from the craziness of Union Square (only two MUNI stops away). Embarcadero station is right outside front door, so easy access to MUNI and BART. Great restaurants and shopping nearby.
San Francisco needs to clean up the homeless people that are obviously permanent residences outside the front door and in other doorways. We won't go back to San Francisco .

review.title: Nice vacation
review.reviewText: Great, wonderful experience.
review.positiveRemarks: Room space, view, 360 restaurant is amazing, great service, Hotel architecture is fabulous,
review.negativeRemarks: Music, indoor pool

managementResponses.response: Thank you for your review. It is great to hear our staff was able to offer any assistance when you need it and glad you found your engagement ring. However, we do apologize for the city construction in the front entrance. We hope to see you come back and see us again in the near future.

review.title: Honest cleaning staff
review.reviewText: I was in such a hurry to get to my tour bus location, I left my $12,000 engagement ring on the bathroom counter. 2 hours later I realized I was missing my ring and so in a panic my husband and I walked many, many, many blocks back to the hotel room. The room had already been cleaned and my heart started pounding and there it was exactly where I left it. You hear and read about horror stories of cleaning staff stealing from rooms. My ring was there for anyone to grab and yet it was waiting for me to pick it up. My husband and I made sure we told the front desk how grateful we were that the hotel had such an honest staff. Oh and the concierge was awesome! No matter who was working the desk, they were all very knowledgable and helpful!
review.negativeRemarks: I know it couldn't be helped, but the construction outside the building was annoying.

review.title: Very expensive hotel ..
review.reviewText:
Expensive hotel does not match inquiries and facilities ..
Cleaning was good ...

managementResponses.response: Wow! Thank you so much for your 5 star review! Hope you had a fantastic time at the Nike Women's Marathon and enjoyed San Francisco! We are thrilled you had such a great experience with us. Your compliment on our staff is much appreciated and I'll be sure to share with the team. Look forward to welcoming you back soon!

review.title: Friendly staff, clean and comfy room
review.reviewText: Upgraded to bay view room upon check in and we enjoyed beautiful vistas from the deck and water view from the room. Room was clean and comfortable. Location was terrific with easy walk to Union Square and Fisherman's Wharf. In/out valet was easy with fast and friendly service. Liked room key entry for side hotel doors and elevator after dark, but area around hotel seemed quiet and safe. In room Starbucks coffee was nice treat in the morning. We were in town for the Nike Women's Marathon and this was a great location for the race and touring the city.
review.locationRemarks: Steps away from Ferry Building with great shops and vendors, classic cable car right in front of hotel, easy walk to Union Square & Fisherman's Wharf

review.title: Comfort at it's best
review.reviewText: Our room was spacious, well appointed and quiet . . perfect for a good night's sleep . .
review.positiveRemarks: #1 the location. The dinner in the hotel restaurant was excellent.
review.negativeRemarks: Entrance to the hotel due to the construction.
review.locationRemarks: Just steps away from the Ferry Building,

review.title: Perfect location to tour San Francisco with views
review.reviewText: Stunning hotel with atrium and panoramic views of the Bay. Excellent service and the lobby bar and restaurant was as good as many in the city. We ate there twice. Parking was a little steep at $61 per night but that is not unique for San Francisco.
review.positiveRemarks: Our Bayview room with a balcony and real patio furniture was the best. The Atrium is worth a tourist stop.
review.negativeRemarks: Nothing
review.locationRemarks: Perfect location to walk to most areas, particularly the water front.

review.title: Nice Hotel, on the Embarcadero
review.reviewText: Great hotel, but major constuction going on in front of it, which I know is beyond their control.
review.positiveRemarks: The enitre staff from valets to room service was excellent.
review.negativeRemarks: Parking was outrageous $61 for one night. Also the bathrooms are a little dated.
review.locationRemarks: At&T ballpark, Ferry Building, Pier 39 and Fisherman's Wharf

review.title: Nice Hotel, great Location
review.reviewText:
The hotel is very nice and the staff is excellent, the location is one of the best, right across the Embarcadero.
For 2 dollars a person you can go to the Fisherman Place, or walk 1.2 miles, where all the restaurants and shops are. We walked to Union Square 0.7 miles. We like it a lot.

review.title: Nice Hotel
review.reviewText: For our first trip to San Francisco this hotel seemed to be in a good location, it was near the piers and close to transport, there were a couple of eateries across the road, it was also maybe a 30 minute stroll upto pier 39, the room its self was spacious had 2 queen beds, you have to pay for wifi here but it was not too much.
review.locationRemarks: Pier 39, Alcatraz, San Francisco Hop on Hop off bus ( definately worth if it is your first time) , Union Square

review.title: Unique Lodging in Unbeatable Location
review.reviewText: We live not far from San Francisco, but decided to avoid the commute and stay in the City for a weekend. We chose the Hyatt because of its central location to the Ferry Building, and because of the balcony option for many of the rooms. It was so enjoyable to sit on our balcony and watch the City wake up in the morning, and the views of the waterfront were fantastic. The first impressions of the Hyatt are fantastic - the lobby is so unique and the architecture is one of a kind.
review.positiveRemarks: We loved the architecture and design - the lights in the lobby, the glass elevators, the balcony off of our room, the asymmetrical flow of our suite.
review.negativeRemarks: Not sure what can be done to "dress up" concrete balconies, but they were a bit shabby (though we loved ours nonetheless)
review.locationRemarks: At night, we took a short taxi ride to the Mission and enjoyed the nightlife. By day, we enjoyed the waterfront and all of the activity on the Pier.

review.title: Nice hotel close to trains for game!
review.reviewText: Stayed there for sf game clean and convenient . Gym was good to for hotel gym! Nice views of the bay. Easy access to trains for the game

managementResponses.response: Thank you so much for your review! We are thrilled you had such a great experience at our hotel! I have to agree with you our location and the beautiful bay view is definitely unbeatable! Please come back and see us again soon!

review.title: Perfect location.
review.reviewText: We WILL stay at this property again! Perfect location. Easy access to transportation to get around the city. Beautiful property. Stunning view of bay, ferry building, bay bridge, Treasure Island and city. Staff very helpful and friendly.
review.locationRemarks: Directly across from Ferry Building and streetcar. Easy area to walk around

review.title: Quiet hotel next to Ferry Terminal
review.reviewText: Quiet hotel located a quick cab ride from just about everything
review.positiveRemarks: Quiet rooms, very comfortable bed, extremely helpful staff, Alcatraz history/exhibit
review.locationRemarks: Across the street from Pier 1 (Ferry Terminal), where you can shop, rent bicycles, eat wonderful food, etc.

managementResponses.response: Thank you for your feedback. We strive to provide authentic hospitality and seems we fell short during your stay, please accept our sincere apologies. We recently introduced 'Hyatt has it' which offers travelers a list of amenities to choose from such as toothbrush, shower cap, flat iron etc. The card is placed on the desk in each guestroom. There will be a cosmetic upgrade end of this year to refresh all of our rooms and we hope this single experience will not deter you from visiting us again in the near future. Your business is much appreciated and hope to see you again.

review.title: Does not meet Hyatt standard
review.reviewText: The hotel is a great location but that is where the good features stop. The hotel facilities are very average and the rooms are more like a three star hotel. The Staff seems to have a culture of indifference towards the guests. Although they had at least four people at the main entry door to the hotel every time, not one and not once any one of them smiled and greeted us or offer to help. The room amenities were plain and missed some of the basics like shower caps. The air conditioning did not work and it took tow days to finally fix it. The room was noisy due to construction on the street below.
review.negativeRemarks: Try to improve everything to bring it to at least Hyatt Place standard.

review.title: Very convenient location. Excellent beds/pillows
review.reviewText: Very courteous staff from the valet, bellman and front desk. The staff all seem to have a goal to make your stay friendly and comfortable.
review.positiveRemarks: While the Hotel is large, once you are in the room it is very quiet, a bit like a retreat especially if you have a Bay view. We will stay again.

review.title: Very nice hotel.
review.reviewText: Was attending the world cup yacht competition and the hotel was very close to the event.

review.title: An Excellent Location, Helpfull and friendly staff
review.reviewText: Excellent location just in front of Pier 1 and the Bart, we had issues with the hot water in the night since it was not working, the room was clean but not as pretty as shown in pictures, somehow you may feel disappointed after staring at the hotel's beautiful architecture and then by getting into the room. The good thing is that the room is just to sleep cause there are tons of things to do around!
review.positiveRemarks: Architecture was really impressive inside the hotel building.
review.negativeRemarks: its a little noisy in the nights, hot water was not working regularly
review.locationRemarks: Pier 1 is great for having lunch or so, pier 39 is about 10 min or less in bus (L) and powell street about 7 minutes in bart

managementResponses.response: Thank you for your recommendation and took the time to write us a review! Great to hear you enjoyed the ideal location of our hotel! Please come back and see us again soon!

review.title: Excellent location to all amenities
review.reviewText: The hotel staff were very helpful and friendly. The Bart stops right beside the hotel and buses very close. The hotel is central to all attractions. I would highly recommend this hotel to anyone going to San Francisco.
review.positiveRemarks: The hotel is beside the trains and buses.

review.title: Great location, but tired facility.
review.reviewText: Hotel staff was very accommodating, but the facility is worn down. Room wasn't particularly clean and amenities were slim. Items in the bathroom were not replaced and air conditioning didn't function well. Although nice to have a refrigerator, everything froze.

review.title: Excellent location
review.reviewText:
We (3 of us) stayed here for 6 nights (August 19 to 24, 2013), in 2 separate rooms.The first room was on the 16th floor, with a King bed, the second was on the 12th floor, 2 double beds, both with city views.My first experience at check in was a bit confusing as I was almost talked into upgrading to the Regency card, which gave access to the 'unique' 360' viewing balcony, breakfast and Wi-Fi, but at $75 a night extra I declined. The rooms are well equipped, a bit dark but very spacious in comparison to other hotels I have previously stayed at in San Francisco. They have very comfortable beds and it is relatively quiet, despite thinnish walls and there being sewage pipe renovation just outside the main lobby entrance, below from our rooms.The only complaints I have would be the showers, very old fashioned and not very efficient, in fact the one on the 12th floor had to be replaced as it was faulty and no free Wi-Fi.

Overall though I would recommend this hotel for its location, close to the Wharf area, Union Square, the California cable car, Bart and Muni transport etc. We personally did not have breakfast there as it seemed overpriced, but if you wander locally there are various places to eat; we used 'Breaking Bread' in 4 Embarcadero regularly. I do not recommend Izzy's opposite, overpriced, not great quality and poor service.

The concierge staff were extremely helpful and courteous with various queries I had, which made the stay a very pleasant one.
review.positiveRemarks: Convenient location. Amazing Atrium. Very helpful, friendly and courteous staff. Good sized rooms.
review.negativeRemarks: Small bathrooms, poor showers, they need modernising. Free Wi-Fi in rooms or at least in lobby area.
review.locationRemarks: Close to the Wharf area, Ferry building, Union Square, Chinatown, the California cable car, Bart and Muni transport

managementResponses.response: Thank you so much for your review! Great to hear you enjoyed the convenient location of our hotel and the view from your room! We look forward to welcoming you back soon!

review.title: The best on the Bay
review.reviewText: Great hotel.....location...room with view....clean ,friendly environment.The Embarcadero is a great place to stay with great shopping,festivals,and food along with great convenience when taking day or local trips.
review.positiveRemarks: Almost everything...extremely professional and accomodating. Big beds,clean rooms,great location.
review.negativeRemarks: The food in the hotel restaurant was lacking and the fact that one had to pay a daily usage fee for Internet was a bit unnerving.
review.locationRemarks: Right on the Embarcadero with great restaurants downstairs and across the plaza by the Ferry terminal accorded us the availability of a farmers market

managementResponses.response: Thank you for your review! Sounds like you had a wonderful time exploring all of the great San Francisco attractions nearby! I must agree with you our ideal location is unbeatable. However, we apologize for the inconvenience caused by the unplugged refrigerator and the city construction outside of the hotel. Thank you for your understanding. We truly appreciate your business and hope to see you again in the near future.

review.title: Luxury accommodations
review.reviewText:
I was thoroughly pleased with the offerings of the Hyatt at the Embarcadero. Nearly centrally located in the wharf area, I was able to freely navigate the city with nearby shops and restaurants at the ready. Union Square is a ten minute walk and a gorgeous walk along the numerous piers is practically outside my doorstep.

I was saddened to realize that my refrigerator in my room was unplugged upon arrival. That was pretty much the only qualm with the hotel as the ongoing construction is something that couldn't be avoided. It happens... C'est la vie. I thoroughly relished my stay and would certainly book into it again the next time I'm in town. Thanks a mill!
review.positiveRemarks: Everything. Tranquil, artsy interior, upscale room and furnishings, friendly staff and great food at the buffet.
review.negativeRemarks: Just keep the refrigerator plugged in! :)
review.locationRemarks: Close to being centrally located in Union Square. 10 minute walk. Schroeder's(German beer/food) and Harrington's (Great Guinness!) Lots of cafes.

review.title: Great hotel in great location.
review.reviewText: This was a great hotel in a very convenient location. The staff was extremely helpful and very pleasant.
review.negativeRemarks: My son missed having access to a pool.

review.title: Beautiful view from the window.
review.reviewText:
We stayed this hotel for Honey moon!
We spent a wonderful days at this hotel.
It was easy to go everywhere for shopping, go restaurant and sightseeing!
review.positiveRemarks: Ocean view, Fancy lobby, Very interesting historic about Alcatraz, Nice bar.

review.title: San Francisco experience
review.reviewText: Our stay couldn't have been better. Awesome location, staff, room and amenities
review.locationRemarks: Excellent location, close to transportation and lots of attractions are within a 30 minute walk.

review.title: very nice hotel, location is ok, breakfast is amaz
review.reviewText: we stayed as a family, we all liked it a lot, the breakfast in the morning was great, staff was nice, the interior is very nice as well
review.negativeRemarks: it was perfect
review.locationRemarks: plenty of things, wharf, shopping, walking...

review.title: heart of downtown
review.reviewText: We had great views from the 16th floor. Nice room.
review.positiveRemarks: Centrally located, we walked to the ball park and fishermans wharf.

review.title: Great hotel, awesome location
review.reviewText: The location was awesome, right across from the ferry building. There is a lot of construction going on in the area, which was inconvenient. The hotel itself was very nice and the room had a great view of the bay bridge.
review.locationRemarks: Food, shopping and scenery

review.title: excellent staff
review.reviewText: folks went the extra mile on several occasions, making our stay wonderfully enjoyable. Construction around the hotel made access difficult, but that temporary inconvenience was negligible.
review.positiveRemarks: Staff, location, and facilities were all fantastic.
review.negativeRemarks: Nothing comes to mind.
review.locationRemarks: The hotel is within walking distance of many neighborhoods and landmarks, and public transportation is nearby.

review.title: Beautiful hotel near many must see places
review.reviewText: Very comfortable bed, breakfast was worth adding to room rate, hotel is in a prime location.
review.negativeRemarks: There were dirty dishes from room service (from previous guests) for a long time. The dishes were outside our door.
review.locationRemarks: Lots of restaurants near by, fishermen wharf, Chinatown, union square, public transportation near by. It is perfect for walking

review.title: Great Location
review.reviewText: Hotel is across the Embarcadero from the Ferry Building, Bart is at the front door, and within walking distance to ATT Park. We took the ferry from Larkspur and didn't need to drive anywhere to have a great weekend.

review.title: Great hotel
review.reviewText: Convenient location. Staff is friendly and helpful. Enjoyed the Regency Club continental breakfast and snacks. Very nice and clean accommodations. Will definitely stay there again!
review.locationRemarks: About a 25 minute walk to AT&T ballpark.

review.title: Great walking experience at the Embarcadero
review.reviewText: Although there was street construction going on, the service at the hotel was great and the food at the restaurant was excellent, with good service as well. We enjoyed the ability to walk to The Embarcadero as it was in close proximity. I wouldn't suggest a late Friday afternoon arrival as the city traffic was congested, which is to be expected in a city.
review.negativeRemarks: Make sure rooms are feather free before checking in!
review.locationRemarks: Walking, sightseeing, shopping, dining

review.title: Good stay
review.reviewText: Clean, comfortable, extra plugs on surge protector strip under bed. Staff friendly. Concierges helpful and patient in midst of construction.

review.title: Great sleep for the weary traveler
review.reviewText: Our four-night stay met with little inconvenience. What problems we did have were minor when compared to the overall comfort we enjoyed. We made requests for toiletries that were promptly delivered to the room, followed by a follow-up call from the desk to see they made it accurately. We had requested a turndown service one night of our stay, but that never happened. Also, the business center computers met with various errors when I tried to access work email and time sheets, but it's understandable that not everybody's needs can be met where technology's concerned. We did not use the restaurant or room service due to the cost. The highlight of our room was the view of Market Street and the Bay Bridge - a welcome sight during a busy day sightseeing and running errands, along with our bed, which was always made up fresh and tight as if it were our check-in day.
review.positiveRemarks: Great view from room; prompt service for amenity deliveries
review.negativeRemarks: Our confirmation number went unrecognized by the e-concierge system throughout the trip so we couldn't book turndown service or extra treats.
review.locationRemarks: A short walk to Pier 14, Market Street; Pier 39 and the Wharf are a 2 mile hike, great if you have the right shoes!

review.title: Wonderful Location
review.reviewText: Location is Super Super Super Good. Use the back door of hotel, walk 5 mins to Ferry Building. It's very convenient to take public transportation to anywhere you want. If you are first time to visit San Francisco, this hotel is top choice. It's very noisy at night because of his location.

review.title: Perfect location
review.reviewText: Accommodating check-in (gave us a late check-out) and nice, comfortable room although it was quite a distance from the elevators (+ and -). Great location to the Ferry building and waterfront to view the sailing. Unfortunate is the street construction which blocks easy access to the entrance and the streets are quite dirty and smelly around the facility.
review.locationRemarks: Close to the ballpark in one direction and all the activities along the waterfront in the other direction.

review.title: SF Hyatt Regency at the Embarcadero.
review.reviewText:
The hotel is next to the Port of San Francisco near the Fisherman Wharf area. It's a little pricey but better than the Westin Hotels.
They offer a 360 view of the city but unless the sky is clear it's has a nice view of the Wharf and the Bay Bridge. It's a little far from the Golden Gate and cannot be seen with a 360 view. The hotel lobby is nice. Hotel was clean. Room service food was good but a little pricey. No complimentary continental breakfast. Access to the rooftop 360 view is $75 so there better be nice weather before you pay for the view and the food.
review.negativeRemarks: If you were expecting a complimentary continental breakfast.... be disappointed.
review.locationRemarks: Fishermans Wharf is right there and the ferries to Oakland and elsewhere. Chinatown and Union Square a further into the city.

review.title: Nice location
review.reviewText: The hotel is in a great location, staff was helpful, but the rooms need to be updated. Also, wifi should be included in the room price, not an extra charge.

review.title: Comfort and luxury
review.reviewText:
Got one night through mystery deal and that was a pretty good deal for family of four. That was exceptionally great value for money and exactly what we needed at the end of our hectic but fantastic holiday. Very well located with great access to transport. Hop on hop off bus stop is only a few minutes walk and so is Market place. Other places of interest were also at walking distance, we did not have time to do that. In front of the hotel, you'll find subway, Walgreens, seven eleven, a bakery, Starbucks and a couple of other little food outlets. Take a walk around Embarcadero centre and you'll have a great choice of restaurants if you don't wish to eat in the hotel's restaurant.
The only thing I wished the hotel could have done at time of booking confirmation, was to advise us of a limousine company which charges a fixed price of US $55 one way to and from SFO airport. We paid $72 plus tip for a taxi. We only found that out on our way out when we wanted a taxi and the valet asked us if we didnt mind getting the limousine company. It is not a limousine but a luxurious comfortable big black car 10 times better than taxi. So, ask hotel to book it for you or the details of that company. It's the hotel's contractor.
review.positiveRemarks: The complimentary toiletries items available such as shaving foam, razors, mouthwash etc
review.negativeRemarks: No free wifi available. Should be free at least in lobby
review.locationRemarks: Refer to comments above

review.title: Very nice hotel, great location
review.reviewText: Location is great, close to piers, BART station, cable trains, inside financial district, with many shops around. Beautiful architected build, gardens, parks surroundings. Parking is very expensive ($60) though. We chose to return our rental car to AVIS which is just inside the hotel and ride BART to airport. It saved money and brought convenience. We walk along the piers to Explotoriam, pier 33 to take furry to Alcatraz island, went to China to eat. Very nice experience overall.
review.positiveRemarks: Location. Hotel designs inside and outside.

review.title: Proximity to Exploratorium
review.reviewText: The location was good and the beds were comfortable. It's a tight space for a family but this is the case for most hotels we found in the city center. We would stay there again. Right near the hotel was an easy walk to coffee for breakfast. Easy access to street car. Overall the stay was pleasant.
review.negativeRemarks: have more sleeping options (ie suite for families of 5)
review.locationRemarks: exploratorium (excellent) also near to restaurants (pier 22) and all of the harbor cruises

review.title: Great location!
review.reviewText: This is a stunning hotel! We had to wait in line, as if we were checking in for an airline flight, to register! However, they did offer us cold bottled water for our trouble. We had a spectacular view of the bay, on the 12th floor, and the bed was so comfy, I actually slept well, and I never do, in a hotel! Very quiet, also! Great location for exploring the waterfront, and we also walked to Telegraph Hill, Coit Tower, and North Beach, which only took a couple of hours!
review.positiveRemarks: The Atrium lights, the location, the view, the comfy bed!
review.negativeRemarks: Check in service.
review.locationRemarks: We walked to the Giant's game, Telegraph Hill, Coit Tower, North Beach, and the shopping in the area, including the Ferry Building, is abundant!

review.title: Awesome hotel and location
review.reviewText:
We stayed here for our outing with our cousins. The hotel lobby is buzzing with people and beautifully decorated. There was an exhibit about Alcatraz during our stay. The staff at check-in was attentive, they handed out Hyatt Regency bottled water while we waited in line.

Our rooms were adjoining king rooms with an outstanding view of the bay. We were upgraded, so we were assigned a higher floor level. At the time, I assumed this was a complementary upgrade....come to find out the following day that the we were charged for the upgrade. I didn't mind that we had to pay for the upgrade, it would have been nice to be told upfront that this was not complimentary. The bed was comfy, the room was clean.
review.negativeRemarks: More attention to detail. My bath towel had blood stains on it, 3 small blood drops.
review.locationRemarks: Steps away from the Embarcadero. Walking distance from the touristy Fisherman's Wharf, Pier 39, the Ferry Building, the ATT ballpark stadium.

review.title: Best location in SF
review.reviewText:
Took BART from SFO direct to hotel. Location is great for walking and transportation to all over the Bay area. BART, MUNI buses, trains, trolleys and cable car.
We lived in SF for 25 years so we know this was the place to book.
review.positiveRemarks: Best bed we've slept in. Great linens. Hard to get out of bed it was so nice.
review.negativeRemarks: Weird that a 4 star hotel didn't offer any robes, even simple ones. Didn't have to be expensive plush ones, just enough to answer the door.
review.locationRemarks: Ferry Building/Embarcadero across street. Trolley to Ballpark. BART to SFO or OAK airports. Restaurants & shopping abound. Can't beat the convenience

review.title: San Francisco July 2013
review.reviewText: Great hotel. Prepaid booking with Expedia allowed us to checkin early (1030). Nice friendly staff and the hotel had a good atmosphere.
review.positiveRemarks: Location and quality of the room and lobby.
review.locationRemarks: Superb for all downtown locations. Avoid Pizza Orgasmica, eat at Perrys!!

review.title: Pivotal location in SF
review.reviewText: Excellent location for business and leisure travellers. Ideal for public transport and for the ferries across the San Francisco bay. Good food and service. Incredible atrium feature.

review.title: Hotel with a great location and friendly staff
review.reviewText: The streets surrounding the hotel were undergoing major construction in July 2013, so getting into and out of the hotel could be challenging. But once inside, the hotel was clean and very comfortable and the staff was outstanding.
review.positiveRemarks: The concierge was outstanding; always helpful with directions and suggestions.
review.negativeRemarks: The triangular shape of the hotel made it hard to figure out which exit to use to reach particular destinations. A map would be helpful.
review.locationRemarks: Close to Pier 3 locations, Market Street, and the Embarcadero BART Station.

review.title: Hyatt Regency - Great Location
review.reviewText: I recently stayed at the Hyatt Regency for 3 days and had a great stay. The staff was very helpfull and the location couldn't be beat.
review.negativeRemarks: Valet/parking charges are outrageous. Unless you absolutely need a car, I would recommend not bringing one.
review.locationRemarks: Fisherman's Wharf, financial district

review.title: best hotel near finance and embarcadero
review.reviewText: We enjoied the stay at the hotel. The best was the access to the regency club. free beakfest, diner and drinks were excellent. the sightseeing from the rooftop was a great experience.
review.negativeRemarks: The Parkingfees are too expensive in San Francisco.
review.locationRemarks: Ner the embarcadero you can visit americas cup 2013 in San Francisco.

review.title: Not a 5 star hotel but a good deal
review.reviewText: Hotel is a bit dated (70s) and rooms are showing the wear. However room was clean and large. No mini bar. Bed is a bit hard but husband found it just right. Got a bay view room with partial view of ferry building. Nice balcony. Valet service is 61 a night but well worth it, since we took the car out in the mornings and evenings. Great location compared to competition. Interesting Alcatraz exhibit in lobby.
review.negativeRemarks: Room needs some updating
review.locationRemarks: Across street from Ferry bldg. Away from congested tourist area but short trolly ride to. Great location for sightseeing by transit and by car

review.title: Hyatt Regency at the Embarcadero
review.reviewText: Stayed at this hotel during my first trip to San Francisco, thirty-five years ago. It still looks as good now as it did then and the staff was very accommodating to every request. I will be there again on my next trip to San Francisco.
review.negativeRemarks: Pillows were a bit soft
review.locationRemarks: Ferry Plaza market is across the street and Fisherman's Wharf is a short trip away. Many excellent restaurants within a 10-15 minute cab ride.

review.title: Convent location
review.reviewText: We honeymooned at this hotel 30 years ago. The surrounding area has changed since then, but the hotel is still a breath of fresh air. Clean, quiet and spacious room. We would stay here again.

review.title: Day in the city
review.reviewText:
We took
Our two children and enjoyed hanging out on the Embarcadro.
review.positiveRemarks: Location, comfortable beds, quiet , coffee in the morning
review.negativeRemarks: More towels in the bathroom, night lite,
review.locationRemarks: Ferry building, ferries to places, AT&T stadium, Fisherman's wharf, exploratorium

review.title: Convenient for tourists
review.reviewText: The staff at the hotel were very helpful and friendly, from the valet to the front desk to the concierge. The hotel is right next to an underground BART and Muni station, which made getting to AT&T park very easy and inexpensive. We walked to Fisherman's Wharf and Ghiradelli Square. We skipped the hotel restaurant - there is a cute little restaurant and a Starbucks right across the street. The hotel was clean and attractive, beds very comfortable, rooms a nice size. Parking was $61 but we were able to leave it for a full 24 hours so we didn't have to move the car for a few hours of sight-seeing after we checked out - and you really don't want to drive around the tourist areas if you don't have to. Very pleasant stay.
review.locationRemarks: Right next to an underground BART and Muni, short ride to AT&T Park, walking distance to Fisherman's Wharf.

review.title: WE LOVED THE PROXIMITY TO THE FERRY BUILDING.
review.reviewText:
WE'RE TWO OLD FOLK AND WANTED TO SPEND THE 4TH IN SF TO SEE THE FIREWORKS.
IT WAS GREAT.

review.title: Awesome time in SF
review.reviewText: No complaints, everything was awesome at Hyatt. Atmosphere was just right. My wife and I celebrated our 23rd anniversary in style! Room was super comfortable, AC worked perfectly. Will stay here again for sure.
review.locationRemarks: Literally in front of Ferry Building and plenty of shopping. Having the Cable Car entry right outside was perfect. Access to Market Street was cool.

review.title: Nickel and dime...
review.reviewText: Although the hotel is old, they've done a nice job trying to keep it up to date. We found however, they wanted to nickel and dime us for everything... Charge for internet, local telephone calls. Also, after staying there 3 nights, on the day we checked out, we rented a car and wanted to return the car to the hotel at the end of the day. They wanted to charge us a $25 fee for non guests. Although at the end of the transaction we did not get charged, twice it was mentioned we should be charged and we had to negotiate not paying this fee. And when we inquired about renting the car and whether or to there were discounts for airline employees the customer service agent (which is at the hotel) told us 10%. When we came back an hour later to finalize the paperwork and pick up the car, he only discounted the vehicle 5%. When we asked about the 10%, he said "ya, it's between 5-10%".
review.locationRemarks: Very close to the Ferry Building

review.title: Great location for tourism.
review.reviewText: We stayed there to see the new Exploratorim. It is so close, we walked. The lounge and bar were good meet-up places.
review.negativeRemarks: Keep up the good work.
review.locationRemarks: Great views of the Bay bridge lights. Good place to begin and end urban hikes.r

review.title: Great Location
review.reviewText: Nice clean hotel with super friendly and helpful staff. My one complaint was the parking fee, $60 a day is outrageous! A Ross the street is only $30. I'll be doing that next time for sure.
review.positiveRemarks: Clean hotel, friendly staff, spacious rooms, location, location, location.
review.negativeRemarks: Reduce parking fee. $60 a day is way to expensive even for San Fran!
review.locationRemarks: Alcatraz, Giants baseball, Pier 39, Exploratorium, Cable cars

review.title: close to Fisherman's wharf and the pier.
review.reviewText: We enjoyed the Alcatraz display in the lobby. There was a lot of great information. The lobby was beautiful with hanging lights along with its unique design. Our room was nice and clean, nothing over the top. Bed was comfortable. Choose a room with a view of the bay. Our first room had an adjoining room, and we could hear the other people through the door. We asked to be moved, which the hotel graciously did. Our new room was much bigger and nicer.
review.positiveRemarks: The Alcatraz display and the breakfast buffet.
review.negativeRemarks: lower the valet parking rates.
review.locationRemarks: Great trolley access. This hotel was central to Union Square and Fisherman's Wharf.

review.title: Fab Hotel!!
review.reviewText: Have stayed here numerous times and have had an enjoyable experience every time. The staff is super friendly and always willing to help. The restaurant (Eclipse) has good food. Will definitely stay here again!!

review.title: Hotel is beaufiful and we would stay there again.
review.reviewText: The location is perfect for business or pleasure. Interaction with front desk could have been a bit better. The comfort of the room was good except for the heating and cooling system which did not have a thermometer so it was by trai and error what temperature you were wetting the dial too. Made it difficult at night to know what to set it at. Hotel is beaufiful and we would stay there again.
review.negativeRemarks: The heating and cooling system.
review.locationRemarks: Perfect location. Out of the hussle and bustle of the Wharfe but with easy access and lots of great fun transit options.

review.title: Great for a night out on the town
review.reviewText: The staff were wonderful and friendly. I will definitely stay here again

review.title: Location, Location
review.reviewText: Location, location, location. This is a great hotel steps from the BART, Muni, Ferry Building, AT&T Park, bay ferries, many good restaurants and central business district. We asked for and received an upgraded king room with a stellar 11th floor view of the Bay Bridge with light art installation and enjoyed viewing it every night. The front desk, bell captain and concierge were all very helpful. We booked a wine country tour through the concierge desk (Great Pacific Tours was tour operator) that was excellent. Our room was immaculately kept and bed was comfortable. We had an excellent experience.
review.positiveRemarks: Views of Embarcadero and Bay Bridge
review.negativeRemarks: long walk to elevator from room (minor complaint)
review.locationRemarks: The best for central accessibility to city.

review.title: Nice hotel. Close to the Ferry Building.
review.reviewText: Very nice hotel and excellent location. Great view of the Bay Bridge. Right across the street from the Ferry Building. The staff were all very helpful. I would highly recommend this hotel.

review.title: Great hotel with exceptional service!
review.reviewText: The hotel staff is excellent from the front desk to the concierge to the restaurant staff! The rooms are clean, hotel location incredibly convenient. Would recommend to any traveling family!

review.title: Relaxing, Fun Night in the City
review.reviewText: Beautiful view and relaxing clean room very nice service throughout whole hotel
review.negativeRemarks: Nothing
review.locationRemarks: Awesome

review.title: Hotel Staff did not understand reservation
review.reviewText: We arrived early and one room was ready but the other room was not 2 double beds so we said we would be back later after graduation and dinner. Upon our return they issued a room not on the same floor with all the perks we had on the 17th floor. Upon review it, too, was not two double beds so an attendant broght us the keys for the room which we had originally booked. The light was out in that bathroom. Our shower was a dribble.
review.positiveRemarks: Breakfast up in the Regency Lounge. Excellent food and a marvelous view.
review.negativeRemarks: Price of parking 61 dallors!
review.locationRemarks: The location allowed us to view the BAY TO BREAKERS start.

review.title: Not worth $400/night
review.reviewText: I booked this hotel because it was close to the location where I had a meeting despite the fact that it was $400/night. I had called the front desk the day before I checked in to add my fiance's name to the reservation and to inquire about the possibility of extending my stay an additional night. The man told me that my fiance's name was added and that there were plenty of rooms available and I could decide later. I was boarding my plane for a 6 hour flight to San Fran when I get a call from my fianc that the front desk said he was not on the reservation. I took care of that by calling the front desk sgain. We stayed one night, and when I called the front desk from my room the morning I was scheduled to check out, I asked to extend my stay another night, but the woman rather rudely said that they had been booked for weeks and that we couldn't stay another night. Additionally, for a hotel that size and $400/night, there was no excuse for them to run out of hot water -- I had to take a cold shower.
review.positiveRemarks: The view from my room of the Bay Bridge was excellent. The bed was comfortable and nice looking room.
review.negativeRemarks: When their front desk tells a guest they have done requested or makes a statement on which travelers rely, they need to be sure they are correct.
review.locationRemarks: In the financial district.

review.title: Embarcadero Hyatt
review.reviewText: As you enter the Hotel the entire indoor area of hotel smells like urine. Rooms seem like they have not been remodeled for a while. Sheets were not clean found small hairs and dried yellow stains on comforter. It was not a good experience. We also disliked that there is no free parking in the hotel self parking is $32 dollars the night. We will absolutely never stay at this hyatt again.
review.positiveRemarks: Sheets and comforter were unclean. Disliked the smell of urine in the indoor main area of hotel.
review.negativeRemarks: Remodel.

review.title: excellent stay
review.reviewText: stayed here for a Giants game and night in the City; great atmosphere and comfortable room with a great view.
review.positiveRemarks: the great view; comfortable bed and pillows
review.negativeRemarks: larger bathroom

review.title: Great hotel for business travellers
review.reviewText:
Room is very clean and the bed is comfortable.
I am lucky enough to get a room on the 16th floor and I can see the Bay bridge from my room - superb!
Very convenient location - easy access to tram (trolley cars) and subway station. And only 40 mins away from the airport by Taxi on the Monday morning (rush hour). There are some nice restaurants in the seafront nearby within walking distance (e.g. the Waterfront next to pier 7 is good, Sinbad's at pier 2 is okay).
At night there is a ocassional noises from the street (I guess this is unavoidable as it is in a busy area). And sometimes I can hear noise from upstair (I guess the floors are not very sound proof) but not too bad.
The gym is well equipped (relative to other hotels I stayed in recently like Hilton), but if you are serious in weight training you might be disappointed - the maximum weight of the dumbells are only 50lbs so it is not enough.
The WiFi is not free, but at less than 10 dollars for 24 hours it is not bad price. Also, if you order drink at the bar you can ask the staff for a guest access code for WiFI access in the bar area.
The valet landry service is expensive: (T-shirt - 7.50, brief - 3.75, socks (pair) - 3.50)...the finanical team in the firm I work for won't be happy to see the bill.
Morning breakfast available from bar area (which I didn't try) and the top floor Regency Club (continental breakfast - very nice view of the bay, but the choice of food is limited).
review.negativeRemarks: Cost
review.locationRemarks: Convenient location near to sea front, with nice sea view from some of the rooms

review.title: Road trip
review.reviewText: Very clean and comfortable room. Nice view and centrally located, a little pricey specially the parking but there is lots to do. Only bad part of the location is that everything closes early.
review.negativeRemarks: Price
review.locationRemarks: Great location

review.title: Tough stay. Not great
review.reviewText: Room was fairly dirty and did not feel taken care of as hotel was crowded

review.title: Not worth the money
review.reviewText: Not worth the 4 star, old hotel, not worth the money

review.title: Service flaws take away from the loveliness
review.reviewText:
This is an impressive building with a gorgeous interior in a great part of SF. It's close to the Embarcadero and everything in the financial district. The room was large, comfortable and had an okay bathroom. For the money, it was alright but usually it's a bit over-priced.

What I didn't like was that Internet is not free. Come on people, it's ridiculous to charge for Internet in these already expensive hotels.

More importantly, my girlfriend and I arrived late on a weeknight with a prepaid room from Expedia & were told they didn't have a room for us and that we'd have to take a different room with 2 double beds, not 1 king. This is not okay, since I've already paid for the room.

Then the guy offered to upgrade us for $30/night to a room with a king. I still held off, as I didn't want to pay more since the room was paid for. So then he offered to upgrade us for $30 total for 2 nights. Still, I held off. Finally, he told us he'd just kick someone else out of a king room for us and give us the room I'd paid for. Was that so hard??? How can they possibly not have a room which is prepaid. And then, suddenly, he has one fairly easily. I don't appreciate these tactics. The hotel over-books and then they try and throw responsibility onto me? Not okay.

Furthermore, the last day we were there, we ordered breakfast via room service. It did not arrive in the time promised & ended up having to cancel as I had to go to work. How long have you been doing this? Can't staff properly???

review.title: Very nice, convenient - needs to add power outlets
review.reviewText:
Pricey, but was the most convenient hotel for my business trip. VERY nice hotel, close to great restaurants, coffee shops, walgreens, etc.

Minor inconvenience:
As a business traveler, I like to have power outlets close to the bed. The bed/headboard configuration makes it impossible to get to the outlets there. So you end up charging your phone/devices in other parts of the room/bathroom. I'll come back again, but will have to bring a light extension cord.
review.negativeRemarks: Lack of power outlets near the bed. Shower & bathroom seemed a little cheap compared to the rest of the room and hotel.

review.title: Great option!
review.reviewText: Great location, very nice people, quite new and amaizing hall! Free wifi in the lobby it's appreciated!

review.title: nice
review.reviewText: nice, confortable, no more, nice location, clean,the beds are hard, nice view, nice building
review.negativeRemarks: hard bed
review.locationRemarks: excelent

review.title: top 5 in SF
review.reviewText: Great hotel and great food!! Go to Regency Club for breakfast its at the top of the hotel and the views are great with massage chairs!!
review.positiveRemarks: Location 20 min walk to union square

review.title: Not Great for Families
review.reviewText:
Not a whole lot of options for families, this is a business hotel. Surrounding area does have places to eat and see but once again, it's in the middle of the financial district so nothing really for kids as expected. SInce it is a hotel for business people, the hotel charges for EVERYTHING extra. Internet in the room us extra, parking is outrageously expensive (but probably not for SF), costs add up quickly. They do have free coffee in the lobby for guests but no hot chocolate. Since most guests have their companies pay for the extras, the hotel charges for it all.

The hotel is at the start of the California Trolley line. The stop is right out the front door and Chinatown is not many stops away. Union Square is also pretty close by trolley.

review.title: Great views, good location, not so great service.
review.reviewText:
Really enjoyed our stay. Location was very convenient and close to Ferry Building and other attractions. Bed was very comfortable. Room was clean and had a great view of the Bay Bridge Light show. One bad point, is parking is $62 per night. Crazy expensive.

Service at the hotel lounge was a not has good. We had our friends meet us at the lounge for drinks and food. We asked about vegan options for our friends and the server almost accosted us for asking about Vegan options "Who's the vegan?" Why does that matter, just tell us what options you have. Her tone almost chastising. Maybe a little more training on how to respond to requests for special needs for the staff would be beneficial.

Oh well, can't win them all.
review.negativeRemarks: Service in the hotel lounge not very good.
review.locationRemarks: Excellent location and convenient.

review.title: great hotel for everyone
review.reviewText: Carpet need shampooing bad. Had several stains. Bathroom ceiling above bathtub had part of a dead bug smeared. Looked like a roach. Tried wiping it off but didn't come off. Gross. Heater was a bit noisy. Other wise enjoy staying for the location. Have stayed here four other times.
review.positiveRemarks: view of bay bridge lit up at night with full moon in background. Cool elevators.
review.negativeRemarks: noisy heater
review.locationRemarks: close to bart and buses

review.title: Love this hotel
review.reviewText: Just loved this my entire experience here, the room was amazing, the view was breath taking and the staff was very helpful. I got the best recommendation for dinner. This area of San Francisco has got everything...no need to ever go anywhere you can't walk. The only bad thing was having to pay for internet wifi and the cost of parking was very high
review.positiveRemarks: You'll be happy you stayed here

review.title: Loved the Regency Club here.
review.reviewText: We were pleasantly surprised with this hotel, we picked it up on a super saver so we weren't expecting it to be too flash, but when we arrived we were impressed. It is in a great location, straight across the road from the Ferry Building, there is a cable car stop right out the front. The lovely lady that checked us in (Ruth) told us about the Regency Club, for an extra $75 a night we had access to this, it gives you brekki, lunch, nibblies (enough to make up for dinner) at night, free softdrink, free wifi, massage chairs. There were 2 adults and 2 kids in our family so we definitely got our $75 worth each day. Because we saved quite a bit on the super saver we didn't feel so bad about paying the extra each day. It is probably a good 30min walk to Fishermans Wharf, but it is a nice walk with plenty to see on the way.
review.negativeRemarks: Aircon could have been a little better.
review.locationRemarks: Great location close to public transport (cable Car, trains) about a 30min walk to Fishermans Wharf.

review.title: Winter in San Francisco
review.reviewText: Very central, breakfast included was a bonus. Easy to get around, concierge very helpful. Happy to recommend.
review.positiveRemarks: Location and ease of transport facilities.
review.negativeRemarks: No tea making facilities, not everyone has coffee!
review.locationRemarks: Superb, it came highly recommended and we weren't disappointed.

review.title: Beautiful!!
review.reviewText: Awesome location!! Beautiful views of the bay, great places to roam and eat.

review.title: Parking is expensive!
review.reviewText: The hotel was very nice, with an impressive interior lobby/atruim. The major disappointment was the very high cost of parking. $57 for one night!

review.title: Good hotel, but extras are not worth the $$
review.reviewText:
I had the buffet breakfast in the hotel restaurant. It was mostly awful.

The coffee was excellent. The granola was good. The eggs and corned beef hash were tepid and dried out. The french toast was inedible. I would have done better to order off the menu, but didn't want to wait around for service.

Parking is outrageous - $60/day. Wifi is extra.
review.negativeRemarks: Breakfast.
review.locationRemarks: In Embarcadero center, near our offices on Battery Street.

review.title: Great hotel for business or pleasure
review.reviewText:
The atrium impressed me as I walked to check-in. Dangling lights (double quantity due to the holiday season) really add some awe to the massive space. I found my room to be spacious, with a nice view of the Ferry Building, including a door wall that opens for better viewing/fresh air. The bathroom is a bit snug, but the shower head was nice and high, the water pressure was great, and the water could get nice and hot quickly.

Drinks and apps at the hotel bar were nice, and the ambiance of looking into the atrium is a great touch.

The location is great. Walk to the Financial District, down Market St., or to the Ferry Building for some Blue Bottle coffee. The BART station is nice and close too.
review.locationRemarks: Great location! Walk to the Financial District, down Market St., or to the Ferry Building. The BART station is nice and close too.

review.title: San Francisco Gem of a hotel
review.reviewText: This hotel was just perfect to explore the embarcadero and union square. the staff were excellent and accommodation were comfortable, clean, and tasteful. We received an affordable rate who h made it even more desirable.
review.positiveRemarks: Beautiful Atrium decorated with thousands of cascading strings of lights
review.negativeRemarks: Didn't have an in room coffee maker
review.locationRemarks: close to union square and directly across from ferry building , beautiful view of the bay

review.title: Great Location
review.reviewText: Awesome location and views of the bay. Good restaurants and service. Great location with awesome restaurants within walking distance.

review.title: Great location, very clean hotel!
review.reviewText: Clean, relatively quiet, housekeeping staff does a wonderful job!

review.title: Good business hotel
review.reviewText: great dcor in the lobby, wonderful holiday decorations, lovely views of the bay from patios but rooms/fixtures are a bit old
review.negativeRemarks: Rooms and fi
review.locationRemarks: great

review.title: To much for to little!
review.reviewText: It was at most a three star hotel for four hundred dollars and sixty dollars for valet. The faucets were not working correctly. The bathroom was old and wallpaper dingy. Our room was next to the ice skating which we were told that music would be playing until 10pm. However, the hotel neglected to mention that we could hear every word plus the loud speaker with announcer. I think they should have been more considerate. Now I remember why I do not like staying at Hyatt hotels.

review.title: Embarcadero location not enough for 4 stars.
review.reviewText: I could not believe this hotel recieved such a high rating! If you want to stay in the Embarcadero, I suppose this would be a good option, however, the rooms are small & feel crowded. This would not be so bad if it had been clean! The bed looked as if the sheets had not been changed, and the bathroom was dirty, with mold in the tub! The staff was friendly, but the service was slooow despite only seeing a handful of other guests. Overnite parking fees of $50.00 not mentioned in reservation. Room service food mediocre. I would not stay here again, especially considering the abundance of truly top notch hotels in the City.

review.title: Nothing's a problem.
review.reviewText: Excellent staff made our stay totally enjoyable. othing was too much or them to do.

review.title: Great Hotel convenient to Mass transportation
review.reviewText: Great convenient hotel.. Regency Club upgrade charge was not worht the $$. Too many kids running around unsupervised.

review.title: Fun overnight to the city
review.reviewText: Great location. Right across from the ferry building. You are close enough to walk to chinatown, downtown, or union square. The staff here was very friendly and helpful. Concierge was able to book us at a great restaurant after our show. They are setting up their holiday decorations. The lights are beautiful . We loved our stay.

review.title: very nice
review.reviewText: The hotel was beautiful and the staff was so helpful

review.title: Location cannot be beat!
review.reviewText: GREAT LOCATION! This is a very nice hotel in the Embarcadero/Financial District. It is close to shopping, great food and public transportation is a pleasure. The one downside to me is that this is a HUGE hotel. It is big, empty space which does not allow for the staff to integrate with the guests easily. I prefer a smaller feeling in a hotel... but you cannot beat the location.

review.title: Great location
review.reviewText:
The hotel is in the Financial District, so while it is a very clean/safe area with all transportation within the block, most street-side restaurants and coffee shops closed for the entire weekend.

The hotel is geared for the business person, so the hotel staff was attentive and quick...also very pleasant.

Except for a shortage of hot water in the shower, our stay was perfect.
review.negativeRemarks: Cafes were closed for the weekend
review.locationRemarks: Close to Ferry Building and Embarcadero.

review.title: Still Our Favorite SanFrancisco Hotel
review.reviewText: When we checked in we opted for a bay view room for a $30 premium. The room's safe was missing - where it had been was quite obvious. A phone call to the desk got us moved two doors away to another bay view room with a safe. When my wife tried to open the sliding glass door to the view, it fell out of the tracks. Another phone call got the head of maintenance right up to the room but he diagnosed the problem as too serious to fix in a reasonable time so he called for another change of room but he though an upgrade was called for. A bellman was sent up to move us to a bay view room with a walkout patio on a "Regency Club" floor that included full membership for the three days we would be staying. This included a lavish breakfast buffet, all imaginable drinks and snacks all day, serious pre-dinner hors d'oeuvres and an honor bar. It's located in the circular glass-walled room on the top of the property. It was lovely and we fully appreciated the hotel's eagerness to make up for the problems. They definitely succeeded! We have stayed there many times but this was the first time there were any problems and they certainly did well by us.
review.positiveRemarks: We love the location and the architecture of the hotel.
review.locationRemarks: Right on the Embarcadero across from the Ferry Building. Close to all varieties of public transportation.

review.title: Great hotel for a weekend getaway.
review.reviewText: We love to stay here. We always get a bayview room which has a nice balcony overlooking the embarcadero and the bay. Love the architecture of the hotel, the balcony and the location is great!
review.locationRemarks: Close to North Beach or the Embarcadero, walkable to Union Square - great location!

review.title: Anniversary Get Away
review.reviewText: The staff would bend over backward to do things for you. My husband and I were celebrating our anniversary and loved every minute of it. I would highly recommend this hotel to my friends and family.
review.positiveRemarks: The staff was very friendly and helpful.

review.title: Great hotel, great location!
review.reviewText: Staff, location and room was great. Valet service extremely expensive. Atrium was beautiful and our balcony room was worth the extra money. Bathroom in need of updating.

review.title: Perfect location, great staff.
review.reviewText:
Stains in the carpeting were a little disappointing, but the bed was very clean and comfortable. The hotel is older, so it is entitled to have a few minor issues. Overall, the room was very clean and comfortable.

Loved the location and the staff. I would visit again.

review.title: equal to 2.5 starshotel service expectation
review.reviewText:
Breakfast is not like 4 star hotel- and service is not good at all
My bedroom is not beyond my expectation - very basic
Safety box is not working
Breakfast on my first day around 7 am the food was not in right temperature ;-( they forgot to put the flame on to keep the food warm
review.locationRemarks: Location is anout minutes walking distance to union squire

review.title: disappointing
review.reviewText: the room thermostat is old fashioned and would not cool the room.

review.title: Great Hotel
review.reviewText: Great hotel. Well worth every penny you spend. Great location, the staff was so professional and friendly, and the ambiance was superb. Staying there really took the stress out of traveling and made us feel relaxed.
review.negativeRemarks: Being able to hear the city sounds in the street from your room.
review.locationRemarks: Great location. Right next to the bart/munni station, waterfront, and old ferry building.

review.title: Good location and nice vew of the Bay Bridge
review.reviewText: We stayed at the Hyatt for just one night. The hotel located in the Financial district, a few blocks away from the most tourist areas. We actually prefer this way.
