We were there for the weekend and we really enjoyed the empty streets. The room is large for SF standards but the bathroom is relatively small. There are plenty of power outlets so you can always find one to recharge you gadgets. The hotel seems well maintained (but a little dated). The light decoration pending from the roof in the lobby is very nice. The bar in the lobby is good but we wanted to go to the Regency Club on the rooftop. However, we arrived too late. They informed us that it closes at 9:00pm and also you need to make reservations. This is not a budget hotel at all but if you want to stay in a good hotel in SF there are no cheap options. You can find low-cost hotels in the nearby cities for a lot less but then you have to drive back to SF what may take around 30 minutes depending on where you stay.

managementResponses.response: Wow! Thank you so much for your review and congratulations on your 17th year anniversary! We truly appreciate your compliments on our staff. We look forward to welcoming you back for many more years to come!

review.title: Great hotel for entire family.Only place we stay.
review.reviewText: It was our 17th year wedding anniversary,the entire staff went out of their way to make our stay very memorable & pleasant.It's the ONLY hotel we stay at when in San Francisco,& that is quite often.
review.negativeRemarks: Nothing
review.locationRemarks: Close to everything,only place when in S.F.

review.title: Always a great place to stay
review.reviewText: My wife and I got engaged at the top of the hotel in the club lounge and we look forward to staying there every time we visit San Francisco. The close proximity to the Saturday farmers market and walking distance to the ballpark are just a cople of great things about the area. With Views like the one we had in our most recent stay, you can't not love the place!
review.positiveRemarks: The lobby is one of the nicest in town! We love the lights!!
review.locationRemarks: Perfect location for everything we enjoy doing in the city.

review.title: Hyatt regency
review.reviewText: Some difficulty getting from Rgency Club to hotel floor. The elevator wouldn't stop. Overall a good experience.
review.negativeRemarks: It needs a better menu in restaurant

review.title: Wonderful hotel in a convenient area.
review.reviewText: The hotel itself is very nice with a great staff, although they should include a power bar near the desk in the room, and also have some charging plugs near bedside table for families who all have their own smart phone via USB charging. This hotel is in a great area. The rooms are quite up to date with decor and amenities.
review.negativeRemarks: Expedia reservation details involving breakfast were not clearly communicated to hotel staff, and not enough power outlets for laptops in room.
review.locationRemarks: Excellent location, near ferry building and many interesting areas.

review.title: Nothing out of ordinary.
review.reviewText: I had to pay for internet. Used room service for breakfast and it never arrived, but then I got complimentary lunch. The bed was very comfortable and the room a good size.It was a " bay view" room but it was a partial bay view. The staff is very efficient and friendly.
review.negativeRemarks: The building itself
review.locationRemarks: Great location

review.title: Nice romantic place to stay.
review.reviewText: The hotel was very clean, and the staff were very welcoming. In a city that can feel very cramped, every time I entered the hotel it was like a breath of fresh air with the large open space inside. The hotel is in a nicer area of the City to stay, so you don't have to worry about wierdos as much. I loved the sliding glass door that opened in the room. The concierge was wonderful, they helped us find restaurants to dine at, and even called to make reservations for us.
review.positiveRemarks: The Huge atrium. It is very welcoming and open.
review.negativeRemarks: The price of parking was steep, but it is expensive to have luxury in the city.
review.locationRemarks: Great location to stay. Easy to catch transportation to any part of the city.

review.title: wouldnt go back
review.reviewText: the hotel itself was old and needs some updating, the staff was cordial and polite but there were no extra niceties in the hotel room itself

review.title: Great location
review.reviewText: Well located for the wharf and the hop on hop off bus

review.title: Extremely satisfied
review.reviewText: Only small complaint is that for the expense, there was no free wifi, even in the lobby. But all together, excellent.
review.negativeRemarks: No free wifi
review.locationRemarks: Very comfortable and well located.

review.title: Great location
review.reviewText:
Very large room with comfortable beds and great pillows.
Enjoyed the view from the deck.
Great location.

review.title: Best hotel in the city!
review.reviewText: We had an amazing stay at the Hyatt Regency. The location is perfect. The city is beautiful!

review.title: A view to a drowning
review.reviewText:
WiFi was expected on the Lobby, after a check in their website, but no, and concierge doesn't know what is a WiFi access point. In 2012! So $9.95 per day, for just ONE DEVICE (it stack up).

Correct room, correct view on the bay area with a balcony, buggy interactive TV (switched language, crashed it for 10 minutes!), good but expensive movie to rent, beautiful lobby, no more panoramic view...

Looks like the titanic: have been beautiful but it's drowning!
review.positiveRemarks: Superb Lobby, great view if you are lucky.
review.negativeRemarks: No more in line with it's quality standard.
review.locationRemarks: At 2 minutes of Pier 1, subway station, Bart station (SF airport), tramways, buses, I think the location is perfect!

review.title: Great Location
review.reviewText: Staff was super friendly, concierge was really helpful. Parking at the hotel was $56/day, however, because of its location, we were able to find parking on the street for FREE (on the weekend) and during the week after meter hours--didn't end up spending a dime on parking. There's a bike rental stand just outside the door of the hotel $9/hour, or $27 per day, which was a nice way to get around the HILLY city. There's also a trolley stop and bus stop just outside. On the weekends the market outside has vendors selling everything from photos, jewelry, souvenirs. Breakfast was $50 for two, although delicious, way overpriced. I'd definitely stay at this hotel again!
review.locationRemarks: business district--a couple miles from "the scene" but better because of it

review.title: Loved it
review.reviewText: The best part was the breakfast server's. They were friendly and very helpful with everything. No complaints what so ever with this hotel. Great location to go to AT&T Park or Fisherman's Wharf.

review.title: Very comfortable Hotel!
review.reviewText: Very immpresive atrium lobby. Good Service al all.

review.title: great place to stay with family
review.reviewText: we were very pleased with our stay at Hyatt Regency in SF. the staffs were wonderful and friendly. the only down fall is the expensive parking. public transportation is right in front of the hotel, cable car, metro...and very close to market square. we would definitely stay here again. highly recommended.
review.negativeRemarks: price for parking
review.locationRemarks: the location is very convenient.

review.title: I would not recommend it to my friend
review.reviewText: old, dirty and noisy. The only good thing was its location.
review.negativeRemarks: dirty

review.title: Good overall
review.reviewText: Small for a family of 4. Only double beds, not queen. Very expensive parking.
review.positiveRemarks: Good location to walk to Pier 1 market and china town.
review.negativeRemarks: Small room and expensive parking.

review.title: Hotel has great location.
review.reviewText: We were a group of 12 traveling for business. We picked the hotel because the location was convenient for our meetings. The hotel was very nice and comfortable. It's location also provided easy access to great food and entertainment.
review.positiveRemarks: Great location, near the Ferry building and Embarcadero. Shopping mall and food court next door.
review.negativeRemarks: Difficult to find using gps

review.title: Perfect location!
review.reviewText: This hotel was perfectly located down near the Ferry building and right next to the beginning of the cable cars. We were impressed with the friendliness and helpfulness of the staff. Being newcomers to San Francisco, we had many questions about restaurants and directions and we were given excellent advice. Our room was very comfortable. We will definitely stay here when we return to S.F.

review.title: Great Location for working/visiting San Francisco
review.reviewText: Great location for work and san francisco visiting

review.title: Quick trip
review.reviewText: We had a very pleasant experience at this hotel. The staff was friendly and courteous, and the room (although oddly laid out) was quite comfortable and very clean. It is within short walking distance of many different public transportation options, and the lobby restaurant was outstanding. Parking was a bit high, but allowed in and out privileges. We were in town for a short business meeting and to celebrate our anniversary, when we asked if we had a nice view he said yes, we had a bay view, but it was a very narrow view of the ferry building. Overall we had a great stay.
review.negativeRemarks: Parking charges

review.title: The Hyatt is in perfect locatio.
review.reviewText: Our staying at the Hyatt was great. The only thing I would change to be able to register earlier to your room than 3:00pm.

review.title: Great customer service.
review.reviewText: The employees were great. They excel in service from valet to room service. The hotel was very well maintained and met our every need. They service in the hotel bar was a little lacking in knowledge and attentiveness. Everything else was great.

review.title: Convenient location
review.reviewText: Location was wonderful and very convenient; staff was very friendly; Breakfast buffet was fabulous - wonderful food variety and different foods each day. Only negative for me was that I expected a better room - it needs upgrading - carpets are worn; bathroom was not ventilated; walls are very thin - could hear neighbors' conversations.
review.negativeRemarks: room - needs upgrading
review.locationRemarks: Convenient! Near warf; trolley and BART lines.

review.title: Friendly and helpful staff!
review.reviewText: The hotel and staff were just fabulous. Everyone was friendly and helpful, smiling. Our room was clean, and had a beautiful view. Breakfast was included in our stay, and it was their standard buffet which was well prepared and tasted great! I have stayed here before, and would stay here again.
review.negativeRemarks: Nothing!
review.locationRemarks: Easy walk to the Ferry building and many other sights.

review.title: No HD welcome to 2002
review.reviewText: The rooms are in desperate need of an update. No HD, no mini bar in my supposed suite, no room service after 11pm, difficult to get around the hotel due to the design. Tiny shower. Toilet ran all night, stains on the carpet. Scratches all over the furniture.
review.negativeRemarks: The condition of the room, the lack of services offered
review.locationRemarks: Convienence

review.title: Great Hotel for Families
review.reviewText:
The service provided at the hotel was wonderful. We had a young child with us and no matter where we went or what we were doing they catered to all of us.

The dining room and lobby was family friendly and and very welcoming. We ate most of our dinners at the hotel becuase of the family freindly staff, service and amazing food.

Would recommend to any family wanting to stay in the area.
review.negativeRemarks: Literally walking around the corner or across the street from the hotel and being asked for money and running into the Occupy SF
review.locationRemarks: Location is great if you want the business side of the house, will probably stay closer to Fishermans Wharf with the family next time, here for work.

review.title: Great Hotel for San Francisco vacation
review.reviewText: The hotel was in a good location to go sightseeing, and easy access to buses and street cars. Also great for walking to many of the attractions. The maid service was good, but we did have to request extra towels, new drinking glasses, and coffee machine replenishment, which should have been automatic. Other than that, the hotel worked out great!
review.positiveRemarks: Location and Starbucks across the street. (Fastest Starbucks I've ever been to!)
review.negativeRemarks: We had a view but not from the bed. You had to go to the window to see it. From the bed you just saw the side of another building.
review.locationRemarks: At the Embarcadero. At the BART stop. Buses run right outsdie the hotel. very convenient. Next to shopping and farmer's market.

review.title: Beautiful Hotel
review.reviewText:
The hotel staff was willing to help us with a smile and didn't seem like we were bothering them. We weren't from the area so we had a lot of questions. The hotel was absolutely BEAUTIFUL!
The only bad thing is you have to pay $57/night for parking. I thought that was a little rediculous!
review.negativeRemarks: The only bad thing is you have to pay $57/night for parking. I thought that was a little rediculous!
review.locationRemarks: The location is perfect, right in walking distance of many attractions!

review.title: Couldn't earn points and room was old
review.reviewText: I was very disappointed that they would not except my Hyatt Platinum number because I booked through expedia. I was also disappointed with the attitude. I checked in at 2.30 and was told I was too early as official checkin is 3pm. When I showed my surprise that 2.30 was considered "early" I was told they could get me a different room. However, I thought the room I got was very old and a bit run down which was again disappointing.
review.negativeRemarks: the attitude, how old the room was

review.title: Best location needs windows renovation
review.reviewText: No double glazing and even at the 8th floor the street noise 24 hours was disturbing
review.negativeRemarks: Street noise is a real problem

review.title: nice hotel
review.reviewText: Overall it's a nice hotel, but the washroom is a little small. Convenience to everywhere but some restaurants near by close too early! Only one bad experience was on the last day (May 12) when I need to leave my luggage at the bell desk and the gentleman there were not very nice. I felt he did not want to help me at all and gave me the dirty look! All other staff was very friendly and nice.

review.title: The lobby is a great meeting place
review.reviewText: Fantastic location and the lobby is a superb place to meet customers and partners...

review.title: Hyatt in name, but not in service.
review.reviewText: A very nice hotel close to shopping, food and all the piers. Hotel Lobby is impressive and design of hotel is magnificent. Staff seems to need a refresher course in hotel etiquette. Valet Parking costs more than a rental at $57 per day. Self Parking is a deal at $32, but don't park there after midnight as the elevators will have already shut off for the night. If money is no object this is your place.
review.positiveRemarks: close to tourist areas along the pier
review.negativeRemarks: hotel is so big, that our room was a quarter mile from the elevator
review.locationRemarks: great location

review.title: I was amazed!
review.reviewText: This is one of the best hotels in the US that I have stayed at. From the valet, the bell staff, front desk to the Regency Club, I was simple amazed. This hotel staff understands good service. The room I stayed in was on the 16th floor with a balcony and great view of the Bay. Comfort of the bed rivaled my own. The bathroom had in the mirror a tv so could you keep up on sports while shaving. Lastly, I highly recommend you take advantage of th Regency Club on the top floor. The 360 degree view of the city can be enjoy with either a chair massage, wine, or with any of the breakfast-lunner-dinner offerings. If you are afraid of heights, there have a nice bar/resturant on the main floor. I can't think of staying anywhere else when you visit San Fran.
review.negativeRemarks: No hotel is perfect, but I did notice any flaws
review.locationRemarks: Great location!

review.title: Good Hotel
review.reviewText:
Good area to stay in, close to the different piers and near the farmers market on Saturday. The staff were all very friendly. It is a good hotel and good staff for the price. If you are looking for luxury, this is not it.However,they do have big rooms albeit with small bathrooms.

I don't know if I would have made this a 4 star hotel, maybe a 3.5 star.

review.title: Watch for parking cost
review.reviewText: Parked next door at 4th Embarcadero. 24-hour parking pass for $32 should allow exit and re-entry. Ended-up costing us extra $32 just to go out for dinner. Parking is setup to rip you off rather than being convenient.
review.negativeRemarks: Street noise and parking
review.locationRemarks: Great

review.title: Meeting trip March 2012
review.reviewText: Very clean rooms. Location was great, right next to a cablecar route, a streetcar, and a BART station. You could go anywhere in SF easily on public transportation from this hotel. Hit the Walgreens across the street and get a public transportation pass and you will be set to see all the sights of SF without breaking your budget on taxis. The only potential downside was that some of the nearby restaurants are not open for dinner, the hotel restaurant is average (had dinner there one evening), although the breakfast buffet did look very nice while I was grabbing my free coffee in the mornings. First time staying in the financial district, but will probably stay here again on future trips.

review.title: Suggestion.
review.reviewText: The only thing I would recommend for each room- the Shampoo/Conditioner/Lotion, smells so bad, that I had a hard time using it... I didn't bring my own, so had no choice but to use it. Please, please please change it to something more pleasing.
review.negativeRemarks: the shampoo/conditioner smell/brand..
review.locationRemarks: Location was ideal.

review.title: Wonderful atmosphere
review.reviewText: The staff was very helpful. The location is very convenient to everything. I would definitely stay there again if I could only afford another trip. I rate this hotel and workers superior.
review.positiveRemarks: Quality of the staff. I sincerely believe their goal was to make the stay of the guest a quality stay.
review.negativeRemarks: For the price you should have received a morning newspaper.
review.locationRemarks: Easy access to Chinatown, Fisherman's Wharf, easy to find your way out of town and easy access to the BART.

review.title: Great location for a weekend in San Francisco
review.reviewText: This hotel is well-located for an easy ride on the BART from the airport to a stop just next to the hotel, a short walk to the ferry building for great coffee and food, and a nice 1 mile walk to the city center at Union Square. The room was comfortable, clean and pleasant, though the bathroom could definitely use an update. I have no complaints and I would definitely stay here again.

review.title: Balcony room is a must
review.reviewText: Located directly across from the Ferry Building and overlooking the Bay Bridge and Treasure Island with stunning views of San Francisco Bay. The parking valets provided superb service.
review.negativeRemarks: none

review.title: Hyatt Regency Hotel Room stay experience
review.reviewText:
The room was exceptionally kept clean when we arrive. However, there were some non-functional items found in the room as follows:

a) Mini-Bar is not turned on
b) No refrigerator
c) No microwave oven
d) Coffee Maker is found hidden inside the closet
e) Toilet water tank filler stop doesn't stop

However, the hotel room package makes up for the above deficiencies so our hotel experience exceeded our general expectations.
review.negativeRemarks: Elevator waiting time was too long so we had to take the stairs down to the lobby most of the times.
review.locationRemarks: Can't get a better Embarcadero Fireworks view in SF and New Year's eve hotel experience than the Hyatt Regency.

review.title: Disappointed
review.reviewText: Christmas lights in the lobby were beautiful but the whole place is too big and impersonal. Our room was 6th floor over the entrance and was really noisy in am. You might think a new hotel like that would put in double-paned windows to cut down on that problem. Also they knew we were 4 in the room and we only had towels, glasses, coffee etc. for 2. Shouldn't have to ask for that kind of stuff at those prices. Next time we will stay in Union Square area, lots more going on around there. Thought we would have a nice view of bay and be quieter at the Embarcadero - but not the case. No view and plenty of noise!
review.negativeRemarks: No view and noise.

review.title: Great location; spectacular lobby
review.reviewText: The lobby was festooned with thousands of hanging lights for the holidays: a beautiful sight. You cannot beat this location ... near the Ferry Building and Market St. Room was large and comfortable, with a lovely balcony (and a view of the bay). The room could have been cleaner (found some hairs -- gross! -- in the bathroom), and the sink was cracked.

review.title: Business Hotel
review.reviewText: If you are traveling with a family this is not the place for you.This hotel is obviously intended for a business person with an expense account. Conveniently located with beautiful atmoshere and lots of amenities.The rooms could be bigger, but have all you need and are quiet. No comfort food here. The Chef has surrendered good tasting food for elegance, which is reflected by the price. The staff was pleasant and eager to assist with any request. I will stay here again when on business, but will look elsewhere when accompanied by family.
review.locationRemarks: Not sure.

review.title: Clean and Comfy
review.reviewText: The hotel was very clean, the beds were comfy and that's all I really care for. The location wasn't that great and it was unfortunate that the protesters were across from the hotel.

review.title: Needs Work! Great Location.
review.reviewText:
As a SF native I knew what to expect from hotels in the city (small rooms, noisy, old building). I picked this hotel for it is close to everything that I wanted to see. BUT......

The room was a major disappoinment. There was a bag of left over food in the mini bar from a previous guest and the mini bar was off. Then in the bathroom I saw a few areas where the tile had black mold. The last few moments in the room.... I was bending over to get my suitcase and noticed what was either vomit or food that had been spilled and dripped down the bed skirt. It was a swath about 10 inches long and as equally as wide. It turned my stomache and I simply walked out. I never said anything but just made a mental note to stay in a different place next time. This property is overdue for a remodel and some serious cleaning. I woudln't stay here again until they do!

review.title: Lovely hotel
review.reviewText: Wonderful bed, nice view

review.title: fun in the city
review.reviewText:
We had a great weekend in San Francisco staying at the Hyatt
parking is just around the corner and we saved a few bucks there
the location was excellent and I can't say enough about our stay what fun we had

we will be coming back soon

review.title: Good but not great
review.reviewText:
Very accommodating staff - but we did not feel that the room standards reflected the price.

Great location, anyway, and very impressive lobby.
review.locationRemarks: Embarcadero - Pier #1 - super for shopping, restaurants, central location

review.title: Heart of San Francisco
review.reviewText: We stayed at the Hyatt Regency for 5 days and loved it! A wonderful location in the financial district that was safe and close to a lot of tourist attractions. The BART, trolley and cable car stops were all extremely close. The concierge was very helpful as was the doorman and most of the front desk clerks. Also, we never had a bad meal at the restaurant or with room service. The only con during our trip was this: The front desk attendant checking us in was abrupt and distracted. We had several delays getting checked into our room because the front desk thought it had been cleaned and it was not. We finally checked in about 3 hours after arriving. The management sent up some wine and fruit later that evening for our trouble.
review.locationRemarks:
We took a city tour and a trip to Muir Woods and Sausalito through the Great Pacific Tour company, per the concierge's recommendation, and enjoyed them thoroughly. Although, unless you enjoy shopping, there wasn't much to do in Sausalito. We also took the evening tour of Alcatraz and loved it!

However, be warned that if you are staying over the weekend, the majority of the shops and restaurants around the hotel close between 5-6pm. We know we were in the financial district but still found this odd. Also, the F-train that takes you to the Fisherman's Wharf area is very busy most of the time, so be prepared to be crowded and probably have to stand for the short trip. Finally, we ate dinner at the Waterfront on Pier 7 one evening, and I would recommend skipping it. The food was just ok, it was overpriced, and the service was slow and not especially courteous.

review.title: very expensive
review.reviewText: Having stayed in a number of hotels in California on a family trip this hotel was the most expensive and although the location was central wasn't the greatest

review.title: Bad experience
review.reviewText: The hotel has no privacy policy. We stayed for three nights, since the beginning they allowed several drunk teams to scream in lobby and hallways all night long 'til dawn.

review.title: Seem to be cutting back
review.reviewText:
This hotel is a good value for the basics. Anything extra will be charged. No free Wi-Fi. Newspapers used to be delivered to the room. Then they were stacked at the elevators. Now they are only available at the bell desk in the lobby.

Like many hotels they have installed nice big flat panel TVs but the selections are limited, all displayed in the wrong format (stretched and not adjustable) and no High Def channels.

There seems to be fewer staff around. They DID replace the non-functioning clock unit when we called. The hotel has started a practice of not changing towels OR bed linens unless you notify the desk by phone that you want this service. That seems rather extreme to me.

The rooms are quiet, have nice views and are good sized.

We enjoy the location near the bay, ferries and food market. The street peddlers are becoming tackier and more intrusive in the neighborhood.

We will consider using a different hotel in the future.

review.title: Great Hotel
review.reviewText: beautiful hotel, great service, helpful concierge, parking is expensive but worth it there's a 24 hr valet. Reliabel service, very accomodating, great location can get street and cable car from close by to all attractions, no free internet,

review.title: "A different hotel next time"
review.reviewText:
What I liked the most was the great location: steps from the BART, and proximity to Ferry Terminal and Market St.. The offer to give us 2 complimentary breakfasts for the disruptive sleep while there.

What I didn't like was their unreliable WiFi, noise from the street from workers (we were on the 6th floor facing the street) in the middle of the night and early morning, and slow service at the desk due to computer problems.

review.title: Breakfast buffet is delicious
review.reviewText:
The service at this hotel is good and our room was clean and tidy.
The breakfast buffet is so delicious and the quality of the food is very high and tasty.
Generel noise from lobby, street and fellow guests is quite loud as the doors/windows/rooms do not seem to be insulated that well.
Fine location.

review.title: Location, location, location!
review.reviewText: Stunning hotel, extraordinary service and fantastic location! Right across from the Ferry Building with amazing bay views, right at the end of a cable car line, right next to Muni bus and rail lines, it could not be more conveniently located. The doormen, the valet, the front desk agent and the bellman were right on. Friendly, welcoming and sincerely courteous without being obsequious and cloying, absolutely perfect. The hotel lobby is spectacular, has to be seen to be believed. Many eateries within a couple of blocks and a 24-hour store right across the street. The rooms were well appointed, scrupulously clean and very comfortable. Loved the floor to ceiling windows too! The exercise room was great but really missed a pool or spa to rest my aching feet from all the walking we did! Seriously, the only poor experience was with the concierge who were absolutely terrible, all of them. I dealt with at least four different ones and they were equally indifferent, one had terrible body odor and none seemed bothered to do their job. A real contrast to the front desk agents who couldn't have been nicer or more accommodating. We asked for an early check-in and a late check-out, we got it. I asked them for help with things I would normally ask a concierge and they were terrific! Has drinks in the lobby bar and the staff there were great too. Nice non-alcoholic drinks menu for the kids, perfect! Would absolutely recommend this hotel and stay again and again!

review.title: Definitely the place to stay...
review.reviewText: Great hotel. Very clean and in a great location.

review.title: Perfect location
review.reviewText: Great location for the 4th of July. Had reservations at the Slanted Door across the street in the Ferry Building. A perfect combination for a great meal...Walked to the Giants game. Loved our stay at the Hyatt!

review.title: Poor Concierage service
review.reviewText: Concierage reccomended taking shuttle to Muir Woods. Was ok on the way out but coming back was a disaster. Needed some additional information but the desk was not open or line was extremely long. Other than that hotel was ok and location was ok.

review.title: UNHAPPY
review.reviewText: NO POOL AT THIS HOTEL. REALLY! WHAT HOTEL DOESN'T HAVE A POOL IN CA? NO VENDING MACHINES AT 3AM WHEN WE WERE THIRSTY. WE WALKED ACROSS THE STREET AT 3AM TO A 7 ELEVEN THAT WAS CROWDED. LOCATION WAS NOT EASY TO DEAL WITH. WE STAYED IN FISHERMAN'S WHARF THE NIGHT BEFORE AND THAT WAS THE PERFECT LOCATION WITH A POOL.

review.title: Perfect Location
review.reviewText:
If you are looking for the best location hotel, this is it! There are a lot of public transportation connection near by. I would not recommend you going with your car, as you will pay $57 per night for the car. I cannot say the best things about the hotel service at the front desk (check in and out). People were not too friendly. Make sure you bring all the paperwork you need. They charge a lot for the business center, and the personel there is the worst!
Hotel is a little worn out for the price (old bathroom, carpet, furniture...) but the bed quality and the pillows were very satisfactory.
The best things of all were concierge personel. Extremely friendly, kind and willing to take extra mile. So if you did not completely planned your time in San Francisko, they can organize and come up with great ideas! Make sure you ask for the restaurant list. They have the best food!!!

review.title: We'd do it again
review.reviewText: Check the cable car repair schedule if you were counting on them to get around.

review.title: Great hotel, great location
review.reviewText: No complaints, only positives. Looking forward to returning.

review.title: Good but had an issue
review.reviewText: My husband and I just got back from San Francisco and absolutely LOVED our vacation. The view was beautiful and the workers were very friendly. The only problem that we had was that our power went out in the room & after going down to the desk twice, it finally got turned back on (45 min later). However, the maintenance manager came to our door and rudely asked if we were using the blow dryer and iron at the same time. Our answer was yes, because we had an 8:00 pm reservation for dinner. Unfortunetly we MISSED our reservation because apparently the Hyatt doesn't have enough power to use the blow dryer and iron at the same time. The way that the worker held him self and spoke to us was not appropriate! Being rude to a customer who spent so much money to stay at your hotel was not right! I was furious but other then this small mishap, we had a lovely time!

review.title: Older, but still beautiful!
review.reviewText: We recently stayed at the Hyatt Regency in S.F. on a family vacation. It was well located within easy walking distance of china town, Union square and the Embarcadero. Public trnasportation is plentiful downtown and we had no problems leaving the car at the hotel and walking or taking BART everywhere we wanted to go. The hotel itself has baan around awhile, and there was some wear and tear evident in our room. The baseboards needed repainting and the bathroom vanity cabinet had some serious dings in it. The lobby is lovely, and doesn't show the age of the property. We had a very basic room on the 10th floor with two double beds (even though Expedia listed the room as having two queen beds, a point which I will take up with them at a later time) There is no complimentary morning coffee, but rather a coffee honor bar that requests a "donation" of $2.00. Starbucks is across the street. The room was quiet. For the money, it was a good stay. The downside was the $57.00 per day charge for guest parking. The garage across the street charged $37.00 per day.

review.title: Noisy due to construction on streets surrounding hotel as of May 2011
review.reviewText: Nothing out of the ordinary. This hotel is what you would expect for a Hyatt. Very beautiful lobby. Couldn't sleep at all because of construction noise. I wish hotel would have informed us about the construction. They were jack hammering and paving all night long and even though we were pretty far from the activity, we could still hear the noise. Noise started at 12am and didn't finish until sunrise. Other than that, pretty nice hotel.

review.title: "Will stay there again"
review.reviewText: The Hyatt Regency was in a great location. We were able to walk (several blocks but not a bad walk) in a safe area to Union Square. We also caught an Historic bus and went down to Fisherman's Wharf. The walk to the ballpark (AT&T) was somewhat long but scenic and easy, plus we had time to stroll. The rooms were clean. The beds were VERY comfortable. The staff was super helpful and courteous. We go to San Francisco often and to this date have NEVER been so pleased as we were at this hotel (we have tried many). If I had to say one bad thing it would be the expense of the valet parking. We knew it was costly before hand. If one did not know that going in they might be surprised. On the other hand the friendliness and helpfulness of the men working there made up for it.

review.title: A fine place to stay in SF near the wharf
review.reviewText: The building is an interesting 1960's architecture.. the rooms are pleasant and the views are beautiful. The bed was very comfortable. I would return if on a business trip.

review.title: Great location!
review.reviewText: We had a nice evening at this wonderful location near the Ferry Bldg, Embarcadero and AT&T. Only negative was the nice flat screen HDTV but only analog channels!

review.title: The place to be in San Fran
review.reviewText: The room was great, the bathroom and shower suburb, and the breakfast brunch out of this world.

review.title: Great Hotel in a great location
review.reviewText:
Hotel was very good and clean, we were there for ten days over the Christmas holiday and enjoyed our stay. The room was big and clean, The one thing I could not understand was why they had to stock the fridge and put a sensor in there. because of that, we could not put our drinks or water in the fridge. Again a hotel like this, should be able to afford complimentary wifi for guests but you have to pay abpout $13 i think to use wifi in the hotel, Thank God there was a Starbucks and Bistro Burger right across from the hotel that had complimentary wifi, so went there everyday to check e-mails and have breakfast or lunch. Didn't eat at the hotel, it was ridiculously expensive and the menu I saw, had no seafood which I had been looking forward to.

The location of the hotel is excellent, right across from the subway station and the cable car stop, the F-line which goes to Fisherman's wharf is right across too as well as the ferry building and farmer's market. It is a short walk to the excellent shopping at Union Square. We also had a beautiful view of the bay bridge from our hotel room. All in all, it was a wonderful experience and we would stay here again if we can get it at the same rate we found it on Expedia.

review.title: Excellent hotel and location
review.reviewText: This is a very nice hotel with decent prices and excellent location

review.title: San Francisco Christmas Trip
review.reviewText: Great location for tourists. Public Transportation is right in front of the hotel or you can walk to a lot of sights from the hotel.

review.title: Excellent hotel , not a good place to eat
review.reviewText: Excellent Hotel , perfect location , clean and the staff is good...I'm a bit disapointed though with the service in the restaurant. The breakfast is fine , but , expensive and the service is not as good as the one we recieved from the rest of the Hotel crew.

review.title: The perfect family location in San Francisco
review.reviewText: We were delighted. The hotel was very impressive and situated right across from the Ferry Buildingperfect for visiting the Market, shopping, eating, and walking along Embarcadero. It was also an easy walk (if you like walking) to Union Square and the famous China Town area. We loved the area. Lots to see, felt very safe, and there was great shopping and dining nearby. And the hotel was right outside a Bart station which made it easy and cost effective to get to and from the airport. No traffic jams.

review.title: San Franciso-New Years Eve-2010 AMAZING!!!!!
review.reviewText:
My girlfriend went to San Francisco from December 28-January 1, 2011.
We had an amazing time @ the hotel because it was in the most perfect
location. The Ferry Building across the streeet was really beautiful, and other
locations to walk to were very easy.

review.title: This was a dream come true.
review.reviewText:
The Hyatt was located in a great spot to every where.
We will come back.
We used to go to San Francisco and always would walk through the lobby and say one day, we would get to stay here and we did.
It met all of our expectations, especially the people-from the front desk, to the food servers, cleaning lady, and all the people there we asked questions to.
The people were just the best.

review.title: SAN FRANCISCO S MAGIC WILL BE BACK REAL SOON
review.reviewText: TV DID NOT WORK ROOM TO DARK TOO SMALL LAMPS WERE BROKEN

review.title: Great hotel, perfect location
review.reviewText: This hotel was extremely nice for the price. Great location next to all available means of mass transit for visitors. Room was clean and staff was very courteous.

review.title: LET DOWN
review.reviewText:
The hotel was notified this was our wedding anniverisity the hotel manager did nothing special for me and my wife even after me bringing this to his attention.
We paid an addition charge for the up grade for an Ocean veiw room our view was mostly roof tops the manager told me this was the best they could do.

review.title: I will highly recommend this hotel...
review.reviewText: Very impressive hotel. Clean, organized, centric, friendly personnel, closeness to public transportation, a comfortable rooms. Security was decent, nevertheless lot of homeless which may looks unsecured. One important missing item is SPA services.

review.title: charged for WiFi
review.reviewText: We travel around the world as well as in a motorhome and find that campgrounds and much less expensive hotels offer free WiFi. It is just tacky after paying a big price for a very nice room that they would ask us to pay extra for that service. We wanted to purchase some cheeses, etc. at the Ferry Building across the street, but sign over the refrigerator warned us that we even opened the door we would be charged. Our room was lovely with a wonderful view from our balcony, but couldn't enjoy it fully with those two restrictions.

review.title: Can't wait to go back!
review.reviewText: Overall Hyatt exceeded my expectations. I have always stayed with Marriott and took a chance based on price and location in the city. I am so glad I did. The decor for the holidays was beautiful and the staff was wonderful! The only thing I didn't like was the fact that above our bed was a really gross stain but other than that I can't complain. The concierge went above and beyond and the valet was great! The food in the restaurant was expensive as usual but it was worth it. My clam chowder bread bowl after a cold night at Alcatraz was delicious and satisfying. Thank you Hyatt for changing my mind about only choosing Marriott.

review.title: Would definately stay again, very impressive!!
review.reviewText: We were offered for a price an upgrade to a suite to which we accepted, however this was only on the 5th floor. We had already purchased the Regency room option for our stay & were extremly delighted with the Regency Room benefits. This hotel is in the financial district but very close to the cable cars, the ferries & the BART.

review.title: Great Business District Location
review.reviewText: Perfect geographical location for both day and evening access to business and tourist's areas. Easy access to public transportation (cable car, bus, Bart). Next time I may even take Bart from the airport which stops at the hotel entrance. Walking distance to many restaurants, the Bay, and a quick cable car ride to tourist piers and scenic sights.

review.title: Great hotel, great city
review.reviewText:
this hotel is a great launch pad for loads of attractions in San Fran. Great views of the bay and ferry building too and especially good if you also need to be near financial area for work. Right next to the BART and a couple of Tram lines and walking distance to China town, Union Square and even fisherman's wharf.

Only downside is that it is in the financial district and can sometimes be difficult to find places open ont he weekend.

Only had one meal in the restaurant, but the food was excellent and affordable.

review.title: Hyatt San Francisco
review.reviewText: The best thing about the hotel was the location.. right on the Embarcadero at the ferry terminal and a focal point for ground transportation. The area is rather busy during the week, but the hotel was perfectly quiet inside. The ferry terminal is filled with shops and breakfast/coffee shops. The best deal by far is the weekly transport pass (available in the ferry terminal) which pays for itself after a few rides on a cable car. The concierge has a good supply of guides and maps are also available at the terminal. The city probably has the best collection of restaurants of any American city, with no end to ethnic foods available, particularly Chinese.

review.title: Excellence at Hyatt Regency SF
review.reviewText: Could not have asked for a better experience! Staff were friendly and helpful, location was perfect for walking around a beautiful city. Bicycle rental just outside hotel was convenient. Concierge helped us get to the 49ers game and back with ease and for good price, as well as made arrangements for airport shuttle. Would highly recommend this hotel to anyone visiting SF!

review.title: Fabulous location
review.reviewText: We wanted a hotel that would be convenient to public transport and within walking distance of some of the places we wanted to spend time. This hotel was perfect for that. We had some really yummy suppers just blocks away and several of the more prominent public transport options were just outside the front door. We were extremely satisfied with the staff and service. The only annoying thing about our room was the faucet handles, which were very difficult to turn, but it became a joke and certainly wouldn't prevent us from recommending this place or staying there again the next time we vaca in San Fran.

review.title: excellent hotel and locale
review.reviewText: Excellent hotel with very accomodating staff

review.title: HYATT
review.reviewText: MY EXPERIENCE WAS A GOOD ONE, WILL DEFINATELY USE THEM AGAIN.

review.title: SF is my city
review.reviewText: Loved that there was a bagel shop around the corner

review.title: Will stay there again!!
review.reviewText: Loved the trip and hotel was so upmarket just made us feel special!!

review.title: One of SF's finest hotels
review.reviewText: elegant hotel, courteous staff, nice amenities, great location. It was Fleet week, with blue angels flying through downtown and over the bay. Great place to watch. Close to Ferry building and the weekend Farmers Market. walking distance to AT&T Park. Several nice restaurants withing walking distance also, plus beautiful view of the Bay Bridge and the Bay.

review.title: location, location
review.reviewText: Stayed end of Aug/2010. The building looks a little bunkerish in its architecture and being all concrete but the interior is quite spectacular. Rooms/bath are standard. Maid service good. You must have a bay view room with balcony. Do not go anywhere near the fridge. It will cost you dearly. A great location! Across the street from the Ferry Building and Ebarcadero with Sat. farmers market and lots of artists stalls. Out the front door you have access to Bart(perfect for to and from the airport) Muni, buses and street cars on Market and of course cable cars up Sacramento to link you in with the rest of the system. Buy a transit pass for your stay, it is invaluable.Starbucks and others across the street to compensate for the in-room coffee maker and Elephant & Castle further up the street for a good breakfast. After a busy day site- seeing and shopping it is great to take transit back to the hotel front door, hit the deck of your room and watch the harbour traffic go by. Really the only thing to improve would be king bed mattress. It was high in the middle with two valleys on each side. Also it seemed the only way to access the lounge with the great views on the top floor was to do a room upgrade. They should make it more available to local folk. Top of the Mark seems to have no restrictions. We would recommend this hotel for its location and friendly/ informative staff.

review.title: Great location, above average hotel. Would definitely go back
review.reviewText: Our stay was enjoyable, Did not find the concierge to be very helpful. Figured things out on our own. The location made it easy to see all the highlights of the city, near ferry landing and lots of public transportation. Food at the hotel was good but very expensive. Felt like I was at a 5 star hotel in Maui. Would definitely consider staying there again if in the area.

review.title: great location, great service, great food!
review.reviewText: The hotel was beautiful, had great service, and the location was perfect for us.

review.title: ideal spot
review.reviewText: The hotel's location was perfect for us - across the street from the Embarcadero and a minute from BART. All our meals were pre-arranged so we didn't have an opportunity to eat at the hotel. The lobby was fantastic - a great spot to have a drink or a cup of coffee. The room had an impressive view of the bay!

review.title: Our Craig Ferguson Weekend
review.reviewText: Check in and check out was very easy. The room was beautiful and everything we expected. Great view of the Bay!! Breakfast was pricey and we were pretty much talked into the buffet. To be honest, it wasn't very good. We will definitely stay there again, but next time, we will skip breakfast and find something in one of the many restaurants nearby.

review.title: Just OK
review.reviewText: I had a Bay View room but the loud music from the restaurant down below that went on until midnight could be bothersome The restaurant has a limited but great menu. Service could be better in the restaurant. It took some time before our order was taken and we were not checked on once the meal was served althought there were several servers standing around. I felt our server was more interested in collecting his tips than taking our order. At one point, he even cut us off mid-order to collect his tip from another table. I did request my room folio for expense purposes using their online request form and received it within 24 hours. The bathroom could be updated. The gym is nice but has no natural light. Prepare to trek down long hallways as well.

review.title: Great great great!
review.reviewText:
We stayed at the Hyatt Regency for 5 nights and loved it! It is a great location, convienient to the Ferry Building and Embacadero. For necessities, a Walgreens, Starbucks, and 7-11 are located across the street, and the BART is literally a 3 -minute walk from the hotel, very convienient for getting to/from airport.

My favourite part of the hotel was the 24-hour fitness center - lovely, very up-to-date, very high tech fitness equipment, and warm towels, free headphones etc to use while there.

Overally, the service with this hotel was fantastic, every worker we encountered was very friendly and professional - from the room cleaners to the check-in desk staff to the concierge.

WOuld stay there again if I ever returned to San Francisco

review.title: Parking is a HUGE additional cost
review.reviewText: The hotel is awesome in a very great location. I would definitely recommend the hotel HOWEVER be warned the parking is OUTRAGEOUS. We were charged 57 for one night. Also we called down for our car an they said it would there in 15 minutes we went down about 10 minutes later. After 10 minutes of waiting I asked where my car was the guy told me they were busy and it would be here soon ( they were not busy there was only 2 other people waiting for their cars). After about a total of 30 minutes from the time I called for my car it finally got there. For just under sixty bucks a night it should have been washed and waxed and delivered promptly. I won't make that mistake again. Look for a nearby parking garage.

review.title: Great hotel.
review.reviewText: We stayed at the Hyatt for 10 days while in San Francisco. The room was very clean with nice view. Can't wait to go back next year.

review.title: great location
review.reviewText:
The Hyatt Regency was great. My 11 year-old son absolutely loved the lobby, with the visible elevators and hanging strings of light. The location was perfect for us - it was a mile walk to AT & T park and a mile in the other direction to Fisherman's Wharf (although there are buses and trolleys so you certainly don't have to walk). Also, the end of one of the cable car lines is steps from the lobby door, which made riding the cable cars tremendously easy, which we did for both fun and as an actual means of getting somewhere. Further, there was a BART/Muni station right next to the hotel, which made using public transportation very convenient.
The room was more than adequate and the staff was nothing but helpful, including moving us to a different room on night two so that we had a view of the bay and the Bay Bridge, which was stunning.
One drawback is that you are in the financial district, so there are not a lot of restaurant choices, but its adequate, especially if dining isn't a top priority.
I had considered staying in the Fisherman's Wharf area, but I am very glad I didn't. A couple of visits there were great, but the more quiet area near the Hyatt, along with the great location, made it a perfect spot for what was a truly unforgettable trip to a most unique, beautiful and just plain awesome city.

review.title: Beautiful, but Nickel and Dimed..and not Helpful.
review.reviewText:
A beautiful building, though bathrooms a bit outdated. The chamber maids were friendly, nice, and the front desk was patient with me. The Doormen were also helpful. The Concierge, as I mentioned, were programmed to only smile and give directions. Not very helpful, or able of handling anything out of the ordinary. What they did help with turned out to be misguided advice.
Always amazes me, the more expensive the hotel, the less aminities they offer. Can go to a Comfort Inn and get free internet, a fridge for your use in the room (thiers was stocked with items at an exhorbant price w/ a steep fee to have them removed, Intenet also a fee per day). Was afraid to touch anything in the room in fear of another cost tacked on (Local calls: charged) Did not use TV in fear of a charge that I may not have noticed. This was a business trip and pennies were counted. The classroom was confortable temp (a real plus.) Even though I was not able to eat much, it was my loss as he food was exquisite.
I know I have been harsh on this otherwise fine Hotel, but this was the worst trip I 've had (I travel frequently) and totally exhausted. Although this certainly is not the fault of the Hotel, it would have been nice if there was someone that had the ability to help troubleshoot for you when you are not sure what to do. Seemed everyone was programed to smile, but not trained to help with t travel disasters. ( I eventially did get my bag back 3 days and 2 extra trips to the airport).

review.title: San Francisco's Best location
review.reviewText:
The Hyatt Regency is located right across the street from the Ferry Building. Muni transportation was right out the front door. After walking the first two days, we started using public transportion (Streetcar, Muni Train, Bart, and Muni Trolly)
The only downfall to our hotel stay was not being offered a complimentary breakfast so every morning we would go out the front door of the Hyatt and stop at Noah's for coffee and homemade bagels.

review.title: Great Location!!
review.reviewText: Great Hotel near everything!

review.title: Great location
review.reviewText: Great location, big and very clean room. The only drawback was the charge for the wifi, which most hotel offer for free.

review.title: Great hotel, great location
review.reviewText:
WOW. What a suprise.

Only thing missing is a pool and jacuzzi.

review.title: Horrible check in experience at the Hyatt.
review.reviewText: Our check in experience was horrible. They refused to let my traveling companion check in since her name was not on the reservation even though I had called a week earlier and gave them her name. We were given a room with one King size bed instead of two doubles. We came back to our hotel one day to find a pile of cleanig rags left on the dresser after our room had been cleaned. Overall, I was extremely disappointed in the Hyatt.

review.title: I will always stay here whenever I visit San Fran
review.reviewText: Hyatt Regency is a beautiful hotel, the lobby simply breathtaking. Kids love it, and It's family-friendly. Although the financial district gets a bit desolate at night, it is basically on the Embarcadero as well as close to other hotspots such as Union Square and the Westfield Mall, and the Golden Gate bridge is about a 10-minute drive. There is also a small mall right next to the hotel, with some eateries and shops. The valet parking is well worth its price, and you're on the highway in no time if you want to drive out to Napa or Santa Cruz for the day. If you want to walk along the water, this is basically one block from the waterfront. Many rooms have a great view, and the staff is friendly and helpful. Great, comfortable stay.

review.title: Very Nice Hotel
review.reviewText: I really enjoyed my stay at this hotel. The concierge service was very awesome. Good size rooms, good location, awesome view of the bay, the bay bridge...definitely worth checking out if you wanna visit San Fran.

review.title: I love San Franciso and this hotel !
review.reviewText: I was pleasantly surprised at the friendly nature of the staff, in particular the doorman/head valet. He was very helpful upon our arrival and ran the length of the hotel driveway to saying good bye to me on our departure date! Very nice guy. I saw him daily for the four days we spent at this hotel and he always made a point of smiling and greeting us in a very scincere way. The check-in staff were also very nice. Overall a very attractive building, clean room with great beds! Haven't sleptt so well in a hotel in years. The room was clean and well laid out with the vanity outside the bath/toilet area for greater functionality. We had a TV issue, dead batteries on the remote. The techician was friendly and offered trolley, and restruant info while he was there assessing theproblem. Only complaint was the weak stream from the shower...but this was minor. Overall I really enjoyed my stay. Lots of places to get a meal, close to the market at the Ferry building and close to the Embarcardero walkway along the piers. If you are walking to peir 39 it takes 25 mins from this hotel.

review.title: Very centrally located and great hotel if you book only room
review.reviewText: The Hyatt Regency Hotel is very well located in the middle of the financial district. We got a good rate as we booked early (min 3 weeks before arrival). We were there with two children and booked two rooms, but as their rooms have good sized queen beds, one room would have to be sufficient for one parent with a child in one queen bed. The rooms were very spacious and the beds very comfortable. However, the breakfast at US$ 28.00 would have been very poor value as is the parking (valet it US$ 58 per day and a nearby parking is still US$ 32 per day). If you are prepared to walk a bit, this can be reduced to US$ 15 per day (along the water front). Overall, great hotel with impressive atrium and great location if you book just the room as a holiday, but probably worth paying more if travelling on business. As usual with Hyatt very efficient checking and check-out.

review.title: Below standard Hyatt branded hotel
review.reviewText: Have been to many club level hotels and in my experience drinks provided during cocktail hour(s) are part of the package. At Hyatt Regency San Francisco this is not the case. You pay a premium for the Regency Club and in return you are required to pay for your own drinks during the cocktail hour. At no point during the reservation process was this advertised. When I rang the front desk to question this they advised they were not allowed to serve drinks at no charge as it was California Law. Not sure how the legal system works there, but surely when advertising a nightly cocktail hour you would mention the fact that alcoholic beverages are not included.

review.title: Not Impredded
review.reviewText: Do not recommend this hotel

review.title: I would like go back to this Hotel
review.reviewText: This Hotel is in a safe place in San Francisco, close to Embarcadero, Bus Stop, You can walk to the Town Center in San Francisco.

review.title: Great Hyatt hotel @ San francisco right by the bay
review.reviewText: The Hyatt experience was wonderful. Everything went smoothly and I got the room with a view of the Bay Bridge and the room it self was very convenient. The staff were excellent and the complimentary breakfast in the morning and the desert in the evening was excellent. Overall, it was a wonderful stay and I would recommend this hotel to anyone.

review.title: WORST Hyatt experience ever! Would never go back!
review.reviewText: My wife and I spent our anniversary there recently. The only thing we liked about this hotel was its location. Upon check in, we noticed the room assigned was fairly noisy, I politely inquired if it was possible to have us transferred to a different room or a higher floor since both my wife and I were light sleepers, the front desk lady replied "you have to REALIZE it's San Francisco here, and it is noisy here"; the bathroom was like a 2-star motel standard, the bath tub was not draining AT ALL, and the people who came to clean the drain of tub gave us a bad attitude because we called them around 10:00 pm - maybe it was too late for them to work. Checkout was super slow and once I got back home, I noticed the actual incidental charge to my credit card was DOUBLE of the invoice I signed upon check out, so I end up dealing with their centralized accounting department for the past three weeks and they STILL couldn't sort things out for me. I already gave up on asking for the refund because I've sent numerous emails and phone calls, I have the actual invoice showing the agreed amount, I even sent them my visa statement as proof and they still couldn't/wouldn't correct their mistakes. My wife and I have stayed in several other Hyatt hotels even at cheaper prices, this particular Hyatt Regency San Francisco Financial District is the WORST ever. I'm sure everyone's experience is different but I personally would NEVER EVER go back there.

review.title: Hyatt Regencey at the Embarcadero
review.reviewText:
I appreciated both the location and the appearance of the hotel. We were able to get from the hotel to where we wanted to go easily. the restaurants close by were great, and the Farmers market on Saturday was fantastic. We also enjoyed the view of the Embarcadero waterfront from our room.
The only downside that our room was far from the elevators, and that was a minor inconvience.

review.title: Surprise
review.reviewText:
The last night of our stay we were awakened by a voice on the hotel P.A system telling us "get out of the building immediately" This was at 2:30 am
Later a recorded voice told us to"disregard the announcement, The reason for the malfunction has been discovered and repaired" --not very reassuring

review.title: good location
review.reviewText: I really liked the location. It was very convenient as I could go to all the tourist attractions easily. One thing I didn't like was that the wireless internet was not free.

review.title: Awesome Hotel, Awesome Location
review.reviewText: I can't believe what a good deal I got on Expedia for this hotel. It is definitely a 5 star by San Fran standards and the location couldn't be better. Customer service was impeccable. Everywhere was walkable from this location and the trolley stop was right outside the hotel. Rooms were spacious and very clean. Right across from the Ferry Building where the market is one of the best I've seen. Walk to all the piers, China town, and Union Square. Wine tours leave very close to this location Would definitely stay here again!

review.title: Great Location!
review.reviewText: Who could ask for more? You step off public transportation and face the door of the Hyatt Regency. Just steps from the waterfront market and upscale shopping, the hotel is close enough to Fisherman's Wharf to access the touristy action but far enough to maintain your sanity. There is some homelessness in the block or two around the location, but I always felt safe. The lobby and hotel interior is cavernous: but I did not book the Hyatt for a B&B feel. You won't enjoy free perks: the hotel food is expensive; there is a charge for internet; it is one of those minifridges that charges you for touching items, but the bed was comfortable and the room was clean. I will say that the bathroom was older, but even that was not uncomfortable.

review.title: Excellent hotel in an easy access area for public transportation
review.reviewText: Well pleased, easy access to cable cars and the piers, great trip.

review.title: "Great hotel - impressed"
review.reviewText: The hotel was great, room very comfortable and clean, friendly staff. San Francisco is much bigger than we thought, we dropped off our hire car as soon as we arrived, thinking we did not need it, but we would have seen more of the city of we had kept the car for an extra day. It would have been very easy to drive around town although public transport is very good. The area around the hotel is much quieter during the evening with many food places closing in the afternoon, so we needed to plan where to eat. Area certainly seemed less chaotic than Pier 39 area, whihc with 2 kids was nice. We would definitely recommend the hotel and definitely recommend San Fran for a few days holiday. We would however probably have had a more of a wild time, without the kids, looked like the nightime scene had a lot of potential.

review.title: No lobby bar in the afternoon.
review.reviewText: Lovely Hotel, great beds, friendly staff...BUT....we like the hanging lights, but miss the softness of the Ivy planter boxes. At 3:00pm your lobby bar was not open. The man stocking the bar told us to come back at 4:30pm. So we went next door to the Thai Restaurant for Happy Hour. It was outstanding! But it seems that a hotel this size should have an open cocktail lounge.

review.title: San Franciso's Jewel of the City
review.reviewText:
The Hyatt was more than expected. The lobby is Soooo grand made me fell like a spent alot to stay there. The staff was extremly courteous and the concierge helps when you want to find a good place to eat, rest, and enjoy the city. Take advantage and they even book excursions like tours right from there. Easy and quick and convenient. You have to enjoy the morning brunch there in their lobby cafe. It rivals any brunch locale and put them to shame. I would definately stay there again when I revisit.
The room was nice but I was in an adjoining room with a door and I could hear every conversation from the people in the next room. My neighbors made alot of noise, however, once I notified the Desk, it was swiftly taken care of. I could even hear the discussion when they called them about the disturbance. "Love this hotel"

review.title: Looking forward to our next visit.
review.reviewText: We have stayed at the Hyatt Regency before several times. We have never been disappointed. It is convenient to all the wonderful shops and great places to eat. Can't wait to go back.

review.title: Wonderful hotel!!
review.reviewText: This hotel was so convenient to everything!! Cable cars and Muni right outside the hotel! Get a CityPass either before you go or once you are there in Fisherman's Wharf! If pays for itself fast! Book Alcatraz tours BEFORE you leave, as we waited until we got there to find out they were booked for the entire next week or two! Bar down in the hotel had happy hour with good prices and appetizers. Housekeeping always brought any extra towels we needed and were very helpful. There is a Wal-greens and a liquor store across the street and we got a cooler and used that in our room instead of the $30.00 charge for the mini-fridge! Loved San Francisco and would love to have had more time. Go across the Golden Gate Bridge and visit the wine country!

review.title: Visitors from Ottawa
review.reviewText: We paid the upgraded price for access to the Regency Club, it was well worth the extra - free breakfast and snacks at prescribed times throughout the day and it gave us somewhere to relax with a panoramic view of the city.

review.title: "Will go back"
review.reviewText: The Hyatt hotel is a great hotel. The lobby is beautiful, rooms are very nice and the bay view that I had requested turned out to be very good. The hotel is located in a good location and the only thing my wife and I didn't like was the mini-bar set up. If you dont' pay attention and read the "Warning Lable" atop the counter or your kids just walk in and decide to take a water or a candy from the mini-bar in the room you will have to pay $3.50 for a small bottle of water or a candy bar. It turns out that the mini-bar has a sensor that every time you pick up any item inside the mini-bar it will automatically be added to your credit card. It just seemes to us that the hotel is just trying and hoping that you dont pay attention so they can make more money. My wife and I, just find it hard to believe that a hotel of this high caliber can't or just wont give a little back to their customer's. Maybe they will one day realize that if you give someone a glass of water(bottled), they will return and probably will recommend other people. It's hard to believe but, somthing so minor can actually bring more $$$$$$ than relying on people not reading the mini-bar warning sign.

review.title: terrific view from balcony
review.reviewText: Friedly , helpful staff , spectacular lobby, large room with balcony-great view of san Fran Bay,helpful concierge,very clean rooms; easily a 4 star hotel

review.title: wonderful hotel experience
review.reviewText: everything about this hotel was excellent. I would recommend it to anyone traveling to San Francisco!

review.title: A Stunning Lobby
review.reviewText: A good central location with very good access to public transportation. The immediate surrounding area is pretty clean and safe. As I has been warned many of the little cafes and restaurants in the immediate vicinity of the hotel close early.

review.title: Not "funky", but a great hotel all the same!
review.reviewText: Space age architecture is a little "troublesome", but I loved the location and had a truly wonderful stay. Construction in the hotel driveway area on my arrival resulted in some temporary inconvenience, but this was more than made up for when they offered me (without my asking) free valet parking to compensate. Staff was extremely helpful throughout and lived up to the hotel's LGBT-friendly promise. Ocean view room, short taxi ride up Market to the Castro, very short walk to the water and easy access to the Bay Bridge to see first the A's play the Yankees and then Neil Young in at the Fox in Oakland.

review.title: "Perfect Location"
review.reviewText: First time to San Francisco and glad to say that I picked the "Perfect Location". Hyatt Regency is close to the Bart, Cable car, Street Car and other Municpal transportation. Everyone is friendly from the front desk to the ladies/guys that clean up our rooms. Future San Francisco trips...will stay with the Hyatt Regency.

review.title: Great Location
review.reviewText: We took the Bart from Oakland & got off at the Embarcadero stop & the Hotel was right there. We got a great deal on Expedia & were very pleased with the room & the hotel in general. One nice feature was that the elevator was locked after a certain time & you needed your room key to go past the lobby. We will certainly stay here again.

review.title: San Franciscos best hotel
review.reviewText: The hotel was situated in a great part of town. Just across the street from the Ferry Building with easy access to ferries and charter buses. We took the street cars to Fishermans Wharf which only took 10 minutes and their rates were cheap, also the drivers were courteous to tourists. The erestaurants on the different piers were awesome.

review.title: Hyatt in summer
review.reviewText: Super location to trolley and cable cars. Nice hotel.

review.title: Great hotel and service
review.reviewText: Great service could be seen right at check-in. We got a great room on the 15th floor. We were also allowed to check out late, at 1 pm at no cost. Great location, easy to get around as cable cars and busses stop right outside the hotel. It was also very easy to get to the hotel from the airport by metro. Overall, it was a great experience.

review.title: Hyatt Regency
review.reviewText: great hotel great location

review.title: 4th of July in the City
review.reviewText:
Having just experienced a stay at the Hyatt in Monterey, we had our expectations. Since this was the City afterall, we figured there would be differences. Parking in Monterey was easy and free. Not so here--parking can be expensive but we found a reasonably priced parking garage a couple of blocks away and hoofed it with our luggage. The Hyatt's location was perfect--it was across the street from the Ferry Building, close to restaurants, shopping and the shuttle to Pier 39 was right in front of the Ferry Building. You won't need your car! The Cable Car to Chinatown is within walking distance of the Hyatt so you can fit lunch or dinner in Chinatown into your itinerary very easily. The same Cable car can bring you to the famed Fairmont and Mark Hopkins hotels.

Our room was beautifully done, very high end. We enjoyed drinks at the bar located just off the lobby. The shuttle to the Pier was a great convenience. And, the shops at the Ferry Building were unique--think mushrooms, cheeses, and pig parts! Our future visits to the City by the Bay will always include a stay at the Hyatt Embarcadero. The City is beautiful, but our stay at the Hyatt made it perfect.

review.title: Very convenient location
review.reviewText:
Hotel has elevators only at one end of the building to serve 400 rooms plus. Very inconvenient . Guests need to walk long way.
Breakfast and dinner overpriced.
No free Internet connection.

review.title: a little too old for us
review.reviewText: while I know that the Hyatt Regency in other areas of this country are unbelieveable....this hyatt leaves me to wonder as to book at others....It is old and shows signs of aging....the bathroon is very poor and old....i had to use a can of disenfectant before going in it. It took 3 - 5 minutes every time we wanted to use the elevator to go downstairs. we were on the 10th floor. very frustrating!

review.title: Hyatt Embarcadero
review.reviewText:
Definitely one of SF's best locations to enjoy your trip West. Enjoyed the location and professional services afforded by staying at this Hyatt location.
Would DEFINITELY recommend this location to others

review.title: Super Great Location
review.reviewText: We loved the location of this hotel. Street car right out front, easy to get anywhere you wanted. Location was quieter than the Wharf which was really chaotic and busy. We would stay at the Hyatt in the Financial District again.

review.title: Disappointed
review.reviewText: It had been a number of years since staying at this hotel. It seemed totally different........like financial distress. Lobby mostly empty, no entertainment of any kind, only one bar. The room while clean with an acceptable bed had flimsy cheap towels, limited ammenities (Q-tips, mouthwash,etc.) no postcards/ stationery or pens......only a note pad.

review.title: Hyatt Regency SFO very nice place to stay in San Francisco.
review.reviewText: Reasonable price, perfect location, Adjacent to the Market street and in front of the Pier, easy access to public transportation, rooms with attractive view, good breakfast, nice and knowledgeable concierge, acceptable room amenities, Internet connection was not really good but it was acceptable.

review.title: "Perfect Location-Perfect Hotel
review.reviewText: Loved this Hotel very much - comfortable, clean and very friendly. It's perfect location made getting around very easy - the bart station(SF Underground) was right outside - the trams and trolley stations were across the road. The hotel's location made it easy to walk to all the touristy attractionsas well. We would definately go again!

review.title: good location in a very interesting city
review.reviewText:
Great hotel overall. Had a nice view of the bay, with a balcony, although only booked a standard room. Stayed at the hotel for a conference. The location was good, easy access to transit and a short walk to the tourist areas of Pier 39 and fishermans wharf.
Room was clean, good size. Hotel is a little dated, but still well kept. Beds were comfortable. Staff friendly, especially the door man, very talkative and helpful.
My biggest complaint would be the lack of eateries around the area. There are lots of places for lunch, but almost everything closed at 5pm, The ferry building is right across the strett, but again, most things closed early, and although the burger joint there was great, you can only eat so many burgers.

review.title: Nice hotel!
review.reviewText: Overall good hotel. The room was excellent. The location other than being accross the Ferry Bldg and next to the Embarcadero Center was not very convenient because almost all businesses close down around earlier. Would have to take the bus to the Union Square area to get a late dinner or cup of coffee. Now that I know the area better though, I would definitely return.

review.title: Good location, decent hotel, not great but quite good, especially for that price.
review.reviewText:
Nice place, great location, car rental on site with after hours drop off. asked for an upgrade and got a room with a harbor view. stay again? why not...

don't bother with breakfast in the hotel. there are plenty of better options downstairs.

reserved a rental car, but they run out of standards. they offered a Mustang or a bright yellow Camaro for $20 more. Make a wild guess what we took for our trip down north on rt. 1 ;o)

review.title: My best stay in SF...excellent hotel, location, and value
review.reviewText: Great location in reference to BART and next to Ferry Building, excellent restaurants, fun shopping, coffee shops, drug stores, and, of course, close to San Francisco sights. The rooms on one side of the hotel was noisy to me; when I requested a quieter room they accommodated my request and even upgraded my room for free. Rooms were nice and we got a great rate through Expedia.

review.title: Great experience.
review.reviewText: The rates were much more affordable going through expedia and combined with my airfare. Overall a very good hotel.

review.title: I would definitely stay here again!
review.reviewText:
The location was perfect. I could walk to pretty much everywhere, except for the Golden Gate Bridge.
Highly Recommended!

review.title: Always love this place
review.reviewText: The location of this hotel is terrific and very near the Ferry building. We walked about a mile to the Ball Park, and the walk was scenic and fun. The hotel is pretty on the inside and the bar area is relaxing before and after dinner. Fun spot.

review.title: so clean, comfortable and friendly!
review.reviewText: Great hotel. Service was wonderful. People extremely friendly and helpful. Room was so clean. Bed comfortable. Wanted to take the pillows home with me. Beautiful lobby. Easy to find. Easy to get to all the places we wanted to go. Starbucks across the road. Trolley car right outside the door. 10 minute walk to union square.

review.title: Felt at home and would go back in a heart beat
review.reviewText: Right from check-in the staff was very professional and courteous. The hotel was very clean and elegant and cant wait to stay there again. Very convienient location.

review.title: Would stay at this hotel again
review.reviewText: Great hotel that's central & perfect for getting around. Trolley's, buses, cable car right smack outside front door. Five minutes to Pier 1 or Market Place and Ferry Building. If there on a Saturday, be sure & take in the all day Farmer's Market. Don't miss it! Besides it's right outside your door. Great bagel/panini place is out front door, hang a left, has great coffee too.
