Keep going around corner to left of Hyatt & you'll come across The Boudin Soup place, also the Osha Thai Restaurant & Bar. Another great place to eat is Cheesecake Factory in Union Square. Be sure to take the City Tour as great way to see all of San Francisco. Enjoy the 1/2 ferry ride over to Sausalito. It's a must see too.

review.title: great location
review.reviewText: I had a few maitenance problems but the hotel took care of them as soon as they were informed.

review.title: Very Nice Hotel
review.reviewText: Was here for a convention. Hotel is very clean and well maintained. Staff was friendly, efficient, and helpful. All my needs were met. And the Financial District is close to Fisherman's Wharf so that was a nice diversion after hours. Will definitely come back again if business brings me back to San Francisco.

review.title: Would definitely stay at the Hyatt again
review.reviewText: The Hyatt Regency hotel was fabulous and so was the staff. The location was awesome. I advise everyone to purchase the San Francisco Go Card in advance. You save a lot of money and get to do many things. I suggest reservations in advance at Alcatraz - call them to set it up and purchase the Go Card through them. I did not like the Blue and White Fleet (I believe that's was the one) bay cruise because it was audio and I prefer someone's personality giving the tour as opposed to just listening to history, however. Alcatraz's audio tour was great. San Francisco is a great city. My 14 and 18 year olds had a great time also. There is so much to do and see. You have to visit Ike's Place (over 200 sandwiches). We each got one and sampled each others - they were to die for, but this is not a sit down restaurant so we found a park not that far and sat and ate. The neighborhoods were so quaint. I am from very flat land and to walk up many hills . . . Well I got my workout. I would love to go back tomorrow!!

review.title: Great hotel in San Francisco
review.reviewText: We loved this hotel and San Francisco is a great place to visit!

review.title: This hotel made my trip great location
review.reviewText: The hotel was great. I was worried if it would be nice enough and was surprise how clean and updated it was. Great great location too!

review.title: Great Hotel San Francisco
review.reviewText: We were offered an upgrade to our room at check in that ended up putting us in a larger room with a view of the bay area from our room window. The hotel staff were extremely accomodating and made sure we got anything we needed to make our stay pleasant.

review.title: Good Experience,
review.reviewText:
The atrium and bar area were very cool and we hung there quite a bit at night since most options are closed there early.

The doormen were great and very helpful with directions and any questions.

While the hotel is right near the water and Ferry Plaza and Market, it's also in the business district and most shops and restaurants are shut down fairly early. Fortunately it is near lots of transportation options, including cable, trolley and bus lines. If you are looking for lots of nightlife I would head to another area.

review.title: San Francisco's best Hotel Experience
review.reviewText:
Hyatt Regency Embarkadero is a beautiful, clean, friendly, and conveniently located Hotel in San Francisco. My husband and I love it and this time we took our 12 year old Granddaughter for her first trip to SF. We met friends there and we turned them on to the Regency Club. Love it!!!! Thanks to all the great staff in that hotel!

There are many great restaurants within walking distance, the Ferry building and Farmers market is across the street, and you can walk to Pier 39 and Fisherman's Warf and cable car back to the hotel's front door.

Fabulous city and water views from every room.

review.title: Nice and clean but not good enough for how much you pay.
review.reviewText: Our room had candy wrapper trash in the trashcan when we arrived and we were charged for those items that were taken from the minibar. We also had to pay $9.95 per night for wireless internet service. Ridiculous! Especially considering how much we paid per night! The room was otherwise clean and comfy. The decor was nice and the hotel staff was very pleasant. Great location, too. Had great restaurants within walking distance and many shops as well. Delis, liquor store, and fast food nearby too. Just upset about how much the cost was and the lack of amenities. No pool or vending machines and the ice machine was very far from our room.

review.title: Love this place
review.reviewText: Very nice rooms good location great bar

review.title: Comfortable 4-star hotel with great amenities
review.reviewText: This is a nice 4-star hotel with large rooms and great amenities, including a large fitness center. It's conveniently located in the Financial District and next to a BART station. It's comfortable and homey, not over the top. Enjoyable place to stay while on long business trips. I would recommend getting a higher floor or room facing the Bay as there could otherwise be some intermittent street noise. Parking is expensive.

review.title: A Classic San Francisco Spot
review.reviewText: I used to live and work in San Francisco, so at least one vacation a year is a return. I have always marveled at this hotel for it's architectural play on Wright's 'Falling Water'. The hotel is in a convenient location to the Embarcadero and the amazing Saturday Farmer's Market that happens right on the wharf; a far cry from what you experience at Pier 39. Easy walking distance to Washington Square, China Town, etc. I would stay here again.

review.title: A+
review.reviewText: surpassed every expectation.

review.title: NICE!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!
review.reviewText: There was lots of hair and dust in the couch. But overall, the bed was cozy and the location was very convenient.

review.title: San Francisco's "Grandest" hotel!
review.reviewText: If you want to stay somewhere that is "top notch", and truly a home away from home, this is the place! I loved having the balcony to sit out on in the morning! The lobby is absolutely georgeous! I would love to go back!

review.title: Nice place but not as nice as expected.
review.reviewText:
Obviously a Hyatt Regency is trying to be a really nice hotel so I understand that they don't want to do the free buffet breakfast thing. Its kind of an image thing. That's OK with me. After all, if you have the money to stay at the Hyatt what's a few more dollars for breakfast. But not providing free internet service in this day and age is totally unacceptable. In my opinion the per day charge for internet service is like a slap in the face to people who need to carry on their lives while they're away from home. Couldn't they just include this as part of the regular provided services and it wouldn't change anyone's bill by more than a dollar or two or should I be thinking of this in the same way as the breakfast? In any case, this charge, even though I knew about it, was a downer.
Otherwise the place is pretty nice. However, I was surprised at how drafty the sliding door on the balcony was and at how noisy and squeaky the heater motor was. I think these are examples of the place starting to show its age and not being maintained to original standards. Of course its tough as a building like this ages but it was a little disappointing given the rates.

review.title: STILL A GRAND HOTEL!
review.reviewText:
I SPENT A CONSIDERABLE AMOUNT OF TIME IN SAN FRANCISCO IN THE LATE 60'S AND THIS WAS ONE OF THE GRANDEST HOTELS AT THE TIME.

I WAS NOT DISAPPOINTED IT IS STILL A GRAND HOTEL. IT LIVED UP TO MY EXPECTATIONS. ON ANY SUBSEQUENT TRIPS I MIGHT TAKE TO SAN FRANCISCO, I WOULD CERTAINLY CHOSE THE HYATT REGENCY AGAIN.

review.title: " Can't wait to go back"
review.reviewText: Would recommend the hotel to anyone. Awesome staff, very helpful. Walking distance from restaurants, shops and various activities.

review.title: Great place
review.reviewText: Easy access, clean, great views, helpful staff

review.title: Will go back again on EVERY visit to San Francisco!
review.reviewText: This Hotel is in a great and safe neighborhood and after walking outside of the Hotel lobby, you can access subway, train or trolley to get ANYWHERE you need to go on foot! It is a short walk from Pier 33 which is where you board the boat that takes you over to Alcatraz!

review.title: Great location - bad bathroom
review.reviewText:
Good - Location, convenience is great - right across from Ferry Building and close to all public transportation. We had a great view of the bay and there was in room coffee. Very comfy bed.

Bad - The bathrooms reminded me of a Motel Six. The faucets are horribly designed and is hard to turn on with soapy water without the assistance of another! It makes it very inconvenient. I would also advice people with weak wrists or single people not to stay here for this reason alone.

review.title: "Will go back"
review.reviewText: Great place!

review.title: Great hotel
review.reviewText:
We booked the Hyatt as a package and got a steal for two nights at this great hotel. We did not book a "bay view" room and were asked if we wanted to upgrade at check-in. We didn't take the upgrade but then they upgraded us anyway! Room was nicely furnished, clean and the king bed really comfortable. Bathrobes were sent up when requested.

The lobby is a sight to behold, the light installation over the bar is magnificent.

Overall, great experience.

review.title: SF Embarcadero Location
review.reviewText: Usual Hyatt quality. Great location for "downtown" activities including the Ferry and all its restaurants and shops. Very easy access to public transportation including BART and Muni.

review.title: "Impressive"
review.reviewText: I will definetely go back to this hotel when i visit San Francisco again!

review.title: Choose another Downtown Hotel than this one for the price.
review.reviewText:
Room decor and furnishings were out of date. Bathroom area (Funishings) very out dated. Valet parking $50.00 US per 24 hours. I was on the 8th floor and heard people and traffic from the street until 3 - 4am.

When I checked in and out of the Hotel I had to wait for someone to show up at the front desk.

review.title: I would recommend this hotel with these reminders
review.reviewText: THE PLUSES: Beautiful, well-maintained hotel. Amazing location. I loved staying on the Embarcadero & got myself from SFO almost to front entrance of the hotel by public transit, BART. The staff was courteous on the whole - a few especially memorable. (I find being nice to folks, remembering how hard it is dealing with demanding customers all day, usually gets this result.)THE MINUSES: I could hear the guy next door snoring & on the phone. Admittedly he was loud, but walls are thinner than I'd like. There are also 8am wake-up bells from Ferry Building (not the worst alarm clock). And if you're lucky enough to have a terrace (w/gorgeous bay view) & folks party 2:30am on terrace above, just know you can hear it. I'm extra-sensitive to noise, but found ear plugs worked nicely (ask at desk or go across street to Walgreen's). Otherwise, the room was quiet & I was able to enjoy my time while in the room. EXTRA MINUS: An East Coast snow storm canceled my flight(s). I called on room phone for help & was told hotel was full so he had to charge me full rate. (Very high for me.) He kept telling me he didn't negotiate, but came back a few times anyway, final offer still high for me not knowing how many days Id be stuck. I feel hotel could have been more accommodating (and he could have shown more empathy), since I didn't choose to be stuck & hadn't planned to spend that much more! Its the one memory that left a bad taste and might keep me from coming back.

review.title: Good Location
review.reviewText:
The Hyatt hotel was a lovely place to stay and in a very good location for transport links and tourist attractions. The maids were excellent and kept the room to a good standard. The only down fall is that there was quite a lot of noise from outside despite us being on the 12th floor.
San Fran is a fab place to visit, if you plan to walk to the tourist attractions make sure you take comfy shoes!! We did quite a lot of walking (especially up the BIG hills) as the weather was nice so we didn't want to be stuck on a bus etc, saying that the transport that we did use such as the tram, buses, cable cars and bart were all very efficient and clean.
The one bad thing about San Fran, but I suppose it's similar in most cities is the amount of tramps and people begging.

review.title: A Wonderful Hotel in a Great Location
review.reviewText: We arrived at the hotel earlier than expected, but our room was ready so we were able to check in. The room was wonderful and the view of the Bay was marvelous. Coffee on the balcony in the a.m. was such a treat! I also love the location of this hotel, close to the Ferry Building which has wonderful food and shops (a good place to get breakfast), and close to transportation to get anywhere in the City. We'll definitely stay here every time we come back to San Francisco.

review.title: Excellent Location...
review.reviewText:
This hotel is close to several must-see sights in San Francisco including Fisherman's Warf, the Coit Tower, ferry ports to Alcaraz, the farmer's market and so forth. The streetcar is right outside of the hotel to get you around the rest of the city. The hotel is safe and the staff are generally very friendly. I did not find the Hotel Concierge very helpful with respect to his knowledge about the local attractions and in arranging for tickets to certain shows (I was able to find much better deals and seats on the internet).

The rooms are a bit small but very clean and have everything that you need. If you pay an extra fee you will be upgraded to a room on a higher floor (recently renovated) and will have access to the Regency Club Room where they have breakfast, a great view and complimentary snacks and drinks throughout the day.

review.title: Very Nice, but I'm a free continental breakfast kinda gal.
review.reviewText: Their consiere (misspelled) was awsome. We asked the best way to get to the de Young museum for the King tut exhibit. He gave us a map, told us which bus, then routed us to Chinatown. On the downside, I think at those prices, they should have free internet.

review.title: Good Hotel in Good Location
review.reviewText:
Found the Hotel huge and the staff were friendly and helful. Good location within easy reach of transport, shops and eateries. Only one downfall was that the walls between the rooms seemed very thin. The first two nights all we could hear was a baby crying all night. On our last night our neighbours were a group of American Teenagers who were having a party which ended at 2.30am. Not something you want to hear when you have a long flight home to deal with the next day.
Don`t move anything in the mini bar as it`s all censored. You`ll end up paying for it whether you had it or not!
However, all in all we had a great time and the Hotel met our needs. Would stay again.

review.title: awesome
review.reviewText: The hotel was AWE inspiring! I was totally shocked at the sophistication of the design of the lobby and elevators. I wasnt the only one. As I travelled through the hotel some new guests entered the elevator unaware of the surroundings. Once the elevators went up a shrill of excitment rose through the atmosphere as they witnessed the same AWE as myself. I quitly nodded to myself as if saying, ' me too ladies...MEEE TOOO!' :)

review.title: Great Location
review.reviewText: Our stay was great and room service was excellent. The best fries in SF. Be careful with the mini bar. It has a senser which automatically charges your room if you lift anything up.

review.title: Excellent Hotel, Beautiful City, Great Food and Entertainment!
review.reviewText:
We checked in on the Saturday of a long weekend and were told upon checkin that they would move us as soon as a room with a better veiw opened up (because we were staying the full week) without us asking for it! Our first room had a pretty good view from the 2nd floor...you could see the bay and the Bay Bridge. On Sunday we moved to the 11th floor and to the other side of the hotel and the veiw was spectaculor. All your transportation options are at your doorstep....cable cars, F-train, BART, cabs and Budget Rentals. Hotel was VERY clean, staff was VERY friendly and knowledgable. You can walk to Fisherman's Warf, Pier 39, shopping - Macy's, Bloomingdales, Barneys etc.
The Ferry Station is across the street and has some wonderful local stores in a flea market fashion. Wonderful street performers! "Wicked" was a great show in a beautiful facility!

review.title: Great Location in San Fran
review.reviewText: So glad I went with the "Expedia Pick" - it was my first rip to San Fransisco and I had no idea where to stay on my own. The hotel was right across the street from the Embarcadero BART/Muni station, where we used convenient public transportation to go everywhere - the ocean, GoldenGate Park, "Wicked", the airport, etc. Across the street at the Ferry Building was our Wine Country Tour pickup and streetcar stops to Fisherman's Warf.

review.title: Hyatt Regency, a good choice in San Francisco
review.reviewText: It's a beautiful hotel with helpful staff. The balcony rooms have a great view of the bay and are worth it. I have no negative comments and would gladly return to stay with them.

review.title: We are already planning to go back next year!
review.reviewText:
The hotel was beautiful, minutes from the Ferry Building at Embarcadero. The BART station was literally around the corner. There were shops within 5 minute walk. Great restaurants. At the corner of Market Street. Everything was at your fingertips.
We will be going back again next year. We can't wait!

review.title: Great hotel but rooms facing Broadway are noisy
review.reviewText: Lovely lobby, nice room, extremely helpful concierge, but rooms facing the street with the trolley line (Broadway) are noisy enough to compromise sleep. Would only stay here again if I could be guaranteed a room on the other side of the hotel.

review.title: Great location and good value.
review.reviewText: This hotel was really good for the price. The location suited me - close to the bay, right next to the cable car stop and near some good places to eat and shop.

review.title: stay here
review.reviewText:
Impressed with the service and cleanliness of the hotel. The bathroom was old, small and in need of some major updates. I was disappointed that the bathtub was small and not inviting to relax in.

All in all a good experience and I would stay here again

review.title: Good hotel, great location
review.reviewText: We got a good Expedia deal providing access to the Regency Club. This was well worth the little extra cost. Fantastic harbour view, free WiFi, substantial high quality breakfast and evening snacks. We were almost too full for dinner! Embacadero BART and MUNI right outside the door, Ferry Building across the street and easy walking up Market Street to shops and Union Square.

review.title: Much better than that other hotel that starts with an H...
review.reviewText:
We stayed one night in a suite in the H___n, and two at the Hyatt, which was much nicer. Definitely worth the extra cost to get a room with a balcony, because those rooms are bigger. They do not allow smoking, but they said we could smoke on the patio, which was very nice.
We were delighted with the room, the service, and the hotel was absolutely beautiful with all the Christmas decorations filling the atrium. It was breathtaking. There's a liquor store across the street, and the Farmers' Market and craftsman vendor booths on Saturday were also fun to see, with some beautiful ceramics, jewelry, stone works, etc...
We definitely loved this hotel and would not hesitate in the slightest to return for another stay..."we'll be back".

review.title: Great location
review.reviewText: We have stayed at the Hyatt Regency San Francisco in the past and always had a pleasant stay. The hotel was decorated very festive for the holiday season which made it warm and inviting to stay at. We did pay a premium for parking our rental car at the hotel, but we feel it was worth it for convenience. The guys handling the car were absolutely wonderful and efficient. Check-in was smooth and the room was very comfortable. I would stay here again on my next trip to San Francsico. It is close to the Ferry building and if you don't mind a long walk you can stroll down to the wharf/pier.

review.title: Wonderful Stay!
review.reviewText: Stayed in this hotel for 6 nights including the New Years eve. The staff were very nice and helpful. The room is so neat and clean and the bed and beddings were just so comfortable, and the bay view is great! Great access to everything... a trolley to Market street stops right at the hotel, the subway and bus stops is just a few steps away! The fireworks in Embarcadero on New Year's eve is just right across the street and great view from the hotel too. The hotel was thoughtful enough also to host a guest exclusive dinner/breakfast (book early!)and live entertainment to celebrate the New Year. We enjoyed our stay, would recommend this hotel to anyone going to SF.. 'will stay here again for sure!

review.title: Will definantly go back
review.reviewText: Convienantly located. Muni and cable car outside entrance of hotel. Rooms very nice. Staff helpful. Enjoyed ou stay there.

review.title: good location
review.reviewText:
Well presented hotel and central location .Hotel staff friendly and accomodating for all enquiries
Rooms clean and maintained daily

review.title: I would love to go back again....
review.reviewText: I like this experience through Expedia. The flight was good... The Hyatt Regency Hotel was a very good choice. Its location is in a very centeric area which is close to the public transportation, to the Union Square and to Cable cars. You can take the train right from the airport to the hotel directly and spend less money on tranportation. The service in the hotel was very good and satisfactory and the decoration for christmas was an amzing one.

review.title: Excellent location
review.reviewText: The hotel and room was superb. the location great for walking to shops along market street. trolley cars and pier etc. 15 min walk to Alcatraz ferry. Service by staff friendly and food good. Room clean and adequate for the the four of us. Room service efficient, Concierge informative and able to clearly explain our questions. Food and Beverage staff (Wagener and Ronni) couldn't help us enough when one of our children was unwell to povide snacks and late check out. Car park is expensive recommend parking elsewhere (just around the corner for $US32 rather than $US57 with hotel. Highly recommend

review.title: Mediocre Value
review.reviewText:
The hotel boasts that it's the only 4 star hotel on the water in San Francisco, however we have stayed in 3 star hotels with much better service and maintenance.

We paid another $25 per night to upgrade to a balcony. But a few floors up the guests were smoking and ended up throwing their cigarette butts all over our balcony - our chairs and balcony were littered with cigarette butts. The front desk staff were indifferent and said they weren't responsible for the behavior of their guests. Also, the bathroom smelled like cigarette smoke and the shower head broke. Not a great experience.

review.title: Fantastic hotel
review.reviewText: Very pleased with everything not been to San Fransisco before and would certainly return and stay at The Hyatt Regency

review.title: best deal in town
review.reviewText:
I would definitely stay again at Hyatt. Room is large and clean. The staff are very friendly and helpful. The location is excellent. At Posh-Bagel next door, you can enjoy a fresh warm bagel with free wifi excess. Many good food just across street at the market (inside and outside the old ferry building). Pete Coffee plus a small book shop completed all the necessities. You can get fresh crab for dinner at the ferry building.

Only complain I have was the neighbor put their left over room service tray in front of my door. It just prove that you can not choose your neighbor, even at Hyatt.

review.title: An All American Hotel
review.reviewText:
A very impressive hotel, you check and look up to the largest ever atrium.
The rooms are fantastic, try and get one with a bay view. The only downside of the Hotel is it bar and restuarant, it is a combibed affair in the lobby little or no atmosphere an a very limited menu. Its like eating/drinking in a railway station lobby. The staff of the hotel are 5 star very friendly and very cistomer focuseed, that is except for the bar staff. A litte rough around the edges - as is the bar area, and not very friendly. The bar does not reflect the high quality of the hotel.
The location is good for seeing the city with very good public transport links.
The surrounding area is the Financial District so much of it closes down after 6pm ( hence why the hotel should have a better restuarant option) their website shows a rooftop restaurant but it is restricted to top rated rooms or an extra $75 a night. Plenty of great places to eat downtown or on Fishermans wharf. We found a great breafast restuarant on the Phoenix Hotel just of Stewuart 5 mins walk from the hotel - great brunch, lookslike good place for an evening meal though we only found it on our last day!

review.title: Hassel-free stay
review.reviewText:
I stayed 3 days in November and it was a hassle-free experience. There were no long line ups for check-in\out, slow elevators, poor housekeeping or rude staff.

The hotel is really conveniently located (near MUNI, BART, cable cars & Trolleys stops), modern, clean and well staffed. The staff was courteous and happy to serve you. There are plenty of elevators so it is almost like no waiting.

The room was spacious and well equipped with all the essentials. I especially liked the paper disposable cups available for hot drinks. The only thing that needs replacing is the pillows which seem to be overused as there is no firmness to them. There is a $10 daily charge for internet and the mini bar is sensored.

Since the Hyatt Regency is located in the financial district, the streets are practically deserted at night.

review.title: Very Impressed
review.reviewText: I do alot of travel for both business and personal and found the Hyatt Regency to be of very high standard. The rooms were large and comfortable. The hotel staff were very pleasant and quick to help if asked, The dining area was also great. Overall a great experience for both my husband and myself and we would definitely return.

review.title: Very convenient and accessible to the sights of San Fran!
review.reviewText:
My husband and I had a 10 day stay in this hotel in early November 2009.We weren't sure what exactly the Financial District entailed, and were surprised at how close we were to the water. We walked every day up and down the piers and took in a lot more than we anticipated. The Bart/Muni and trolley stops right at the side door, Starbucks right across the street and tons more.
The bed in our room was the most comfortable we had ever slept in.
We would go back in a flash!

review.title: Great Hotel
review.reviewText: Hyatt Regency San Francisco was a great hotel. Perfect location, clean, good service etc. And, to top things off, the night we arrived was the night of their Tree lighting ceremony. The lights hanging from the top of the Atrium create a magical experience. I would definitely recommend this Hotel to others.

review.title: Excellent accommodation
review.reviewText: The Hyatt Regency is a superb, quality hotel - the staff were always very helpful and courteous. Will definitely stay there again.

review.title: Great location, snotty staff
review.reviewText: I had a satisfactory stay at the Hyatt in San Francisco. The location of the hotel was great and very convenient. The Port of San Francisco was within walking distance as well as many quality restaurants, shops, attractions such as cable cars and shopping. I felt safe walking the newly constructed streets. (Most of the area has been rebuit and remodeled). I liked the Hotel, it was very beautiful and elegant. I feel like the staff could have been a lot friendlier. Upon checking in I was not greeted by the front desk. The two young desk agents were chatting and laughing and I was made to feel like I was imposing for interupting their conversation. The attitude was also very snooty when I asked about the vallet parking and bag storage while we shopped upon checking out. Again the front desk clerk was very snooty and pompous when I was genuinely trying to inquire some simple information, as if I should have known what their vallet and storage policies were. The room was great except the tub plug did not work when I tried to take a bath. It leaked water so I had to cut my bath short. This was very annoying considering the amount we paid for the room and we were on a weekend vacation getaway. I basically paid for the convenient hotel location, and the pretty ambiance, nothing more- not service nor comfort. I give this hotel a B-

review.title: Wish they invite me back when they are ready.
review.reviewText: Incredible, spectacular internal atrium design. Installation of lighting for the holidays was underway while I was there, as was construction in the street below my room. At check in they offered to upgrade my room for an additional $40 but I did not realize the value of this. In retrospect I am disappointed at the notions that they had better rooms available and they choose to leave them open rather than providing for my comfort. I have had better service at less expensive hotels. I could have stayed a few blocks away, with a similar room in a "less fancy" hotel and saved $1o0 and gotten a free continental breakfast.

review.title: My favourite hotel
review.reviewText: 20 years ago I used to stay here on business. This year I returned with my wife on vacation and upgraded to the Regency Club. Not sure whether or not that was a wise move because my wife won't go back to SanFran unless we stay there again. All the hotel staff were extremely pleasant. The Regency Club has a relaxed and peaceful atmosphere with superb views. Location is ideal with a short walk to Chinatown and the ferry building plus easy access to cable cars, trams, Metro and ferries to travel further afield..

review.title: Would stay here again!
review.reviewText: This was an extended "girls" weekend and we couldn't have been more pleased. The pictures say it all. Very nice hotel and pleasant staff, great location, walking distance to the Wharf and cable car right outside the hotel. We arrived early just after 12 noon and we were surprised to learn that our room was ready! Definately would stay here again. The only issue we had (which was not a deal breaker) was that the roof top bar was not open to the general public, only if you had premium status with the hotel chain.

review.title: Great Location
review.reviewText: This was our first visit to San Fransico and we wanted to be fairly central to everything and we couldn't have chose a better hotel. It's right in the heart of the Financial District and within walking distance to many of the attractions. Our room had a a view of the Bay Bridge and the Ferry Building was directly accross the street and only a 20 minute walk along the Embarcadero to Fisherman's Wharf. We even walked to China town for dinner which might have been a 15 minute walk. The rooms were bight and airy, very happy with everything including the price. Would definitely stay there again without hesitation.

review.title: Nice hotel despite the noise
review.reviewText: The hotel was in a convenient location for my requirements. Service was great and rooms were clean. I attended a conference here and facilities were first class. Two other comments - firstly, the hotel was quite noisy but the noise was from outside on the street and it carried significantly (I was on floor 9) - suggest sound proofing the windows! Secondly, as this was part work, part holiday, I actually had 2 separate reservations, one personal and one via work. This created some confusion with front desk staff and a major issue on checkout re payment. Suggest that the Hyatt's on-line reservation system be made clearer in regards to payment authorisation requirements.

review.title: SFO
review.reviewText: Breakfast is so so, over crowded place.

review.title: Would definitely stay there again. Loved the location
review.reviewText: Never having been to San Fran before, we really didn't know what the "Financial District" entailed. We were pleasantly surprised to find it so conveniently close to the waterfront Farmer's Market building, transportation (street cars and trolleys) and fabulous restaurants. We only had breakfast in the hotel once so cannot really comment on the restaurant. There are many small bagel/coffee shops in the area which is what we preferred. Lobby is beautiful and the concierge was very helpful.

review.title: Can't wait to go back!
review.reviewText: Our stay was GREAT! The location of our hotel was perfect for getting around to all areas of the city. The hotel staff, especially the restaurant staff, were wonderful and as a result, we ate breakfast there every morning. The food was also wonderful! The bed was exactly as they advertised, VERY COMFORTABLE.

review.title: Terrific stay in San Francisco!
review.reviewText: The Hyatt at the Embarcadero must be the best hotel in San Francisco. Although the price was a little steep, I got what I paid for. The location is magnificent, right across from the Ferry Building and a moderate walk to Fisherman's Wharf. Restaurants galore! The cable car starts in front of the hotel so you are always guaranteed a seat. And on the weekend there is an arts and crafts street fair for browsing and buying. My room was quiet and comfortable. There was a sliding glass door (no balcony) which opened up to a view of the bay. Look in the closet for the coffee pot. The only drawback was the absence of a sundries shop in the lobby. But the CVS is right across the street next to Starbucks.

review.title: Charges for everything
review.reviewText: A very nice hotel, very friendly staff. Hotel was clean and the rooms were spacious and nicely decorated. The only complaint was that there were charges for everything. The bar fridge in the room was packed with products to buy and very expensive. When asked if you could remove them until you left and then put them back before you left. They would charge you to do this or you could rent another fridge for $15.00 a day. Parking $50.00 a day, room service very ordinary for the high cost.

review.title: Great location
review.reviewText: Great service, great location. Very convenient to public transport.

review.title: Great hotel for the money!
review.reviewText: Can't imagine a better location. You can take the BART right to the hotel entrance than use the MUNI, cable cars and buses to get anywhere else you need from the hotel. Rooms all have great views and were clean. I will stay here again when I go back to San Francisco.

review.title: Great hotel, great location
review.reviewText: The Hyatt is in a perfect location. All transportation available in San Fran is right outside the hotel and can get you anywhere including Oakland, Sausalito, Union Square, Fisherman's Wharf etc. The food in the hotel was really good. There is a Starbucks across the street. The beds and pillows were really comfortable. We had a great vacation and would certainly recommend this hotel. We will certainly go back.

review.title: Top Notch Hotel, Great Location
review.reviewText: The hotel has an awesome location. The lobby was awesome. Good service. Knowledgeable concierge. Clean and classy rooms. Great view from Bayview room.

review.title: Great location but beware conference time!
review.reviewText: Staff were friendly and helpful but I had not been alerted to a conference which was taking place in the vast atrium, complete with microphones, speakers and hundreds of attendees. The noise was deafening and could be heard in the bedroom. Not enough lifts,either. Sometimes had to wait 5 mins to get to my floor.

review.title: Great location
review.reviewText: Perfect location for four day tourist visit.Hotel concierge limo service was $105 whereas regular limo service is $45. Regency Club well worth the extra cost, particularly for smokers with a balcony room. Grat access to all public tansit.

review.title: Fantastic Vacation Spot
review.reviewText: The hotel had a couple of noisy nights. Over all great place to stay central to all transportation and the staff very helpful and friendly.

review.title: Great Location, Great Hyatt service and room.
review.reviewText: Had a great room overlooking the bay bridge and trolly stop. Excellent location to metro. Would stay there again. Beds good, but not great. Overall very nice

review.title: Excellent hotel; excellent location!
review.reviewText: If this is your first trip to San Francsico, I recommend you stay at the Hyatt Regency - Embarcadaro! My first trip and the experience was fantastic! Excellent hotel...not only because of excellent staff and services provided but the comfort and location was just right for us. The hotel had easy access to: cable cars, trolleys, ferry building, a walk down the warf and the BART system. Thank-you Hyatt Regency!

review.title: Excellent choice
review.reviewText: Great location and wonderful service. Very clean room with an amazing view of the harbour. Would stay there again if in the San Fran area. Loved it.

review.title: Fun Place to stay in the city
review.reviewText: Lately when in the city, i have been having a good time in this part of town. Definately a safe haven from 5 blocks up market, but the embarcadeo is harmless and fun. The farmers market on saturday is so awesome, plan on waking early. Lots of crafts, lots of high end dining, and right on the waterfron overlooking

review.title: San Fran Hyatt
review.reviewText: Hotel was very nice and an exceptional Expidia rate; untill the upgrade which was still a deal but not worth the aditional $40. Very clean, safe.

review.title: Great but......
review.reviewText: Great location for the Bart and F line and was overall very happy for the price I paid through Expedia. However, at full price, I would have considered the beds too noisy when turning over and they skipmed on toiletries. Overall, great value for the price I paid. Clean, comfortable, quiet. Food very good but expensive.

review.title: Can't wait to go back
review.reviewText: Very very satisfied, looking forward to visiting again.

review.title: Nice but costly.
review.reviewText: Bar prices are a bit HIGH - also very strange hours, but good location and comfortable rooms. Check in staff were very helpful.

review.title: Will stay here again!
review.reviewText: We booked the stay as a package and didn't expect too much on the room, however, the quality of the hotel service was excellent! I was most impressed when called into the housekeeping asking for shampoo, they even address me with my last name which was very professional! I had a great stay for the entire weekend! Can't wait to go back there again!

review.title: Perfectly located
review.reviewText: Took the BART from the airport for $8.10 ( 30min) to the hotel and arrived at the front door. Cable car is also at the front door. Asked for the best room possible and got a bay view on the 12th floor. Room was perfect, the bed was grand and the service was awesome. Ferry building out the side door, perfect to get fresh fruit and foods for breakfast, get on a cable car and go sightseeing. Get a three day pass (MUNI), well worth it. I'll be back....

review.title: All Around wonderful Accomodations
review.reviewText: The Hyatt is first class! Our room was spacious with a view of the bay, the Bay Bridge and ferries to Sosilito. We had 3 televisions and 2 baths - how luxurious! All within walking distance of Fisherman's Wharf, shopping, fine dining etc.

review.title: Convenient Location
review.reviewText: The Hotel was conveniently located near all the public transportation systems for the city. There is a bart/muni train access and a skip and a hop away from the ferry building and F lines. Our room was always picked up even when we would leave our room late. The concierge was very helpful at all times.

review.title: Great Location
review.reviewText: The hotel was very nice. There is a convenient BART stop right out front and the Ferry Building is across the street. We would definitely consider this hotel on our next visit.

review.title: LOCATION ~LOCATION ~LOCATION!!! Could not ask for a better place to stay! Would DEFINETELY re-visit
review.reviewText: Loved the location! Public transportation easily accessible! Very beautiful hotel! Very friendly staff! If given the opportunity to ever stay here again at the "same rate" as this visit, We Will Be Back!!! Thanks Expedia ;)

review.title: GREAT LOCATION
review.reviewText: Great location and lovely ambiance in the hotel, handy to the Bart transport and Fishersmans wharf. We got a great rate with Expedia if we had to pay full price would be disappointed with the size of the rooms and paper cups for coffee with no fresh cream or milk only at an extra cost. Evertime you remove anything from your room fridge whether you consumed it or not you are charged. This corporate greed at its very worst. We could have easily stayed a week in this hotel instead of the one night before our cruise.

review.title: very good hotel in a wonderful City
review.reviewText: The lobby of the hotel is spectacular; our room had a balcony with a terrific view on the bay. Very good situation to visit the city; the employees of the hotel were helpful; we got very good suggestions from the concierge of the hotel

review.title: Not worth a second stay
review.reviewText: The air conditioner only had one supply vent into the room, so the area in front of the vanity for hair drying was not well ventilated. The air conditioner grille was noisy, but quieted down when I struck it with my hand. One bedside lamp came apart, but was promptly repaired. The sheets on the bed were very nice. The room smelled like bleach when we first checked in, but cleared out in a couple of hours. Parking!!!$57/day valet and $32/day public.

review.title: Looks grand but rooms only average!
review.reviewText: Overall just ok. Chose this hotel based on price. Got a decent deal but the rooms were small, the bathrooms were dated and the service was average.

review.title: Great Location, Great View
review.reviewText: My boyfriend and I stayed at the Hyatt Regency over Labour week. The location was super, right up from the Embarcadero (so close to the waterfront), walking distance to the Giants stadium and Fisherman's warf.The BART and trolley cars are right outside the door (very convenient). The rooms were average although the beds were extremely comfy and we asked for a room on the upper floor overlooking the Bay and they accommodated us. We loved lying in bed looking out over the water and parts of the City. I would recommend this hotel for the price.

review.title: Will stay there the next we go back to San Francisco
review.reviewText: We were very pleased with the room, view & location right by the Ferry Building; dining & shopping were so convenient. Everyone was very pleasant from valet parking through to each of the hotel staff we encountered. Only disappointment was that we were looking forward to dining at the revolving restuarant on the top of the Hyatt, only to find out it is no longer open to the public. Besides that, this was a great place to stay.

review.title: Great experienc
review.reviewText: Wonderful location, close to the Ferry Terminal that has lots of restaurants and a great coffee shop. Easy access to BART/airport route, major MUNI routes and walking distance to Union Square. Room was well appointed and staff courteous and housekeeping extremely quick and efficient despite the size of the hotel. Will make this my go-to hotel in San Francisco for future visits.

review.title: Tried to give us room we didn't book
review.reviewText: When we first arrived we'd booked a king room. They tried to tell us there were no kings available and gave us a twin room. We went to look at it and there was a tear in the carpet, stains on the rug and mold in the corner of the bathroom. We complained and got a king room in the end that was great. Not sure whether the moral of the story is don't book here or if you do make sure you fight for what you booked.

review.title: Fantastic
review.reviewText: Brilliant in every way.

review.title: The Best Hotel in San Francisco
review.reviewText: We stayed over the Labor Day Weekend. I had received an unbelievable rate form Expedia. I was expecting much less than we received. We stayed on the Regency Club level with a view of the Bat Bridge and Ferry Building. Spectacular view. The Service at the Hotel was 5 Star, the staff the most pleasant I have ever experienced. The Regency Club limited access loiunge was a circular top floor room with floor to ceiling glass. We visit San Francisco at least once a year and from this point on I will stay no where else!

review.title: very good hotel
review.reviewText: very good hotel

review.title: Great Location!
review.reviewText: The hotel is right next to a BART station ( Embarcadero) and a cable car stop. Check in was quick and efficient. The room and beds were very comfortable! The hotel is also across the street from the Ferry building and Sat. Farmer's market. Easy walking in this area as most of this terrain is flat. I would definitely stay here again!

review.title: Good hotel in Financial District
review.reviewText: The Hyatt across from the Ferry Building has a great location and provides easy access to business in the Financial District. The hotel met my expectations for a high end, business style, hotel. Thanks Expedia for the great price.

review.title: great place
review.reviewText: Not the closest to down town if that's what your looking for, but a great place to stay. Would diffinatly go back Oh ya $40 a day for parking ???

review.title: very helpful and friendly staff
review.reviewText: the two negatives of this hotel was we requested a non smoking room, was told it was a non smoking room but found cigarette butts on the balcony. the other was it is a long walk to the elavator no matter where your room is.

review.title: Sweet Spot in the City
review.reviewText: This hotel is geared towards business professionals and as a young adult traveling with a teenager i was initially insure of its appeal. I was wrong, beautiful, clean, safe and convenient. With access to both the bart and the muni right outside the front door. I also found the majority of sights were within walking distance, but be weary of the hills lol people arent joking, All and all a great stay although this hotel is not big on San Fran flare I enjoyed my personal bathroom, air-conditioned room with huge sliding doors. Trust me there is enough flare in the city, after spending the day walking around all you want to do is kick back by the water and know your hotel is right around the corner.

review.title: Great location
review.reviewText: Great location. Right across the street from the Ferry Building. Lots of great food is nearby.

review.title: Very nice choise, close to everything
review.reviewText: Great hotel for walking around the city, easy to get anywhere you want to go. Very helpful staff.

review.title: Perfect hotel and location
review.reviewText: The perfect location for a San Francisco vacation.

review.title: Just right
review.reviewText: My husband and I were delighted by the view we had of Market Street leading to the Ferry Building and the Bay Bridge beyond. We also loved how our windows opened wide and we could hear the haunting beautiful sounds of the saxaphone player every evening. A pitch perfect accomodation and I will return!

review.title: Hyatt Regency - SF
review.reviewText: It's a very nice hotel. I was very impressed by the elevators and the beautiful lobby. Our room was nice and clan and had a nice view of the Bay Bridge and Ferry Building. The location of the hotel was perfect - cable car and subway station entry right out side of the hotel, and it's right near the busy Ferry Building and shopping district. We had a great time there.

review.title: really enjoyed our stay
review.reviewText: When we arrived at Hyatt the first night, we got a room which we didn't like at all - very noisy and felt most uncomfortable staying in that room. The service we got that night were also very bad (e.g. no food, didn't receive items we asked for) However the stuff were very helpful and changed our room next day to a lovely cosy and quiet room with a great bay view. Then on, we really enjoyed our stay at the hotel. We were away from the hotel for a few days to travel to Yosemite and we got the same room upon return which we very much appreciated. The hotel is ideally located - it is not at the downtown union square but near the beautiful Bayfront. This means while almost everything is within walking distance (e.g. union square, fishermans wharf , telegraph hill are all easily approachable by a 15/20 minute-walk), you do not get the noise and crowd of the downtown. Plus the cable car, street car, and subway stops are just around the corner. The hotel also has budget car rental on the premise which was extremely useful - we rented our car from there and it was very easy to return the car and check into at the hotel again - saved us a lot of hassle of having to return the car elsewhere and go to another hotel with luggage. And finally, the stuff was very friendly and accommodating throughout our stay. Overall, we really enjoyed our stay there (except for the first night) and will surely go back there again.

review.title: good location
review.reviewText: Great location in city center, close to restaurants, shops and aiport access.

review.title: Well located
review.reviewText: Hotel was located at the right place to get to the Pier and the Market. I night it was very quiet because most of the parties were downtown and I liked that quiet time foe my husband and I . I would recommande this hotel for a family. Will go again.

review.title: Great Hotel and Location
review.reviewText: The last time I stayed in SF I chose to stay at a hotel in Union Square. Even though it was a 4 star hotel the room was tiny and definitely not worth the money. The Hyatt on the other hand was great! The room was nice and spacious with a very comfortable bed. When checking in we chose to upgrade to room with a balcony and a view! The location of the hotel is perfect for those traveling without a car. The Bart and buses are right in front of the hotel which made for easy access to other parts of the city. The hotel is also walking distance to China Town and Pier 39. I would definitely recommend staying here!

review.title: Liked the location
review.reviewText: It's close to the BART and trolley and across the street from the Ferry Building and Embarcadero Center. The hotel had a beautiful lobby. Our room had a view of the bay and a nice balcony. We were very happy with the staff and the cleanliness of the room. We would stay there again.

review.title: Excellent Location
review.reviewText: This hotel is in a great location - only a 20 minute walk from the Alcatrez pier and Union Square. The room was very large, clean and comfortable. However the fitness center was very small. Only one bench and too few weights.

review.title: Disappointment.
review.reviewText: I would not recommend staying at Hyatt Embarcadero. Although the location is great, the service was poor and the food was average. I requested a room on a higher floor with a view for my parents' anniversary. Not only was I assigned to the second floor (although I paid months in advance) - my room overlooked a noisy restaurant/bar - and it was a handicapped room, although I did not ask for one. 4 star hotel? I had to call housekeeping several times as well. It should be a 3-star hotel.

review.title: Loved it! Great Service
review.reviewText: Wentdown for a one day trip. Loved being by the Embarcadaro. Usually stay at Union Square butloved being by the water. Great service, no wait for check-in, upgraded room without asking, cool little bar/restaurant overlooking bay. I didn't want to leave. Rooms was spacial with great view. Definitely will go back.

review.title: Great location if you're in town for the weekend
review.reviewText: I'd give it all 5's if it weren't for the used bar of soap that was left in the shower soap dish upon check-in.

review.title: Hotel was great and the staff were helpful and friendly.
review.reviewText: Hotel is in a great location for getting around the city and has all the amenities you could want as well as great shops and restaurants near by.

review.title: Good Location
review.reviewText: Easy Access to the pier, walking to market street and China town.

review.title: San Francisco's best hotel
review.reviewText: Very professional staff at the service desk, helpful, organized. Clean rooms, best and fast housekeeping staff. If you don't want to pay for any drinks from the fridge or even a water bottles from the top of the dresser, Don't touch them, because they have sensors attached. Overall, one of the best hotels I have been for a reasonable price.

review.title: Very Impressed will go back
review.reviewText: Hotel was great everyone was really helpful, was hard to get into drive entrance and no room for more than 2 cars.

review.title: Great Location - Dated Digs
review.reviewText: The location is fabulous and we spent more time outside than inside. The vast atrium interiors made it a noisy, congested and ackward hotel to navigate, with and without luggage. Elevators were too scarce for the hotel at capacity, meaning 10 minutes or more wait to go down and no option for stairs. Corridors were too narrow for two people to pass due to the overwhelming atrium, which was noisy at night.

review.title: Well done
review.reviewText: we had a great stay for our anniversary...well located in San Fran, near the subway, parked at the Hilton for $30 instead of the Hyatt's $50. Food fantastic...quiet, convenient, clean and easy.

review.title: Noisy & Expensive
review.reviewText: The Hyatt has a perfect location, but many rooms are very noisy and it's extremely expensive. Try not to bring a car--valet parking is an unbelievable $57 per day and self parking is $32 per day at Embarcadero Center. The staff was friendly and accommodating. The rooms are a little small, but the biggest problem is the noise from both inside and outside the hotel. Street noise can be heard at all hours of the day. Our first room faced the bay and the noise from a bar/nightclub below was so loud we had to change rooms to a different side of the hotel. It sounded like our hotel room was the back room of a club. The noise from the large bar in the lobby inside the hotel can also be heard from the rooms.

review.title: good location
review.reviewText: it was nice to walk to all of my meetings downtown as well as spend free time along the waterfront. the business service office was very easy to use and the attendant was friendly and helpful.

review.title: Hyatt
review.reviewText: They were great! They really contributed to a magical honeymoon.

review.title: Fantastic Location!
review.reviewText: Enjoyable trip from SFO to the property on BART. Allowed in the room early, able to check out late. Upgraded to a bayview balcony room and well worth it. Really appreciated the Budget rental car office in the lobby. Very satisfactory stay. Would recommend and will stay again.

review.title: I will back to this hotel
review.reviewText: Improve the Elevators service

review.title: Perfect choice in San Francisco
review.reviewText: Excellent place to grab a quick LUNCH; Burger Bistro, right across the street BREAKFAST; Massimo right next door to hotel has fantastic omelets

review.title: Very Satisfied
review.reviewText: Honeymoon/1st Wedding Anniversary trip. Did not spend a lot of time in the Hotel. Comfortable, Friendly, Clean, Enjoyable accomodations.

review.title: SF Embarcadero
review.reviewText: Its a great location with incredible views, did have one issue though....there was a fist size hole in the ceiling above the shower, a little weird and felt like we were being watched in the shower, once noticed it, called front desk and they moved us to another room. It just felt creepy, but everything else in the hotel was great!

review.title: Location, Location, Location!
review.reviewText: The hotel is like most other very large convention hotels. However, what it lacks in personalized service and amenities, it makes up by being in a great location. There are tons of restaurants, shops, bars, etc. within walking distance or a short cab-ride away. I would definitely recommend this for families, or people on a budget, looking for a nice place to stay in a great city. I would not recommend this for honeymooners.

review.title: Our Expedia Booking
review.reviewText: Our room was very nice, comfortable, and had a great view of the park and the bay. We enjoyed walking in the parks near by and short walk to ride the trolly cars. Lots of places to shop and eat. Enjoyed our stay.

review.title: Very Nice
review.reviewText: The hotel was very clean and well maintained. The service was prompt and courteous.

review.title: The best thing about this property is the location
review.reviewText: There's nothing wrong with this hotel, but you don't come away with anything memorable other than the location across from the Ferry Building, which is something great

review.title: Nice stay - great location
review.reviewText: Hotel is ion a location nearby to numerous restaurants and activities and steps from Bart. Good maid service. No problems

review.title: hyatt
review.reviewText: The rooms were great at the hyatt regency. The only thing I didn't like was how the valet parking was way too expensive for one a one night stay

review.title: Great Hotel
review.reviewText: Hotel staff, rooms and food were excellent. Would have stayed longer if we could. Very resonable rates for that area and everyone was very helpful and friendly. Had a great time and can't wait to go again!!!

review.title: Nice stay
review.reviewText: We enjoyed our stay at the Hyatt very much. It was located at a Cable Car and BART station stop which was very nice. We rode the BART system from the airport to the hotel and that was very convenient.

review.title: Perfect Location
review.reviewText: The Hyatt Regency is right along the water at the Embarcadero and its location can't be beat. Upon check-in, it's customary for us to ask for the best room possible. Boy, did we get lucky. Our room was surprisingly very spacious with a gorgeous view of the bay. As far as amenities, bedding, comfort, etc... it ives up to its 4-star rating. The breakfast buffet is fresh & delicious with great service. The Ferry Building is across the street. Go there and try the coffee at "Blue Bottle", it's the best coffee ever. If you're a bread fanatic stop at Acme for the best bread in town. Also, don't miss out on the farmers market on Sat. You can walk to Chinatown (10 min), Union Square (15 min), as for public transportaion, muni, BART and the cable cars are right outside the hotel doors. Cabs are plentiful and easy to come by.

review.title: Best Value on the embarkadero
review.reviewText: The hotel quality is a couple steps down from when we first went there 10 years ago. The rotating restaurant on the top floor has been shut down, although the structure still exists. Generally this hotel is a good value and I would recommend it. It is right across the street from the Vallejo ferry.

review.title: Nice location-Nice hotel, accessible
review.reviewText: The hotel is right in front of the San Francisco Ferry. I had a beatiful view of the Embaradero harbor. The best thing was, it was so accesible to the BART, right outside the doors. The room was very clean and comfortable. The only issue I had was that I wasn't informed of extra charges on my room service. I ordered a $12 quesadilla (which was pretty good) and a water. The bill came up to 34 dollars no one mentioned not did the menur state that there was a deliver charge and a service fee, and taxes. So before you order make sure you are aware of any extra charges. For that price, I would have gone to one of the restaurants nearby and had a steak dinner.

review.title: clean, sharp, great view
review.reviewText: this hotel is not as packed as it was back in the eighties so the zoo aspect of the great lobby is gone - it's nice and quiet now. we were within walking distance to north beach and the ferry building was right across the embarcadero. if you're a shopper there's great shopping in the three buildings right next door (the embarcadero center). did not eat in the hotel restaurant as the prices were high. the recession has brought down the room pricing to reasonable levels.

review.title: Pleasantly surprised after reading a bad review!
review.reviewText: A very quiet hotel! Massive, beautiful lobby, fast glass elevators but only one restaurant in the hotel! Not to worry, outside the north door is the Embarcadero Center with a variety of eateries... but I DO recommend the hotel's breakfast buffett that starts at 6am. Not a huge selection, but food is good & hot! I recently stayed at the Encore, Wynn, Paris & Caesars palace 'Agustus Tower Suites'and this hotel is up there with them. The only thing I was surprised with is the tub/shower combo with the shower curtain. I like the seperate shower. I recommend paying a little more for the bay view units. I like up high & they put me on the 12th floor. I was treated like royalty from the start & was able to check out over the phone. My tour busses met right outside, along with B.A.R.T., trolleys, busses & taxis. Very convenient location. I will not consider staying anywhere else, should I return. Don't miss the Alcatraz tour (get tickets online).It was a wonderful trip.

review.title: Hyatt Hotel
review.reviewText: I have been to many hotels throughout the world, and this has to be up there with them. It doesn't have all ths fancy little trinkets that make some hotels amazing. But the minute you go into the hotel and see the size and scale it produces a whoa factor. The staff there are without a doubt the friendliest staff you will ever meet. Very professional, and I left having made good friends. The food is excellent, and the bar itself, well becuase of the social scene ended up being my favoirte bar in San Francisco. All in all would recommend this to anybody if you dont mind the price.

review.title: Great Hotel!
review.reviewText: I have been to this hotel before and love it.

review.title: Would go back in a heart beat
review.reviewText: This hotel was super clean, quiet, reasonably priced, and in a great location. I couldn't have been more pleased. You can ride the BART directly from the airport without having to change trains. Cable Cars and city buses are all stop right outside the hotel. The views are great. And unlike other hotels, their rooms match the pictures you find on their website. Have already recommended this hotel to other friends and family.

review.title: not impressed
review.reviewText: The rooms are small for a hotel of it's category. Bathrooms also.Parking too expensive.

review.title: Far below expectations; will not return, and will not recommend to others.
review.reviewText: From check in to check out the hotel staff were distant, distracted and barely helpful. When we entered our room the first time, it smelled of cigarette smoke. We almost notified the front desk so that we would not be charged. We found out that just moving the items in the honor bar refrigerator resulted in charges to our account. This is an annoying practice on the part of the hotel. At 8:30am the morning of the day we were to check out, a housekeeping person demanded to know "when you leave?", "when you leave?" We explained that we would be checking out at noon. We left for breakfast at the hotel, came back to find a housekeeper had come into the room, moved our luggage and personal items around and was proceeding to strip the beds. We had to ask her to leave. The bartender barely gave us any attention when we stopped by for drinks in the evening. During the breakfast, the waiter seemed annoyed that we were there and frustrated that one of us asked for cranberry juice rather than the orange juice he had in his hand. He also seemed annoyed that we asked for hot chocolate instead of coffee.

review.title: Great Value
review.reviewText: Booked the room online a day or two before our visit and got a great deal. Had lots of activities going on over the weekend so did not spend much time in the room but it had a fabulous view of the Bay Bridge at night. Bed was very comfortable and bathroom appointments were well above average. Doorman even let my son park his car out front for several hours at no extra charge while we had dinner nearby... he got a nice tip! Several great restaurants within walking distance; we chose the Waterfront for dinner and had a nice seat overlooking the bay and the Bridge. Overall, we were very satisfied with the stay, though the hotel is starting to show its age.

review.title: Excellent Hotel
review.reviewText: For a short stay in San Francisco this hotel is ideal, it is very comfortable, quiet and situated close to transport etc, can recommend it and would stay there again.

review.title: Location, location, location in San Francisco
review.reviewText: Requested a very quiet room and got a very nice one with a water view and no noise but my own. This standard room was very spacious compared to others I've had in San Francisco. Lots of room to walk around, nice closet, big bathroom and lots of counter space. Big desk to spread out, with great task lighting. Nice flat screen TV. Now for the not nice features: this was not an inexpensive room, yet internet access is an additional ten dlls per day; the mini bar has sensors - so if you pick something up to look at it you get charged even if you don't consume it; the hotel is very large, and the elevators give free access to whomever walks in, giving it an unsafe feeling late at night.

review.title: High Anxiety at the Embarcadero Center
review.reviewText: There's no mistaking that this Hyatt is an architectural masterpiece. The lobby was used as the location for ascene in 'Towering Inferno' and Mel Brooks used the place for shooting much of 'High Anxiety'. But what a shame that the room interiors are so shabby and neglected. The pace has more of the ambience of a 1970s motel than the international hotel it's meant to be. Coincidentally, I was also informed by at least two members of (very helpful and charming) staff that it's the second most popular place to commit suicide in San Francisco (after the Golden Gate Bridge). The downtown location is hard to beat and a big plus is that most of the rooms open out on to private terraces: many with views towards the Bay. For the price, I could think of many better places to stay in the city. For architectural kitsch factor, you may be better off visiting the place rather than staying at it.

review.title: Love this hotel!!
review.reviewText: This is our second time stayed in this hotel within a year. We came here for the 2009 New Year celebration this time, the Hyatt Grand Bed is really nice and the bathroom amenities they provide have a very good quality. Another reason we like this hotel so much is its location, it's so convenient to go anywhere from this hotel. So far this hotel is my favourite in San Francisco.

review.title: not impressesd
review.reviewText: hotel is in a great location - BUT it is in dire need of an upgrade big time

review.title: Just what I needed
review.reviewText: The only thing I didn't get was a room on a high floor, but everything else was great. The room was quite (with the exception of the occasional bagpipe or saxophone player outside) spacious and very clean.

review.title: Hyatt Regency, San Francisco
review.reviewText: Our one-night stay was excellent. The room was very nice and the service was efficient. Every employee in the hotel, from doorman to maid, greeted us with a smile.

review.title: Gorgeous view, great location
review.reviewText: High end, great location for business or pleasure. Amazing lobby and inside atrium...next to cable cars, high end shopping and excellent restaurants.

review.title: Great place to stay
review.reviewText: Very impressed with the room. Had a wonderful view from our room. Front desk people were nice and helpful. Clean room. Perfect place to stay. Definitely would suggest a stay here for business or personal.

review.title: Excellent location. Took 30 minute BART train from SF airport to hotel.
review.reviewText: If I am traveling to SF on business or pleasure I will stay at the Hyatt Regency. Excellent location in the Embarcadero for business meetings and a variety of restaurants.

review.title: Great Hotel
review.reviewText: The location was convenient. The room was comfortable and the stay was great!

review.title: Too Expensive Parking and Meals
review.reviewText: 19.00 plus 5.00 deliver charge plus taxes for a Hamburger is nuts. Parking your vechile for 57.00 i night is only for the rich. I think that EPEDIA should take out of their choses.

review.title: go on stay at the Hyatt regency
review.reviewText: When we arrived Check in was so easy and after a long flight it was a warm welcome greatly received. the room had a great view of the bay and was only hampered by the smoker up stairs who threw there cigarette butt and it landed on our balcony. the maids were good and really looked after the room. we ordered room service which was again very good and great value. so go on stay at the regency as it was perfect for the tram the ferry buildings and the shopping.

review.title: Perfect for us
review.reviewText: Excellent location - Ferry Building right across the plaza; "F"-trolley right there too (for getting down to Fisherman's Wharf easily); even walked to Giants game although it was a bit of a hike; "California" cable-car line right outside. Club room well worth it - great to be able to start the day without looking for breakfast. Also a nice way to end the day with a sweet treat and a nice view. A couple of nights when we were just done with all the walking (and sunshine!) it was even enough for a light dinner.

review.title: Definitely will stay at the Hyatt again.
review.reviewText: I was traveling with 2 teenagers and the Hyatt was a big success. The location is great, staff were friendly and helpful and we had access to the Club Room which we all really enjoyed. We'll definitely go back and stay there again.

review.title: Great hotel to stay in and closeness to downtown San Fran.
review.reviewText: When I saw the photos provided by expedia, I knew this is a great hotel. But actually see it in person, it was amazing! This hotel is not super new, but they maintain it very well. The Eclipse Cafe is being renovated and would be finished this fall. The interior design is classy adn elegant. The front desk counter service and the luggage department staff were friendly, professional and polite. Free lemonade as courtesy at the front lobby. Beautiful elevators. The golden globe artectect is their signature. Breakfast buffet or continental breakfast at the 13 views restaruant is a good one if you don't want to go out for breakfast. However, you can grab quick bite around the hotel with food court, small street food, etc. And if you want to walk across to the pier, you get local food such as oyster or sandwich. The oyster place and slanted door are great place to chill outdoors and with a great view of the pier and one of the bridges. Hotel is very convenient to metro, tram, street cars, bus, etc. YOu could walk around in the night and feel safe. Grab a taxi and head down to china town or local lounges and clubbing or strip clubs with ease and short distance payment.

review.title: great hotel
review.reviewText: We stayed at this hotel on Labor day weekend. Great service. California cable car stop right in front of the hotel. Farmer's market,Art market and Ferry's building right by the hotel. We stayed at 16 floor and got great view of the bay. Room was clean and recently remodeled. We were very happy with evething.

review.title: Hyatt never disappoints!
review.reviewText: Great hotel - walking distance from Union Square and right across the street from the Bay....

review.title: Great location
review.reviewText: Major remodeling being done. Very noisy.

review.title: A bit dated
review.reviewText: This hotel was in the business district and the local area felt safe. It wasn't too far a walk to san francisco's main attractions although because we were there at the weekend, lots of the food places were closed and we struggled to find somewhere to eat - our last day was monday, and it was really buzzing then! The hotel was seemingly well presented and we were impressed by the atrium, water feature and funky '13 views' bar, in which we enjoyed dinner and drinks a few times. However, the room itself was fairly dated, the carpet threadbare and generally quite basic. The bathroom was far from luxury. I would recommend this hotel, but for the money (and expedia rating) I was expecting something a bit more special and was disappointed.

review.title: Expensive Parking
review.reviewText: the Hotel charges $57 per DAY for parking plus tax

review.title: Excellent hotel in great location
review.reviewText: We had 2 rooms and although we checked in after 9PM one room was not ready. This was an issue which hotel tried to rectify.

review.title: Great Location
review.reviewText: We visited in August 2008. This Hotel is right on the waterfront, or as close as you can get. Across the street from the Embarcadero Market, F market street car which can take you directly to pier 39(Fisherman's Warf) or pier 33 to take the Ferry to Alcatraz, or you can walk about 20 -25 minutes. Ferry access also right there to Sausilito and other great places. Also right beside the Hotel, is the Cable Car that goes down California Ave, and the busses/street car that will take you directly to Union Square to shop til you drop or the Haight/Ashbury area, as well as the access to BART to get wherever including San Fransisco Airport(25 minutes -$5.35). The Hotel is in the Embarcadero Centre that has several shops/restaraunts. The shops typically close at 7pm which was a bit of a downer. The Hotel restaraunt was very expensive, but right out side is a great bagel type place called Noahs good food, fair price. Hotel staff friendly and knowledgeable. Things I did not like were noise related, we could hear consruction, street noise, and the "duck" whistle the bellman use to hail taxi's all night, and we were on the 10th floor. Stay on the waterfront side if you can. Enjoy the Farmers market, tues/thurs/Sat, crowded. All in all a fairly quiet area compared to Union Square.

review.title: Excellent Hotel - Much better than expected!
review.reviewText: My husband, our 14 month old son and I travelled to SF on a long weekend leisure trip. We were not sure what to expect of this hotel and its location, but as soon as we got there we realized it was the perfect choice for us. The hotel views are amazing, the service was great from the start. Many employees went out of their way to help us with bagagge and check-in, even when the hotel was very busy. Very clean, lots of elevators which were very fast. Right in front of the hotel there is a pharmacy, 24 hour convenience store, 2 fast food places. Right around the corner many more local places to eat. On the bay side, about a 3 minute walk, many more shops and local restaurants right by the water. The start of one of the cable lines is right outside of the hotel. Also, a subway stop right outside. It is a 10 to 15 minute walk to Union Square. 15 to 20 minute walk to North Beach. However both walks are enjoyable and not hard. Lots of people around at night. We felt safe. Even when the hotel was almost full, we never felt crowded. Our only small complaints were that the lobby was under construction and it wasn't mentioned to us beforehand. Although, I must say it did not interfere with anything and we did not hear any noises from it. The position of the TV in our room was a bit odd. The carpet in the room seems a bit old, but it was clean. It was a great experience, I would highly recommend it.

review.title: Nice hotel
review.reviewText: Very nice hotel; attentive staff;parking was pricey, and had a long wait at valet when checking out, but overall was a nice stay.

review.title: very bad
review.reviewText: i lost my cell phone and shirt in my room ~

review.title: unlikely to return
review.reviewText: water stain marks on the floor, loud pipe sounds at night, loud traffic noise, need I say more?

review.title: very spacious large room; very comfortable stay. would choose to go back.
review.reviewText: Excellent location for business meetings as well as leisure and shopping. The lobby is two floors above the street level which is a little disconcerting but once in the hotel the look and feel improves. The hotel has great retail and transportation options around it which makes it a value-based place to use as a hub when in San Francisco.

review.title: Would highly recommend this hotel for anyone staying in the area
review.reviewText: What a fantastic experience. The view was magnificent. We enjoyed continental breakfast daily in the Regency club lounge. The service was top notch. The room was clean and well appointed. The streetcar and BART stopped outside the front door of the hotel so it was easy to get around. The staff were always friendly and helpful.

review.title: very nice but...
review.reviewText: The service and accommodations were very nice, but on the final morning we had breakfast in the hotel restaurant and it was less than special. The buffet, of which my wife and I partook of two eggs and a strip of bacon, cost us $65! I commented to the receptionist at the front desk on how surprizingly expensive the breakfast was. She kindly assured me that I would not be charged, agreeing that the cost was exorbitant. She charged our credit card account the full amount anyway. Rip off!!

review.title: Great Place To Stay
review.reviewText: The hotel was awesome. It was literally steps away from the great sights that San Francisco had to offer. The concierge were also helpful with places to go for my wife and I to enjoy.

review.title: Great hotel, okay location
review.reviewText: Although the hotel was very accommodating, the staff was surprisingly not knowledgeable about the city of San Francisco. Whenever asked a simple question, they were always unsure. The hotel is not near any tourist spots so be prepared to walk or take cable cars. Also, all the nearby restaurants close down early, which we learned too late. Overall, I would stay there again because of the price, but would have wanted to know this information prior.

review.title: liked it
review.reviewText: everything was great

review.title: Lovely hotel
