review.reviewText: This was a lovely hotel, very clean and accomodating. I particularly appreciated the help I received at the concierge desk. Everytime I had a question, they answered to the best of their knowledge! I would definitely stay at this hotel again.

review.title: Very nice hotel
review.reviewText: We were more than satisfied with this hotel. Minute you walk in we knew this will be the best hotel we stayed.

review.title: would definitly go back!
review.reviewText: the hotel was very beautiful, and the service was great.

review.title: What a fun weekend!
review.reviewText: We originally wanted a room with 2 queen beds but when we checked in, the woman at the desk said the only 2 queen rooms she had were on the 2nd floor and if we wanted a room with one king instead, they could bring in a rollaway bed and get us as high as the 15th floor. It was so worth it. We had an AMAZING view of the bay (and bridge) overlooking Market street and the rollaway bed was just like a regular bed (and we could stand it up out of the way when not in use. We had a great time. Room service was a bit expensive ($60 for a hamburger and pizza) but when is it not? I'd recommend this hotel in a heartbeat.

review.title: Great Location
review.reviewText: World class hotel with great service as you would expect in a Hyatt. Great location, easy to walk to many restaurants, Ferry Building, farmer's market, etc. Easy access to trolley as well.

review.title: Wonderful Experience
review.reviewText: Just letting everyone know that the beds are extremely comfy!

review.title: Great stay, enjoyed the Regency Club
review.reviewText: Very nice hotel, perfect location in downtown SF. Upgraded to Regency Club. It was pricey but I think it was worth it. I wish they would have kept it open later ... closes at 10 p.m.

review.title: Despite Sold Out Hotel, Service Never Sold Us Out
review.reviewText: The hotel is just steps away from the Gay Pride Parade on Market. Which meant that it was sold out, with people milling everywhere. And yet, we never felt that the hotel was overwhelmed. We might have been the only guests. This was especially true of the valet and bell staff, who were dealing with cars and luggage and people and never lost their upbeat gracious attitudes. The only down side was the lobby restaurant. It was so overpriced that even our smiling waiter couldn't make up for it.

review.title: One night in SF
review.reviewText: The hotel is in a great location, convenient to public transportation. The hotel is very nice, and the staff was professional and courteous.

review.title: Very nice rooms and views
review.reviewText: Friendly staff and great amenities made our stay a most memorable one. There are a number of good places to eat within a couple of blocks. We will definately stay again at this awesome hotel. The only draw back is that this is supposed to be a non-smoking hotel but they allow smoking on the balcony and there were cigarette butts left there.

review.title: Just right for the weekend getaway.
review.reviewText: THe hotel is just right the weekend getaway, The begining of the cables cars are right downstairs, so you will be the first to get on. Its across the street from the ferry peir 1 just incase you need to use the bay for transportation,You can enjoy a great walk along others peirs, onto hte famous peir 39, Its a great hotel , right on the water, , I will stay there again, Thank you

review.title: I would stay here again; great service, helpful staff
review.reviewText: This hotel is somewhat dated, although they seem to be doing some upgrades to certain rooms. The service is fantastic, and it is extremely well located. Even the room service food was good, although hellishly expensive.

review.title: Our stay in The Hyatt
review.reviewText: I have always wanted to stay in the Hyatt to see the amazing atrium. The hotel itself is pretty good with the newly opened Regency Club a great boon as the view from the top is excellent and the breakfast and snacks well worth the extra cash. Also for those who don't travel with laptop having the use of a PC up there enabled us to do on-line check-in.

review.title: Good value for money
review.reviewText: This hotel is in an excellent location for the business district and harbour & markets. It is a good hotel but outside street noise is very apparent. If staying here I recommend asking for a higher level / floor to reduce the street noise. Otherwise this hotel is great value for money.

review.title: Not Impressed
review.reviewText: The hotel was in a good location, but I was not impressed with the room. The carpet was clearly worn and soiled which gave the room an unclean feel. The service was very good, however. If traveling to the area again, I would probably choose another hotel...

review.title: very satisfied
review.reviewText: My wife and I stayed Hyatt Regency San Francisco four days, and very much enjoyed. Only thing we could not enjoy was could not see ocean view.

review.title: Does not meet 4 star criteria
review.reviewText: The lobby of this hotel was beautiful however the rooms do not meet the standard of a 4 star hotel as this establishment was advertised. I found the room to be very basic with no special immeneties. The front desk also was not too helpful. The plus points included the view and the balcony. The atrium of the hotel is very nice and there also is a very nice gym. Good overal location in the city. However, in the furture if i was searching for a 4 star hotel, i would try another establishment

review.title: Awesome hotel with service!
review.reviewText: We had a perfect stay in this hotel for our 1st anniversary celebration in San Francisco and Hyatt Regency gave us a perfect memory!! The room is very clean and comfortable, especially the king size bed!! Soft and cozy!! The room has a very good bay view and we enjoyed a lot on the balcony! The staff was very helpful and polite! Hyatt has the best location for tourists! We love this Hyatt!!! We will definitely come back to this hotel soon!!!

review.title: Parking fee is a rip off
review.reviewText: Parking at the hotel was $48 plus tax. Big rip off.

review.title: Perfect Little Get-a-way
review.reviewText: A perfect location in San Francisco for a week end getaway!

review.title: can't wait to go back
review.reviewText: Good location to be able to walk into the city or along the quay. Really friendly & helpful staff. Comfortable, large rooms. Only disappointment was that there is no longer a bar overlooking the city.

review.title: Parking Charges
review.reviewText: The only unacceptable issue with this hotel is the price for parking. It is far too expensive. I have travelled on many continents and have never had to pay so much money for parking. It cost more for daily parking than the price to rent a full size SUV.

review.title: SAN FRAN BEST HOTEL.................
review.reviewText: Fantastic hotel, I would reccomend this hotel to anyone planning to stay near Fishermans Wharf. Approx 25mins walk from Fishermans Wharf, but great views to the bay and some great restuarants nearby and cable car stop outside hotel (Hyde St)and 15 min walk from Union Sq. Enjoy

review.title: Nickle and dimed
review.reviewText: From the moment we checked in at the front desk, I felt like everything had an associated cost from internet service to even opening the mini bar. A nice hotel, great location, but don't expect anything for free.

review.title: Awesome!
review.reviewText: The hotel had the most beautiful interior design. It's open and airy and has the most beautiful architecture design. Can't wait to stay there again!

review.title: Not impressed
review.reviewText: Came for a medical conference. Been to many around the country in the last several years. Never so disappointed in a hotel for the money. Traveled with a co-worker and we asked for rooms next to each other. Got that, but no view whatsoever! Looks like an indoor motel inside. Restaurant is really pricey! And the food is not impressive. Very dim lighting in the interior.

review.title: Location, Breakfast, and Room all 1st Rate
review.reviewText: We've stayed at a lot of hotels but the location here is great being a stones throw from pier 1 and all kinds of shops and food in the Embarcardero squares. Breakfast Buffet at Hyatt was excellent.

review.title: Always stay here when in San Francisco
review.reviewText: A great place to stay because you are accessible to everything. Situated on the Embarcadero you can use public transporation so easily to get any where in the city. If you love being near the water this is the place to stay. Hotel is up to date, clean,and friendly. All ammenties and services available.

review.title: great location!!
review.reviewText: clean, spacious, in a great location, walking distance to the water

review.title: Overlooked Hotel
review.reviewText: Rooms are quite large and very comfortable. Great windows and nice bed. Service was also good. Breakfast buffet is best around.

review.title: Would love to go again
review.reviewText: We enjoyed our stay at the Hyatt Regency on The Embarcadero. It is central to all the necessary mass transit - and with our City Passes we were able to get around easily without renting a car. We arrived on New Year's Eve and then asked if we could move to a bay side room. They were not able to accommodate us on this request until the next day, but as we were there for seven days, it was fine with us. The first room had several rug stains (still wet) which we at first couldn't figure out, but finally determined to be spilled cleaning fluid. Also we were missing amenities such as glasses, instructions to the mini-bar, but we figured since it was New Year's Eve, they were really busy and we were fine waiting til we got to our new room the next day anyway. The new room had everything just fine. Also, our request for replacing the down with hypoallergenic pillows (foam) was quickly accommodated on both room moves.

review.title: Very Neat Design of Hotel
review.reviewText: Hotel has a unique design. The only issue we had with this hotel was the water pressure wasn't quite strong and even though you are on the top floor, the noise of the traffic can easily be heard. If you are a light sleeper, you may want to reconsider.

review.title: very much impressed, excellent hotel
review.reviewText: Nice place , very central, clean and nice water front views. We were charged for room minibar drinks, which we did not take!! However I still recommend the hotel.

review.title: Very good....Will be back for sure.
review.reviewText: Very nice stay! Plenty of things to go without taking the car. It was just great!

review.title: Great Hotel, Great Location
review.reviewText: Our stay was an excellent one-day getaway

review.title: Very nice at Christmas time
review.reviewText: The hotel is always decorated beautifully at Christmas time. Very festive and they have some terrific displays in the lobby. Just outside is the ice skating rink that the city puts up every year. I was amazed however when I tried to order room service at 1am on a Friday night (Saturday morning) and was told that they were closed.

review.title: Awesome Atrium
review.reviewText: Excellent design. Great service. We were looking forward to dinning at the Equinox. We found out that the revolving restaurant at the top of the hotel had been discontinued.

review.title: Recommendable
review.reviewText: This is a nice hotel for its price. However Vallet parking is abit chaotic.(crowded)

review.title: Customer Service in Action
review.reviewText: After arriving about 1 am, they were very friendly and accommodating. With a 12 pm checkout, that gave us time to have a look around the markets at the Embarcadero & have breakfast. Fabulous location for the markets and not far from Union Square. They allowed us to store our luggage until our 6 pm flight so we could get more San Francisco in. Only regret for us is that we wanted to see more of SF while there and did not have enough time to sleep in on the comfortable beds!

review.title: The Hyatt holds it's own in a neighborhood of high class hotels!
review.reviewText: The Hyatt needs music and more places to lounge. But, I would come back!

review.title: Close To All Transportation
review.reviewText: This is a great spot for access to all the different types of transportation available in the city - cable car, BART, subway, bus and streetcar. However, if you want to be close to Fisherman's Wharf, this is not the hotel for you but it is very easy to get to on the streetcar. Ask for a room on the higher floors. We were on the 4th floor on the street with all the transit and it was a little noisy early in the morning. The room was very nice and roomy but I did find the bathroom a little average considering the level of hotel. Close to shopping area on Market Street. Very easy to get around from this location.

review.title: Fun in Frisco
review.reviewText: I definitely recommend the hotel, right from the start, you can take the BART From the Airport and it stops right in front of the Hotel. The Cable car also stops right there and you can take the buses to nearby shops and to the water. It's about a 5 minute cab ride to Union square. Room was nice size and very clean and quiet. 3-4 people in the room comforably.

review.title: WOW - That word describes all. The best place I have stayed at.
review.reviewText: Great place to stay at. The king size bedrooms face the Bay bridge. Great view. The double faces the city. The only down side is that everything closes at 12 midnight. Not the best place if you want to extend some fun beyond that time. Friendly and helpful staff. Very close to Ferry building. And walkable distance to Pier 39.

review.title: Alcatraz
review.reviewText: Very satisfied, Very comfortable beds. Close to the warf, pier 39, ferry marketplace, cable cars, Pac Bell park and the boat ride to Alcatraz
Best location

review.title: Nice hotel noisy rooms
review.reviewText: The hotel is really nice but it was really noisy as well with musinc in Market street from 10am to 8pm as well as some vents that went on loudly from 2am to 4am on one night

review.title: Excellent Location - Lovely Hotel - Not 4 Star
review.reviewText: Stayed 5 nights at the Hyatt Embarcadero for a girl's week away.Excellent location,stunning views of the bay bridge. The atrium is a must see. The hotel is steps away from a cable car line with the Ferry building directly across. Small shops, wine bar and restaurants abound as well as the farmer's market 2x a week. Very safe area. Staff very helpful. Why not 4 stars for a Hyatt on the waterfront? No cpurtesy shuttle from the airport No Pool/ No Hot Tub Fees for internet access No Robes in room (must call down)

review.title: standard fare
review.reviewText: hotel is what you expect from a hyatt, standard 4 star quality and service, great location if you are looking to be in downtown, if you don't mind walking it is w/in 2 miles of everything touristy, bart stop is at the front door, parking at $55 every 24 hours is outrageous by any measure, if they are not offering cut rates any of the nearby competitors are just as good.

review.title: Beautiful Hotel
review.reviewText: A great hotel, visually impressive and clean. An inventively composed atrium.

review.title: Greart Hotel
review.reviewText: Although I was initially disappointed to learn that the Equinox at the top of the hotel had closed, I did find the other restaurant and bar facilities to be excellent. Service was excellent and it's within walking distance of AT&T Park!

review.title: Wonderful Cityscape
review.reviewText: This is a truly beautiful hotel. It is a four star hotel, which makes you feel special just staying there as a guest. It is very luxurious. The view from the 12th floor, toward the city, was awesome. The windows open, so you can hear and feel the city around you. We looked out at may skyscrapers, with a clear view of the Transamerica Pyramid. We had a great time, and highly recommend this hotel. The City is great to explore, go to a play, see Pier 39, see a movie, eat in restaurants, shop, walk, and take public trasportation. Leaving a car at the Bart station, and taking a Bart train into the city saved us lots of money on parking fees. It was a real fun experience for adults and children.

review.title: great hotel
review.reviewText: great hotel, awesome location, valet parking at $51 dollars a day ridiculous

review.title: Good, but over rated and over priced
review.reviewText: This is a good 3 star hotel. The problem is that it is rated, and priced, as a 4 star hotel. We would not stay there again since we do not feel we got our money's worth. Good points: Location, clean Bad points: No complimentary perks to go with the price. Everything had a charge on it. One complaint: After an unusual 90 degree day in SF, the air conditioning could not keep up. We had to sleep with the balcony door open.

review.title: Huge but quiet
review.reviewText: Had an enjoyable stay at this hotel. Valet parking is overpriced but where isn't it in an SF hotel?

review.title: Great Service
review.reviewText: I am glad I had this Hotel...the staff is excellent and very friendly....They will do anything to make your stay happier and great.

review.title: A room with a view - fantastic!
review.reviewText: Front desk staff really helpful. Able to use room from lunchtime. Extremely comfortable room - King size bed with piles of pillows. Balcony overlooking San Francisco bay. Bathroom small but adequate.

review.title: Limited Hospitality Services.
review.reviewText: Great location within walking distance of just about everything one wishes to visit in the City for both business and pleasure. Located on the flat near the bay edge, it is conveniently positioned for our daily run and for walking to all of our favorite restaurants and shops. Architecture is sparce and dated making it seemingly impossible to renovate the facility up to the new standards readily found in other hotels. It's all atruim and no services. No spa, no pool, minimal (but adequate) workout room, no quick coffee shop, no incedential shop - and no space to include them if they wished. Avoid the rooms on the Market Street side. Street performers and the cable cars make them extremely noisy. Rooms are small, yet comfortable, but in need of a reno. Front desk staff and management were great fulfilling all of our spacial requests. Housekeeping services were great as well.

review.title: Very nice SF hotel
review.reviewText: It all depends upon your taste, but for a big hotel, this quite nice. I wouldn't describe it as luxurious, i.e. overdone. It's just a really nice place to stay. Most impressive was my room, the comforter/weight of covers, view with balcony, and size. Really, it's quite nice. The location also worked for me b/c my office was nearby. SF has renovated the Ferry Building in the last 5 years, and it's now this very lovely shopping area. There's also a farmers market in this area on the weekends.

review.title: It's Still the Greatest!
review.reviewText: I first stayed at this hotel in 1980 and was overwhelmed by it's spectacular atrium lobby. The hotel has not changed one bit in 26 years. It still looks like it did the day it opened. Of course the rooms have been refurbed over the years so they are up to date. The location is wonderful. It is right on Market St.in the financial district adjacent to the ferry terminal. Almost every room has a bay view and many have a great view of the bay bridge. The California St. cable car line ends right at the front door and the BART and Muni stations are right downstairs so you can get anywhere in the city easily. Since BART serves SFO and Oakland airports it is a zip to get to the Hyatt inexpensively. The service is always freindly and helpful. The Hyatt Regency is always on the top of my list when it comes to San Francisco.

review.title: Not a good place to stay!!!
review.reviewText: STAY AWAY!!!

review.title: hotel at the holidays
review.reviewText: It was decorated beautifuly and a joy to be at.

review.title: Good hotel
review.reviewText: But No Parking is very bad.

review.title: Enjoyed every minute
review.reviewText: Exceptional all around. Next to every transportation available in the city. Great views, great eats, yet just far enough away from all the noise and traffic.

review.title: Not bad / Not Great
review.reviewText: This hotel is better for a business stay if your business or convention is at or near the hotel. The only truly good thing for the leisure traveler is the location. But, since SF is such a "small" (area) City, there are lot's of hotels with good locations for pedestrian trips. It's clean, quiet, and mostly modern. Bathrooms are small, Furniture was sparce; our room only had one worn-out chair in the corner. Room service was prompt. Restaurant and bar were adequate. But in a city like SF who wants to eat or drink at a hotel anyway??

review.title: Fine Hotel for Business Trip.
review.reviewText: If you have business in the Embarcadero area, this is the place to stay. It's standard fare for a Hyatt -- not much personality, but the staff is courteous and professional, the rooms clean, and the views of the Bay Bridge (from the right rooms) very nice. Not a hotel for a romantic getaway, but for the business traveler or conventioneer, it serves its purposes well.

review.title: great location with a few quirks
review.reviewText: This hotel is in a terrific location to embark on the Muni about San Francisco. You can catch a dozen different buses, cable cars and the Bart right outside the building's entrance. It's also right across the street from the Ferry Building, a destination in itself. The front desk personnel were very gracious, the Bellhops only slight less so. The rooms had a few quirks. If you choose a room facing east, expect to be awoken by the morning bells of the Ferry Building from 8 o'clock on. We moved to the west side and that solved the problem. We couldn't get our rooms HVAC right; it was either too hot or too cool. Also, the toilet ran until we shaked the handle. Other than these minor complaints, we truly enjoyed our stay and would stay at the Regency again.

review.title: Impressive architecture, breathtaking atrium, rooms need update
review.reviewText: We stayed at the Hyatt Regency SF for two nights on a family mini-vacation. The soaring atrium is truly breathtaking, as are the views of the Bay. Our upgrade included a lovely continental breakfast and late-lunch. With the upgrade you get a room on one of the top two floors, so the views of the city and bay are spectacular. My only gripe was the condition of our room. The the fabric on the club chair was old, thin, worn and torn in several places. There was shmutz on the bed skirt. The wallpaper in the bathroom was old and cracked. The room was clean, but didn't feel like an expensive upscale hotel room. The bathroom was decidedly low-scale. I would return to the Hyatt to dine, but not for another overnighter.

review.title: Restful
review.reviewText: OK, but maintenance turned off the water for several hours with no estimate on when it would be restored.

review.title: Beautiful San Francisco Bay View
review.reviewText: This is truly a five-star hotel. Our only down-check was that we were not aware that vehicle parking was not included in our nightly rate. The parking (valet) was serviced as you would expect from a five-star hotel. However, the fees were a bit excessive. If you will have a vehicle during your stay, check out what the additional cost will be. Overall, we were very satisfied.

review.title: Very relaxing!
review.reviewText: The first thing I look for in a great hotel is the quality of sleep I will receive. This was one of the best! The comfort was wonderful. The rooms were clean and well taken care of. The service was exactly what you would expect from a hotel in a major city. I enjoyed being downtown and only a short walk to so many attractions. I would recommend this hotel for business travel or a leisure vacation.

review.title: Nice experience
review.reviewText: The hotel was a very pleasurable experience. The staff is friendly and very helpful. I would recommend not eating in the hotel restaurant to often as it will put a dent in your wallet.

review.title: What a view!!!
review.reviewText: Pay the extra and stay in the room w/balcony & view. Awesome! Clean, contempoary, quiet, comfortable. Great service. $10 Taxi ride to Giants ballpark, walked back to hotel 1.5m. Streets felt safe at night. Must see the revolving restaurant on top. The Margaritas are GOOD $10. Hi-pressure shower heads, yea!Wonderful sleep!The view, the view, the view!!! Inside and out this is an "Architectural Icon" not to be missed.

review.title: Can't wait to go back
review.reviewText: Room was basically clean. I found areas around the telephone to not be clean.

review.title: Wait! Think about the Hyatt!!!!!!!!!
review.reviewText: Clean, great bed, great travel assistance, trolley right out the door/ busses also. Use the hotel limo service to and from the airport...no other people to share space with and about the same cost.

review.title: San Francisco At It's Finest
review.reviewText: Only the Hyatt Embarcadero can put you at the center of everything a visitor could want to do, especially if you don't rent a car. The cable car, BART, and the actual sites themselves are just a short walk away

review.title: Good for location, not for being special
review.reviewText: The Hyatt is an okay hotel in a good location. It isn't special, and there are absolutely NO free rides. Unlike other high price hotels, the Hyatt doesn't give you any nice free perks. But, that said, the Hyatt provides a nice clean room with a good view and good location. The BART stop is just out front, as well as the excellent Peir One (home of the farmer's market and some excellent restaurants.) A cable-car line also starts just in fron of the Hyatt. Overall, not a bad place, but I'm not sure I'd stay there again.

review.title: will stay there again
review.reviewText: it was the weekend my boyfriend popped the question and proposed to me... our stay at the hotel really made it so memorable --- our room had a view of the Port of San Francisco, it was very clean, check-in, check out was a breeze, 13-views Bar, the entire Atrium level was a real feast to the eyes.

review.title: Best location on waterfront
review.reviewText: The Hyatt Regency San Francisco is a beautiful, quiet and comfortable hotel at the foot of Market Street. It is directly across from the most fun place in SF...the new restored Ferry Building. You can also walk to the baseball park along the attractive Embarcadero in about 15 minutes. Just a great spot for downtown and the waterfront!

review.title: Nice Hotel - Excellent Location
review.reviewText: Walking distance to almost everything.

review.title: Worth the money
review.reviewText: Elegant lobby/atrium. Room was very clean and spacious. Definitely meets expectations of a 4-star hotel.

review.title: Perfect
review.reviewText: First time in SF and this hotel was perfect. Reasonably priced and in a greta location. They upgraded us to a bay view room without prompting. It's in a great spot for dining, shopping and getting to local attractions. Very pleased with our stay.

review.title: Great Location
review.reviewText: This is a nice Hotel long over due for a major remodel. The heat didn't work (it was very cold) and the bed was old but the service is very good and it is central to everything. I wish they would bring back the parrots in the lobby and the real hanging vines. The fake vines are tacky. A nice place to stay but over priced considering the dated look.

review.title: Nice Hotel
review.reviewText: Overall this was a nice hotel. The rooms were a little small but comfortable. The restroom was small, and the towels were a little worn, but it was overall a nice place to stay. Also while this is in the financial district it is a ways from some of the downtown attractions. Of course you can always walk if the weather's nice.

review.title: Great San Francisco Location
review.reviewText: If you want a hotel in San Francisco where you clearly do not need a rental car, this is the place. This Hyatt is adjacent to the BART Embarcadero stop, the California-line cable car, the F Line street car that goes to the wharf, the N Line to the baseball park, or several Muni bus options.

review.title: hyatt S.F.
review.reviewText: I expected cleaner rooms from a Hyatt. The room had thick dust around the edge of the whole room, and had cigarette butts on balcony of a non-smoking room.

review.title: I love this hotel!!
review.reviewText: Well, let's start with the downside!! The bed wasn't comfortable and the pillows are flat. I have no problem since I brought my travel pillow with me. But other then that, everything is great and wonderful! Staff are very friendly and helpful. Maid service were great! The food in the hotel just simple. But if you are lazy to get out, Room service is not that bad, the food is from their restaurants, we order the Breakfast from the room service and it was wonderful. We will go back to this Hotel again!! This hotel right next to the ferry building, one of the must go place when you visit SF. Why? the Restaurants inside the ferry building are great. Yes, the price maybe a little higher, but the food was great.

review.title: Great location
review.reviewText: Everything was fine, but we had a few small complaints. One is their use of fluorescent lightbulbs, which gave a harsh, cold light and made us feel like we were staying in a kitchen. The other was the charges for local calls. This seems picky, given the price of the room. The location was great-- right next to the BART station and streetcars. We didn't need to rent a car.

review.title: A good place to stay!
review.reviewText: The hotel is accessible to transportation and center for alot of attractions.

review.title: excellent location
review.reviewText: a good choice

review.title: Very good experience
review.reviewText: My new wife and I spent a week in San Francisco, and for tourists, this hotel was wonderful. The hotel looked amazing inside and out, and our room was comfortable and roomy. The location is within a quick trolley ride of fishermans wharf, union square, and nearly every San Fran attraction. We had a little trouble with getting fresh glasses daily, and it costs $10 to empty the mini-bar for fridge use (per stay), but that doesn't add up to much.

review.title: Not a king bed
review.reviewText: I requested a king bed and got a double and the service in their lobby cafe was not at all good. had to wait to be seated, slow to take order and refill beverages.

review.title: Fantastic central location!
review.reviewText: Very helpful and courteous bell hops. The front staff could use a little warmth. Would return to this hotel simply because it was clean, easy to use public transportation to and from, and had all the necessary amenities.

review.title: Hard beds and cigar smells
review.reviewText: The beds mattress surface was hard but with no support. Had to take Advil in the morning because of aching back. The room smelled awful from cigar or smoke of some sort but no one even bothered to get back to us. And to charge $10 to give you space in the mini bar refrigerator for a nice bottle of California wine was just unreasonable.

review.title: Hyatt Regency - San Francisco - Great Place to Stay
review.reviewText: The Hyatt Regency - San Francisco is a GREAT place to stay. Right downtown in the middle of all the action. Easy access to all the tourist sites including the wharfs/piers/cable cars/great restaurants/etc. Stops for cable cars (California street) / muni / bart right outside the hotel. Highly recommended . . .

review.title: not worth it
review.reviewText: The electronic locks failed we were unable to enter our room for a good while. The staff were polite but downgraded us to a room not nearly as nice. Thereafter they seemed to not know what room we were in. Difficult for outside callers to reach me, no morning paper. Unaccomodating for a late checkout. The hotel building is beautiful, but I will never stay there again and would urge my friends to look elsewhere.

review.title: Excellent Location
review.reviewText: We stayed here for 8 days. The room was great and overlooked the city. Get a room on the 12th floor or higher, because there could be alittle traffic noise on floors 4-7. The staff very accomodating and filled our requests without hesitation. We used the BART to/from the airport, and hotel right there, us the Drumm St. exit. when you get off the train. The bathroom area is small, but i've seen the type setup in many hotels. Would stay here again.

review.title: Hyatt Regency -San Francisco
review.reviewText: Great

review.title: The value is the view...
review.reviewText: Hotel is massive and fits the traditional Hyatt persona. Decor is dated and carpet is in need of replacing along with needing an updated style. This Hyatt is ideal for business, but lacks character for vacationers. Valet is good and $40 a day isn't too shabby. Request a bay view room for a breath taking view, but other than the view it isn't worth the price and should only have 3 stars.

review.title: Very nice for the SF Experience
review.reviewText: We were so impressed that we could step right off BART and look directly at the hotel. They were very accomodating with giving us a "good view" for our fun weekend - the bay was beautiful to look at! There are so many things to do and it's so easy to get around. The room was clean, the lobby was beautiful, and the staff were so helpful.

review.title: A good location in a good city
review.reviewText: Spent 4 nights here, one of the major pluses was the fact that you are almost right on top of Market street, and the Embarcadero, which allow you to move from east to west and up to Fisherman's Wharf pretty easily, and gets you access to the electric streecars, Cable car (the California line starts right outside the door), the muni, and the Bart, which we recommend to take in from the airport (otherwise, you're dropping $40.00 for a taxi and $30.00 for a shuttle) Now the hotel...the atrium is spectacular! and it's very clean, however...the bathrooms, for what you're paying are quite small (I'm 5'6" and I was surprised at how small the bathrooms were). the main room is roomy, and I liked the desk with office chair combo. the way the hotel is configured, depending on where you room is, you may have to walk a ways to get ice, since there was only one machine per floor. The concierge was very helpful and knowledgeable (of course, that is their job, but I digress),and along with a good map, you won't have any trouble getting around. I would recommend the hotel strictly on the location alone, but it has something about it that we enjoyed!

review.title: Awesome!
review.reviewText: Hyatt was goregeous. It may look kinda dinky in a way, but when ur insode, it's beautiful. I would really go back when I get the chance. However,it is a bit pricy.

review.title: Poor Elevator Service
review.reviewText: While this hotel is ideally located in the heart of the Embarcadero, overall I was disappointed. The room was extremely noisy due to the fan system right outside our room. The elevator system is attrocious. For 802 rooms, there are only 3 elevators! We had to wait inordinate amounts of time for an available elevator car to leave our floor, and the stairwells are available for exiting only!

review.title: Great Place
review.reviewText: The hotel was great, but parking was to expensive.

review.title: Top Notch!
review.reviewText: We were extremely satisfied with our stay, from the moment the valet took our rental car , to the kindness and extreme helpfulness of the entire staff. The interior atrium was breathtaking, and the view from our balcony of the bay was overwhelming. Very close to everything. A "must stay" in San Francisco!

review.title: Very nice
review.reviewText: The Hyatt was a great value for San Francisco. The appearence was very impressive, clean, and we had a beautiful view of the bay. The location was good, close to Hwy 80 and the pier.

review.title: Five Star Hotel
review.reviewText: It is located on the corner of Market Street and entrance of Fisherman's Wharf. It was convenient that they have a Walgreen & Starbucks Coffee cross the street. Take F surface street car from Tourist Center. Gigantic hotel and even though you are a cheap traveller, you feel like you are the king and queen of the world.

review.title: loved it!
review.reviewText: can't wait to stay & play again! great location & well worth the extra penny :)

review.title: The Beds were the most uncomfortable ever!
review.reviewText: Their consierge service was not very informative. They also sent me to a restaurant that was closed. THey did not bother to call the restaurant to make a reservation for me.

review.title: excellent
review.reviewText: This was an awesome hotel. The architecture was magnificent and we had a very nice relaxing time.

review.title: Poor maintenance, carpet poor, ceiling tiles falling, in rooms.
review.reviewText: The design of the hotel is beautiful however the maintenance is very poor. We got a top end room overlooking the bay and Transamerica Pyramid. The carpet in the room was bubbled at the front of the bed and dirty worn tracks was evident throughout the hotel. The ceilingtiles in the room was loose and either falling from the joints or loose. The service attitude of the staff was wonderful. Equinox restaurant on top of building is way over priced. Coffe pot in room was full of hair and dust in resevoir. Only stay if you get a good deal on a room.

review.title: Convenient but pricey
review.reviewText: Staff was good and competent, location is very good, right across from SF's Ferry Terminal, and the building and room moderately attractive; the room was pretty ordinary. Definitely pricey, the valet (only available...) parking is $45/day. Without a car, getting around should be easy in the city - lots of public transportation right at the door. The revolving restaurant "Equinox" is pretty good, the breakfast buffet too expensive. All the plants in the atrium are fake; it's too dark for real ones.

review.title: Location, location, location...
review.reviewText: Location is key - on the Embarcadero right across from the Ferry Terminal for the Farmer's Market; walking distance to the Wharf, Union Square, Chinatown, SOMA; BART and MUNI connections practically at your doorstep. Atrium/lobby still beautiful and impressive. Rooms are comfortable but dated and showing some signs of wear. Was kindly upgraded to a Concierge Level floor upon check-in as I stated I was not particular to a City or bay view. Found the value when booked with a flight very good - would stay here again.

review.title: Very Highly Recommended!!!!!!!!
review.reviewText: I was extremely impressed with everything about the hotel: the location, the atmosphere, the staff, the service, the food, you name it. It was very, very nice. All of my food orders and requests for extra towels, stationery, or any other questions posed to the staff were responded to in a very timely and efficient manner. I felt that the service was very personalized. I plan on visiting San Francisco again in August. I am definitely going to book this hotel again. Highly, highly, recommended!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!

review.title: Quiet and relaxing
review.reviewText: The Hyatt Regency is a wonderful hotel to stay at in San Francisco.  We were close to everything, the Wharf, the Ferry Building, Ballpark, etc.  The hotel was quiet, the room very comfortable and we especially enjoyed having the sliding doors open to the Bay Bridge and Pier.

review.title: Great hotel
review.reviewText: I've stayed at this Hyatt several times over the past three years and highly recommend it.  Its a beautiful facility near Embarcadero, BART and MUNI.  Its not the usual tourist hotel, so you avoid that crowd.  There are several very good restaurants within an easy walking distance.  The recently remodeled Ferry Terminal is across the street.

review.title: Great Trip!!!
review.reviewText: Went for East-West Shrine Game.  BART and Cable Car were just across the street.  Very centrally located to everything we wanted to do and see.  Very helpful getting taxi and recommending restaurants.

review.title: To Die For
review.reviewText: It was stunning!  The service was excellent.  The food was delicious.

review.title: Nice location
review.reviewText: The hotel was beautiful, with easy access to many of San Francisco's high points.
